O7CymoJ57sKGiAXhTgEHZQ.text: I have been going the Slater's 50/50 in Huntington Beach since I can remember. I liked that they had unique burgers like the PB& Jealousy... but I loved their option to build and name your own burger. Being the picky person that I am, it's great to be able to customize something just the way you like it. They were also one of the first burger joints I had been to that offered gluten-free buns. The atmosphere of the Huntington Beach location was great, they are in a massive stand-alone building and their bar had its own room (in the middle of the restaurant) and was always packed. The customer service was amazing and the food was literally always perfect. When I heard that Slater's 50/50 was opening in Vegas, I couldn't wait to go and take my BF who had never been to one before. When we arrived I was underwhelmed with space, it was not a stand-alone building and had a completely different vibe from the other locations. When we went to sit down our server did not ask if we've been here before and did not offer the custom menu, I had to ask and almost didn't because I had assumed they didn't offer it here. When I asked about a few menu items on the custom menu that weren't there like they used to be she had a lack-luster response without a resolve. I know you carry these items, is it extra? Is there anything you can do? My BF ordered a triple Wagu build your own and I built up a chicken burger. When the burgers arrived, his Wagu was only a double. We wanted to say something but say for so long before anyone came by he just decided to eat it. When he bit in, it was well done (like the burgers you get at a friends BBQ that were purchased in bulk. It was tough and super dry.  We waited for a little longer and said forget it shes not coming back. Halfway into the burger she finally checks in and we share the problem with her. He explains that he didn't want to wait as he was on a fast. She again lack-luster responded without a solution. I understand he ate half of the burger, but to actually be sorry is one thing vs shrugging it off like oh well. Same goes for the fact he ordered a triple and got a double. My chicken burger came on a gluten-free bun, the bun was not toasted and was literally cold in the center as if it wasn't even warmed. The chicken was room temp and the pineapple was cold. Biting into a cold chicken burger is never fun when you're expecting a hot burger. The fries were cold as well, most of which were undercooked and still hard in the center but soggy on the outside, it was a strange experience. When we got the bill we were surprised to pay $65 for two terrible burgers and a shake. The Wagu (they have a 24 karat burger that is gold dusted bun and bacon with truffle cheese). When we asked about the bill it was a candid response but it was the first time she actually cared to bend down and seemed to want to help us. We did have to push to speak with a manager about the experience. Thankfully he had some resolve to the situation but was short and frankly rude about it. The entire staff was messing around right behind our heads in the kitchen the entire time and were making fun of each other, customers and telling people to put their phones away. Although the manager did apologize and attempted to make things right with a discount, that's not what we wanted. A True and honest we will make sure this never happens again or asking how they could make it right with genuineness is all we wanted. The right staff can make or break a restaurant or franchise, and unfortunately, because of this experience, I don't ever see us coming back.

The french fries were cold and soggy. One burger had to much thousand island dressing and the other had a squeeze. I was hoping to give this place an awesome review, but I just can't. The food quality and service makes me not ever wanting to go back to that location. I will hold out until the next time I'm in California.

7O86i5Ru49fpPGR-EUStcA.text: I ordered a 50/50 slider and they gave sloppie joe slider, i didn't want to be rude and send it back plus the waiter never asked me how was my food but asked the guys on the other side of the table how was the food. I was in a table with 5 other guys and both of our waiters were kind of neglecting me when I asked for water or any questions about the menu and made me feel they just wanted my order so they could put it in. I've been to the 50/50 in California, and they were a lot friendlier there the first time and last time I went that's why We went to the one in Vegas but we'll see if I come back to this location again

llYyJC1kUk-hU8Ar25M5Sw.text: We ordered the bacon burger it was great!! The French fries were cooked just perfect.  Thank you Tarek

8O5DHWv2MZKYOJWk7tWIzg.text: We went in tonight for our second time. The one star is strictly for the service. The food is good, no argument. However, the staff are severely disappointing. Our first time there was about 2 weeks ago. The restaurant was maybe a quarter full, we were sat rather quickly but that was the extent of it. The waitress was slow to take orders and was very inattentive throughout. The staff in general was very disconnected from the customers. The only redeeming factor from the experience was the sweet potato fries. We figured it was the exception for the atmosphere, not the rule. So we decided to go back and try again tonight.  We arrived a little after 2100 hours. The restaurant was not busy and the hostess was nowhere to be found. The bartender, standing 10 feet away completely ignored us, as well as the kitchen staff and a waitress. We waited a few minutes to see if anyone would address us, and no one did, so we walked out. We won't be returning.

aa9dyk32A0Li4rOHfvzQKA.text: I had never been to Slater's until recently. Where in the heck have I been. Can't believe that I've been missing out on this. In fact, I have already returned for round #2 with my family. I had the  same FANTASTIC waitress "Chloe" both times. WOW, she'll get you excited about eating and trying new items. First time there, I shared a plate with my friend and it just wan't enough. The second time I got my own plate and damn, that was a whole lot of food! The Modelo draft helped wash it down though. LOL. Thursday night football was on, so we had entertainment. Also started talking with neighbor customers and had a great time.  Slaters is just a down to earth fun place with lots of creative foods and good people. I tried the BBB Burger first and this time the Lone Star Smoke burger. Also, sweet potato fries with pumpkin sauce. Fantastic!  The best damn bacon burger and the loaded chili-cheese fries were AMAZING !!  More Modelo!  Ha-Ha. Love this place!!

VLyNiocckzOSDSxVzwGy_g.text: Food was awesome and service was great and friendly. Will definitely go back and would definitely recommend this place. Our server Lisa was super nice and very on top of it!

XLlZDpko0ClBnqlc0U3ykA.text: They have excellent customer service! The manager came over to introduce himself and made some recommendations for us to try next time as well. The bacon Mac and Cheese balls are a MUST get, sooo good! Their bacon Bloody Mary was also very tasty, you could definitely taste the alcohol. The burgers were great, my husband loved the wings and beer also. The only reason I didn't hit 5 starts we're the kids meals. The kids pizza is not really pizza and tastes more like a spaghetti or ravioli, not bad but definitely not a pizza. And the kids chicken fingers could use something different, maybe it was time to change the oil? Overall very happy and we will be back again.

xknSgZ5oxhDy6M3GCoKPFQ.text: We had the fried Brussel sprouts app and 2 burgers with fries.  We both chose the hi brow burger based on description, pictures and recommendation of our server Alex.  Alex also suggested we upgrade to the bison patty.  Skeptical, we opted for one of each and had them cut in half.  Both were out of this world, but the Bison was a tad better.  Fries were great, slatherings were great (ordered on the side for fear of making my fries soggy) all in all it was a-lot of food for 2 people.  If you're unsure what to get, I would opt for the hi brow burger with the upgrade to the bison Patty.  For beverages I had some brand of porter I had never heard of.  I sampled the nitro peanut butter porter and it was very good.  Opted for an entire pint of it.  I wish I could've had another but I had to catch a flight back to Detroit. If we come back to Vegas soon we will be sure to hit this establishment again.  Kudos to my wife for finding it as we were driving to the airport.

GRzhgsGRDfLKV-E65IheDg.text: I got the wrong food. The other person I was with didn't get there food. My drink was wrong. Nit great once I got the food. I was there 3 hours with only one other table

YFKEeQAYg-4knFXwjl-7Ug.text: Loved their burgers! Damn thing melted in my mouth. One of the best burgers in town. Hands down! Loved the decor and the bar. Definitely that rustic bar! The staff is so friendly. Customer service is on point. Will recommend to everyone.

Bh36bEB5jfznBmR2C8-_iw.text: This was my third visit here. First time had the Vampire dip. OMG you could spread this on your arm and eat it. Second time had the Sloppy Joe Sliders..again awesome sweet yet spicy. Tonight was my birthday we had an awesome time mostly because of Feddie the great bartender/waiter. He was on point friendly a d funny. Be back soon! Oh and my birthday samore shake was over the top!

qyzx-cs9k1yJP5gQpGkFOQ.text: Extremely underwhelming.  I was excited because the server sounded really excited when he described the 50/50 Burger. However, it was nothing special. When I received my Burger, the over easy eggs was already popped. I'm guessing the Burger had been ready for awhile because neither the bun nor patty were hot. The yolk had dripped out and was soaked up by the spongey bun. The bun was so wet from the yolk and the sauce in the burger, the bun fell apart. When I called the server over and asked for a new bottom bun, he said, " the bun is all soaked with the yolk, right? He knew what the problem was and served it to me like that anyway? And then he was visibly annoyed with me. Also, the fries were nothing special. They tasted like fries from Wendy's.

LG5MGAPiJh78NOaVuuts-g.text: OMG, the food was amazing as well as Nicole and David!!!! This will be my new favorite place!!!!! And with 50 beers on tap, I'm going to have to come back to try them all!!!! Love the idea of having games at the place as well. Can't wait to attend the beer tastings they have!!! Will be there on a regular!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Slater's 50/50 - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pork belly grilled cheese!!!!  Yummmmmy!!!! Nicole and David were awesome!!!! 1st time and the hospitality was great!!! Will be back!!!!

yW_Zhy8bvEj58FRoXRhkhQ.text: We've always enjoyed the food here' However, tonight was EXTRA amazing because we got to have Freddie as our server/bartender! My husband and I enjoyed eating at the bar, but we have recently stopped drinking alcohol. He was so sweet (and very creative!) to make me a couple mocktails! He went above and beyond to make our little dinner date perfect! Thanks, Freddie!

C-YAQnRetuHLmB0gBKKJ3A.text: You're welcome with a bright feel. Hints of yellow dash your eyes.... and the aroma.... bacon. Welcome to slaters 50/50.  I was brought here by a few friends who had tried the place beforehand. We were seated immediately. This was after olympia weekend so I needed the extra calories for recovery. Monta ramen wasnt enough so I came for the burgers an hour later LOL.  Service was friendly. Water was refilled at a very reasonable rate. No complaints and their witty banter was very appreciated. Ups here.  As for our orders. The dip... the vampire dip... amazeballs. Creamy, aromatic, heavy, wonderful. Not much to say.  The burger, however, wasnt as expected. Dont get me wrong, I loved it. It's just that the 50/50 patty had a texture that made it more like a pulled pork sandwich, so as a burger fiend, I wasnt 100% satisfied, but as a guy who came out doing an ass ton of reps it was dope.  Will eat again. Very curious about the all beef patty!!!!

hxx5tWMH6oWcOltii3xDfg.text: I love this place!! Great food, beer selection and service!! I think I found my new favorite spot! The TV screens are great also.

photos.caption: Photo of Slater's 50/50 - Las Vegas, NV, United States. This place is awesome!! Great food and service !!

7EEmaLDzWTf6-6NafZM0jA.text: Had a burger from here a little while ago. They are tasty. Someone decided to put ice cream on a hamburger and it tastes good lol

RLJCD0gSxUm6FoLD7NQcgw.text: Slater's WAS my football spot because of the atmosphere.   The manager and bartender were fantastic so we continued to meet here and brought along several friends.  My bartender was fired with NO warning for staying over to serve us and close our our over $400 tab!  I will not be back!  I'm very sad the manager did not have her back.

Xyb1hUmyOooOH0aGb2ujOQ.text: First time at this place. Atmosphere is nice Variety of beers. Burgers were on point! Sampled everybody's burgers and delish! Service was friendly and knowledgeable! Great personality, Gabriela! She was wonderful! Definitely, have to try. We will be back! Only thing if I had to comment on is the shakes need to be thicker and the fries crispier.

9OQUeqapoftf3ZQEwKQJKg.text: Went here because it was suggested as a romantic restaurant. First of all it definitely is not. Tables are too close together, it's loud. It really wasn't the scene we were looking for. We almost turned around and left.  We decided to stay, and ordered the chips and dip for an appetizer, I ordered the bison and bacon and he ordered the best dam bacon cheeseburger. Service was friendly and fast. The food was not what it was hyped up to be. The cheese sauce in the chips and dip tasted like nacho cheese out of a can with beer added. My bison burger was pretty good I liked the bacon jalapeno jam. The best dam bacon cheeseburger was mediocre. It wasn't special in anyway and we were not impressed.   This is fine for lunch or dinner with the kids or something but it felt more like a bacon themed chachkies then a "hot and new romantic restaurant".

r2CavebU8pI2mSJaKgKcmg.text: The vampire dip and Best Damn Bacon Cheeseburger was delicious! I didn't care for the bacon ketchup but overall two thumbs up.  The selection of beer was huge and they offer samples to try which was nice.  We will definitely be going back.

BmrhoFYKOgDv_pWaY8Uu8w.text: Ate here the other day, nice clean place. Ordered Mac n cheese balls that rocked Then the BBB burger, a little undercooked but tasty Would love it on an onion bun. I will be back and You should try it. A little pricey compared to other gourmet burger joints but try it anyway

Cr2GvkFMWjPkxVVyJR4o0Q.text: Even though I'm not a bacon eater or a beer drinker, I loved this place! You can tell everything is made in house, and the staff is super helpful and friendly. I even saw the manager go table to table, asking customers how everything was. We need more places like this! I definitely want to go back and try more!

O3xpmwGMM-sra-J-D3M70Q.text: The reviews are spot on great choice of Beer add the best burger I have had in Vegas along with Bacon at every choice.The icing on the cake is Tarek our waiter made the entires experience awesome make sure to ask for Takek.Cant wait to come back tomorrow! Keith

Kat is an AWESOME bartender knowledgeable abt the menu & makes some mean drinks. David was very warm & welcoming. Walking around chatting it up with all the customers. Now I gotta go bk with the hubby. Wish there was a Slater's in North Las Vegas

LgT1yx6jzVG4M-lTHYSUiw.text: Think I just a not so good experience. 1st if you don't like spicy don't come here. Every thing is spicy! Who heard of spicy spagettii? Or Spicy Cobb salad? Didn't have a burger, which is their main menu item, next to all draft beer. But I would make sure they don't have spicy sauce etc on the burger.  Had to wait 15 minutes, before being approach by our server, probably because she is the bartender too, and probably why she was a blur running back and forth.  Still the food is fresh and we'll made. The manager approached the table without us asking to see how we are doing. When I let him know I wasn't expecting a spicy Cobb salad, he immediately offered to replace it. I didn't accept, because I didn't have an appetite, but the offer was sincere. So maybe just more bad luck on our 1st trip, we'll see.

Vd4y1ushPqUjhX6Ln8VYdg.text: Amazing service,  great food. I vouch for the Bison burger.  My wife loves the rosemary Turkey burger.  Make sure to get the garlic fries! Freddie gives great service and makes a killer cinnamon toast crunch shot that will make you feel loose!

I had a 16.99 burger with onion rings bringing plate total to 18.99 and just was a $20 plate. will be back for beer and one of those amazing looking desserts!

flgZttrngEJ-gFV2UginmA.text: In town for work and looking for a non-gaming place and came across Slaters on Yelp. Based on some reviews went to check it out. Was welcomed as soon as I walked in by bartender Kat. I travel frequently for work and have seen and experienced it all. Kat was as professional and courteous as a lady can be. Gave me the lay of the land made sure my glass was never empty. Was a real treat and pleasure I must say and I highly recommend Slaters based on my visit. Burger was great as advertised. Very nice atmosphere to get some afternoon computer work done. Thank you again Kat for a first rate experience. Hope to be back soon!!!

pHVbJdRKQLs3fY8Gr4knMg.text: The impossible burger is pretty darn amazing, I guess my only comment here is that they didn't have an actual "vegan option" for this vegan option lol, they have it listed with an egg on a brioche bun and don't forget a side of bacon (they are known for that which is pretty damn impressive- they have a pork spread that the boys couldn't stop eating). It doesn't mean they didn't try to modify, which I so so appreciate! But I would really love if they designated a cool version for the ones not privy to the meat.    I loved all the creative menu options, my boyfriend is a meat connoisseur and I always like going to all restaurants to share experiences, regardless of if I eat meat or not.  The restaurant is new so I'll chop up the ac being out of whack and the forgotten drinks to new territory, I give this place a 4/5 and I'll defiantly be back when I figure out how to modify even more lol, the picture is the alarm burger with, you guessed! No cheese, no bacon spread, no egg or brioche bun LOL!  Don't eat the pumpkin dip that comes with the fires of you are vegan, there's mayonnaise in it, however if you are like my man, try not to lick the little cup it comes in clean... table manners lol (just kidding, he's a proper gentleman but he says it's to die for).

jLiJM0w8v_FUlMrWCU_28g.text: Went there last night, a party of 4. Bill was about $115.00. 2 drinks, 4 burgers. Fries which we upgraded were terrible. Not hot, soggy. Our 4 burgers were up at the pass for 6+ minutes. I don't think we will be back. Our 50/50 burger was the thickness of a McDonalds cheeseburger. IMO overpriced. Next time, GordonRamseys Burger. About the same price. I think it will be way better.

eyZCcYKjTFEPqw4QBiIecw.text: Dinner was great!  Excellent happy hour in beers and excellent selection too!  Burgers were great! The vampire dip was AMAZING! Will definitely be back!

zVUTOd3mmbPiyXfGuLalxA.text: Finally we have a burger place close to Henderson that is worth a return visit. The staff was great and they are genuinely excited about the food.  I ordered the b, b, b which is 50/50 bacon burger, bacon cheese, bacon strips, and a fried egg . It is pronounced buh buh buh because it is so much bacon it makes you stutter.  They have bacon salt on the table too.   The meal comes with choice of sides. I had the regular fries.  They were served with bacon ketchup.  Honestly they underwhelmed me.  The ketchup had a slight smokey flavor and the fries were ok but not spectacular.  The sweet potato fries looked much better. The burger however more than made up for it.   At the bar they have at least 50 beers on tap with a descriptive menu. Now, back to my diet

W_JmmS1mzkUbx1Xvb4BYtA.text: portions were good and pricing was fair. i visited on my birthday and we were assisted by a bubbly waitress. this place would be fun to go to with a group. they serve highly customizable burgers with lots of options on a fun menu. this restaurant's draft beer selection has to be one of the biggest in town. they display them across the front of the interior of the restaurant and it's a lot to look at, but don't let that intimidate you: the laminated beer menu separates each by type (sours, porters, ipa) so you can really decide what to try. highly recommend the flights.

FxI5TATIVbJU2QRlisZJ2Q.text: Sriracha burger = delicious. The burger wasn't very spicy and just had the perfect kick that sriracha is supposed to have. They didn't overpower it. It's a little greasy, but it is a burger and it does have a bacon base.  The fries are basic. Nothing too special there, but nice complement to the burger. I suppose the bacon ketchup would be the appeal!  The layout and space in there is cool. Very open. There's tons of different beers, which is awesome. They also let you sample before you fully order, which I always appreciate (it's so annoying ordering a full size drink and not being into it).   I haven't tried their desserts yet, but man, their milkshakes look so appealing! Will definitely be back.

4DweWB2I4nU7xvjpYpzvew.text: Terrible service. Sunday 3pm server barely even spoke to us! Never refilled water, never followed up on service. Half of Frickles burnt!!! Unbelievable. Slater's in CA is by far a diff experience   Andy invited us back after reading review, Went back last week with my daughters, service was great. Food was amazing! Thank you Andy

YadlVG8ydrTNUl6kvuIXYA.text: We ate here tonight based on recommendations from family and they did not disappoint...   First - the food was amazing ! We had the 50/50 burger , Mac n Cheese balls and onion rings . The Tapatio ranch was awesome and Bacon Ketchup tasted great . Our burger was cooked  perfectly with a beef and bacon patty . The Bun was incredible and complimented the burger perfectly. The onion rings were very crispy and was incredible with the ranch sauce .   I would recommend this to anyone that loves burgers and bar food . I am looking forward to going back and trying more of the Apps and Beers they have on Tap .   I do wish that the seating was a little more comfy and the hostess should not be wearing the shorts she was. The corporate trainer was there and was very nice . Our waiter was a very nice guy and did a fantastic job covering the menu and what Slater's was known for .

Z1OCSgw1kSP4zE-V421mFg.text: We flew in late from LA and was starving and came by this place. It is located in a little shopping black. Parking was easy to find because it was late but plenty of spots available. I had the pork a palooza and while it looks like it isnt enough for one person it is more than enough. Everything was cooked just right and delicious especially the pork belly and bacon. We had garlic fries to share with the table. If you love garlic then you'll love these fries. There were 2 cloves hidden inside and its soft to eat. I love garlic and it was just right amount. My friend had the chili sliders which she devoured. Its a bit hard to pick up and eat because they give you a generous amount of chili. She ate it with a fork but it was still delicious.   Customer service was great. They were attentive and had our water cups always filled. Overall great experience.

l9VsvTU7d385cRGLnABy8Q.text: Went for the beer, bacon, burgers, and crazy shakes. Only disappointing factor was the price, yikes! Bacon cheeseburger A+ Loaded fries A+ S'mores Crazy Shake A+ Beer selection A+ Price FFFFFFFFF! The bill was almost $50 for just that, one of each. I guess we came at a weird time where we just missed the lunch menu, and was too early for the happy hour menu. It is pretty messed up hearing your server offer 2 for 1 beers to the table next to you because they showed to 15 minutes later. Especially when there is only 2 tables in there. If yall lowered your prices I would come back cuz it was good. Real good. So good I even followed you on the gram.

hTOhy6y5x37a14Sei7hs3Q.text: Came here for dinner with some friends after a long day of volunteering. Slater's is a place that was popular in SoCal and I had a location bookmarked for the longest time (I don't remember who told me about it or where I had seen it). Recently heard that it opened up in Vegas.   Slater's 50/50 is located on the SouthEast corner of Bermuda and Silverado Ranch, adjacent to the supermarket. We had came here on a Saturday evening, around probably 8 o clock. The restaurant itself looked pretty busy with the bar on the right, and the dining room spread to the left. Received a pager and said a party of 4 would take 15 minutes. Surprising that it was such a short wait and also surprisingly it was fairly accurate. We were seated within this time frame.   Slater's is popular due to their burger patties made with 50% beef 50% bacon. Never had a burger with a blend of meat like that so I was quite excited to try. BEFORE YOU ALL BURN ME LATER, IM GOING TO SAY THIS. I'M NOT A LOVER OF BACON OR BURGERS . . . !  There was a dip that I've heard of before that sounds amazing. "Slater's Vampire Dip" is a dip made with roasted garlic and artichoke hearts blended w/ creamy melted cheese, served in a sourdough bread bowl w/ crispy pita and veggies for dipping.   OH.. MY... GOD ! THIS .. WINS ! Garlic and artichoke dip already sounds amazing enough. To my surprise, even their sourdough bread bowl was FRESH and HOT ! EVERYTHING WAS SO GOOD ! Pita bread was "crispy" and was a good "start" to eating the dip. Carrots and celery seemed mildly weird to me to dip with. The bread bowl was the best part. I LOVE a good sourdough bread and THIS WAS GOOD ! My friend and I kept digging and ripping out the bread bowl because it was so yummy ! It was so good, and he ate so much, he had heartburn all night long (rip him). LOL HIGHLY HIGHLY RECOMMENDED ! ! !   3 of my friends had all ordered the original 50/50. I had ordered the Hi-Brow burger to be "different" but it also sounded really good.   "The Hi-Brow Burger" consists of a Black Canyon Angus beef patty w/ melted swiss and blue cheese, baby arugula, caramelized onions, horseradish, bacon-jalapeno jam and roasted garlic aioli on a brioche bun with A1 on the side.   Aside from the blue cheese, everything else sounded amazing. I opt'ed to leave the blue cheese in there to see if I would like it now but NOPE LOL DEFINITELY STILL DONT LIKE BLUE CHEESE HAHAHA !   I opt'ed to have the patty switched for their "50/50" burger patty to try but had soon later regretted it.   Burgers come with a choice of "French Fries + Slater's Bacon Ketchup," "Sweet Potato Fries + Pumpkin Sauce," or "Slater's salad". You can also "Slaterize" your Fries or Burger. For the fries, you can add "House-Made Beer Cheese", "Slater's Shmanimal", or "Bacon Chili Cheese". For the burger, you can make it a "Double Patty" or "Triple patty".   I opt'ed to have my French fries "Shmanimal". They described it similar to like "In & Out's" animal style with grilled onions, beer cheese, and bacon.   For the fries, its like the "premium" version of animal style. Onions are nicely caramelized and cooked. Beer cheese was nice. Overall, it was pretty decent. Could kind of omit some of the bacon   The burger, was a bit weird. The patty itself, was a bit firmer than I had expected. Probably because of the bacon, also it was much saltier than I had liked as well. Friend had said, i should have stuck with the black canyon angus beef patty instead ! Aside from that, the blue cheese was really strong. When I had ordered, I had expected like a mild amount of blue cheese with a moderate amount of swiss... man I had forgotten there was swiss in this ! LOL ! Loved the arugula, caramelized onions, horseradish, jalapeno jam. OH ! the roasted garlic aioli on the soft but chewy brioche bun was good !   Overall, eh. tried everything we wanted to try. Wouldn't really come back again for the burger. Vampire dip and a beer? maybe.

94unai3hYTh9ZLCMKnbqoA.text: I heard good things about this place so I took the family and a couple friends, one of which was a vegetarian. People were right! The food is great! We didn't have one thing that we didn't like. Also, I love having meatless options that are tasty. Its in a great location, not far from my house.  The only reason this place didn't get 5 stars was because our server wasn't kind or friendly. I could tell he was not having a good day and his lousy attitude kinda cast a little cloud over our meal. He didn't seem to want to serve us. Idk why, we are friendly people.  I'll try going again some other time...

Photo of Slater's 50/50 - Las Vegas, NV, United States

KcjmAtGqcVxNX4hDtEHOFg.text: I've had my eyes on Slater's 50/50 for a while and finally stopped in for lunch. The space is cool and they have a full bar with plenty of beer on tap.   We were seated and offered regular menus, lunch menus, and the happy hour menu that started 15 minutes from the time we sat.   We opted for lunch specials. The Slater's 50/50 burger and the fried chicken cobb. I had a bite of the burger and it was really good. The salad was a huge portion and very fresh and filling. We also added fries and a coke. The burger was tasty and all of the flavors went well together. The fries were piping hot and we sprinkled some of the bacon salt on them and they went with the bacon ketchup well.   I saw a few more items I would like to try and would definitely stop in for happy hour for drinks and appetizer specials.   The manager was stopping by each table to check in on the diners which is always a nice touch. He made sure everyone liked their food and that they weren't waiting long.   The area needed a good and unique restaurant like Slater's 50/50. If you haven't tried it yet then definitely stop by. You won't be disappointed.

qV1UQcHFCccjJST4TAaOfA.text: One thing I need to said please come with empty stomach too much food OMG but delicious,fresh and the best quality meat ever.And the service  100%

Photo of Slater's 50/50 - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 50/50 Sloppy Joe Sliders
Photo of Slater's 50/50 - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chips and Dip

sBbXs3PuUKAyK2pxC4FiIA.text: When the building and door read: Bacon, Burgers, and Beer it's going to be an uplifting experience!   Here we stand with the door opening to an establishment that I have been meaning to eat at for weeks. It is always the places that you put off that turn out to be ridiculously outstanding.   As I walked into the business I hear Run DMC playing, alright so let's find a seat at the bar. As you pass through the threshold on either side are bar taps from every beer one can possibly think of. Yes this is going to be a wonderful afternoon. With the clock reading around three-ish, I fell in with the lunch special dash. The specials they run are on some popular drinks on the menu. Deciding that a Bloody Mary with bacon is always delicious it's what I started with. To chase that however it was good old fashioned Coke!   Now that drinks are here it's time for food we ordered the backyard burger and added bacon to it.  On their lunch special one can take advantage of any two appetizers that are listed for $8.00! We figured why not. We sampled the tots and queso cheese and fries with bacon ketchup. The burger entrees have the option of tots, fries, or salad; I took the green salad option.   As we waited for the order to come out of the kitchen the music that they play is hip and fun feeling to sing along with. The music is a mix of everything; from Zeppelin to those Reggie classics that just make you wiggle! The service from the staff here is beyond amazing. The burger did not take to long to put together either. With my Bloody Mary only half gone, and the burger and tots show up what fast and delicious service. The smells coming from this backyard burger are intoxicating. It's time to sample it, enough smells!  Giving into temptation I cut the burger in half since it's easier to enjoy. Who does not love a good burger? Let image for just a moment the smells of the backyard bbq that we had all had, the fun of running in the backyard while dad cooks those burgers. The aroma of those smells tantalize my senses and take me back to those times that were oh so long ago! The burgers here are inspirational since the taste takes me back to a time that love filled my life. I'm not sure how they replicated that backyard burger taste, but it's the memories that remind somewhere of a time in their life that brought them such sheer joy. Wow I wonder what some of the other burgers will inspire.   The service was just as wonderful as the food. The bartender was our server and drink maker. Actually the bartender tended to all of our needs. The restaurant was steady, not really busy. This amazing and lovely lady was able to handle a couple of tables as well as her bar customers. She made small talk with the customers that sat at the bar too! The skills that the staff here are amazing. I noticed the other server that was tending to the customers in the main dining area was just as nice. What really stuck out with the other male server was his manners? He used the proper sir names for the social niceties we all observe! He was very genuine and gentle too! As he passed our table and interacting with the bartender the fluidity they shared was positive and mellow. I love a crew that works well together it makes being a customers so fantastic. Knowing that the service is way above the standards it would make me recommend this place to oh so many. It's the staff that are the True representation of a business, and the management is very professional at what type of individuals they want to be serving their guests. Thanks to the wonderful staff here for all their hard work and effort that they continue put forth.  Now who wants to go back in time and remember those bbqing memories of when dad was grilling and you and your siblings were chasing the dog around the yard. You were just wishing dad would cook those burgers faster since the smells are driving you nuts. The backyard burger will send your senses on an exquisite and exciting journey of discovery. You will be remembering when and be able to rediscover those times again, and it's all because your taste buds associated those smells and tastes with such happy memories. The Bloody Marys here are amazing and the bacon slices in it perfection in a cup. Need to watch that game come and do it here the beer types and varieties are ridiculous. The staff is genuine and professional with such stellar service. It's almost Sunday so now you know where to go and watch the game, and bring the family they are all welcome here! The beer is on tap and cold, so come on and join in on the fun!

n3PjCtCeV2oPE8BF-fTv2A.text: Met Freddie (bartender) Friday night for the first time.  It had been a while since returning to Slater's and thoroughly enjoyed his company and service.  The food was great as always and will not wait as long to return.

ebKjb_jaq3E4s885gO7gNw.text: So we originally came for the big selection of craft beers they have on tap; and we hoped the food was decent.  MISTAKE!  The food was outstanding.  We always used to get a regular hamburger, but now go meatless with the Impossible Burger.  If you are a vegetarian, then you know how good the Impossible and Beyond Burgers are; but what makes it special here is all the stuff they put on it.  All the bartenders have been great and are just really nice people - who remember you when you come in - that's such a nice feeling.  Love the fact it's local....no strip traffic.  Keep up the good vibes.

qEiUwhu_0-fto-DkhphTyQ.text: Amazing wings and best michelada I've had in a while. Freddie was the best bartender.

XQozOEwYmmcNYms-wqosqg.text: The interior is spacious and the Slater 50/50 sign was definitely a nice touch. Service was great and the food came out right away. I ordered the garlic fries and the Slater sliders. Both were tasty.   Even though I was there during the lunch hours I wasn't offered their lunch menu. Not sure why.

P-YnhqArFhEgPCkSkhRp7w.text: Delicious food, great coupons, friendly staff and good beer. Seating could be a lot more comfortable but other than that good place to eat.

vbELgnGEeDwxvqoF_BjeYA.text: We really like this place. We have a waiter that we usually sit with. He was there but we didn't get to sit with him tonight. Instead we got the bartender. No we were not at the bar. My glass of water tasted like beer. Dirty straw probably not. Dirty glass probably not beer spilled in the ice probably so. Kind of a disgusting thing to begin the night with. Burger, with wagyu beef, medium well. Problem is I ordered medium rare. I ate it anyways. My wife's Burger cold. How I don't know. I had a chili burger she had a chili burger her chili was literally cool to the touch. Are regular waiter who was quite busy at the time stopped to help us get a warm Burger. Hey at least I don't have microwaves to heat them up then LOL We want this place to succeed. It's close to us and they have a good theme. I guess burgers were coming back all day but the cook. I hope he's okay. Maybe just having a bad day. The fact that both of our meals and my water we're all out of whack is really crazy. I only tipped 11%. I told the waitress / bartender that it was due to our experience. She said she couldn't help how they cooked the burger. I showed her the burger and asked what she thought it was and she said medium well. Then she got the ticket and showed me she ordered it medium-rare. I guess she forgot about the beer water. LOL Anyhow, like I said, I hope this place stays around but I'm going to give it some time before I return.

5hEOkMzlMxVwH9jJTPcEhQ.text: I haven't been in for awhile because ive been working sooo much but I didn't recognize their bartender Freddie but he was A MAZING. He gave good quality service and SUPER nice. I am definitely going back to see him.

DE9S-LNvgum1bgKwn0geIA.text: This is the fun/easy hockey spot to watch the VGK!!  The food is great and drinks were delicious! The service was spectacular! We sat in the bar area and the bartender was quick and personable, Kat was on top of it! She made great suggestions and made us feel very welcome. We will come back !

6eDKc_SopnlJ48uoo_RUiA.text: This place was good, not amazing. Their burgers were good and cooked well. The flavor was definitely the highlight. I enjoyed the sweet potato fries with pumpkin sauce. It was a nice touch. I also appreciated their beer selection. The service was fast and our server was super friendly, which is always a plus.   But like I said, good, not amazing. Probably not somewhere I would go again anytime soon.

2pALTEDnn1ZjaTrSfNMADA.text: Not bad, went to watch the VGK game there on Sunday. Decent beer options, service good. Found it a little pricey though, especially for the location.

8hbu8iKw7Fb2ioctTrjWIA.text: The food here is always great. Highly recommend the vampire dip. Love the build your own burger options. The prices can be a little high, but the food is honestly so good, I don't care! Freddie served us this last time and he was awesome!

VeqcoJJ1NmA44QCFAlIN_Q.text: The 50/50 burger had a burnt taste to it but the bacon ketchup for the fries was very good.  Nice selection of beers.  Unfortunately there are a group of regulars that go on froday for happy hour they were pretty offensive with their conversation and they were very loud.  I won't go back because of them

e6dNVRHgx75Llj6HejO0Yw.text: This place is truly a hidden gem. My husband and I went here for a date night and we were very happy with the service and the food. Tarek, our waiter, was very friendly and gave us good suggestions on what to get for our first time there. The atmosphere was very friendly and the food came fast for how busy it was. We will definitely be coming back and bringing friends.

9sU4tgDUcJ4c5XgoVC69AA.text: Awesome spot with great beer. This is my third time here and I've always had a good time.  Service was fantastic as well. Genesis was my bartender she made two great recommendations on the menu and they did not disappoint.   Definitely will be back!

FnOcCIu7CinE8ixvhXJyWg.text: It was ok, the hype is more then what the food is. When I get a burger I don't like the bread being soggy, it was like super soft and wet so the burger broke and just threw me off. Bc it wasn't like eating a burger anymore. But choice of beers was good

n6jz8mQGkvr4Jk5ZJT2_Ng.text: Visited Slater's for the first time and had an awesome experience.  Our server Tod, was amazing. He went above and beyond. Oh and the burgers and wings were amazing. If you love garlic, the garlic fries are everything. Definitely will be returning.

SwWQFwWnQxE-5UGGok6wUQ.text: Didn't know Slater's had made it out to Vegas. Saw it while driving by and stopped in. Glad we did. Lots of menu items to choose from. Ordered the frickles (fried pickles), vampire dip, and split the PB and Jellousy burger. The frickles were good, served with a honey mustard dip that really brought out the bitterness in the dill. Not necessarily a bad thing! The vampire dip is a super cheesy affair with artichoke in it, served in a sourdough bowl with carrots, celery, and pita wedges. AWESOME and highly recommended! The burger was delicious and reminded me of my first experience of a peanut butter burger in New Orleans. You might think "ewww" but you'd be oh so wrong. The flavor combinations of the patty, PB, jelly and think cut bacon go so well together. As a note, the regular fries that came with it were overdone.  This place also has a HUGE selection of beer, the usual suspects along with some great local choices. They offer flight samples so you can try a few without the whole problem of looking like an alcoholic with the 6 pint glasses on your table.  I definitely recommend this place!

QEtVnYTODjNWM2f7hVlpAA.text: I went here a few weeks after they opened up and at the end of the day the burger was decent nothing special the service was a little odd handing me a card and asked to write a good yelp review with their name on a card just seemed cheesy,  And it's been about 8 months and I haven't gone back, And I'm not saying I won't go back it's just never a place I think of  Maybe I just caught it on a non-spectacular day I will eventually probably return but if you're deciding between this and BurgerIM right near it, go to BurgerIM

0suHNpAkYpItNNfNmaR0Xw.text: The beer selection is incredible. They have a wide variety farmhouse, Hefeweizen, pales has IPAs. The bacon Mac and cheese balls with tapatilla ranch were fantastic but The sweet potato fries with pumpkin sauce take the cake. Mmmmmmmmm

photos.caption: Photo of Slater's 50/50 - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Half of a 50/50 Original Burger and a Farmhouse Saison. Amazing combo, fantastic service, 50 beers on tap and the food is so delicious!!!

zrq3DcAvXIHxe2YpRb9xSw.text: Our first time here. Mariah was our server and man she sure knew her stuff. Burgers and Beer was wonderful but the chili cheese fries and Bloody Mary's were unforgettable. The highlight had to be The Bacon Salt and our table attendant Mariah. Thank you Mariah for a perfect ending to our day!

photos.caption: Photo of Slater's 50/50 - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Perfection! Mariah was our table attendant, man she was wonderful  fast, friendly and lots of fun.

SyT3UzSD0KFKheHsr98eaA.text: We were really looking forward to trying this place after all the good reviews, but we were definitely disappointed. The service was great, but the burger was really mediocre at best. I ordered my burger medium, and it was almost raw. I should've sent it back, but I hoped that the bacon and sauce would cover it up. The French fries and bacon ketchup were good, not mind blowing either. My husband had the hot dog, and he actually liked his, but he tried my burger and agreed it was not worth going back for.

BUWFspHocUoAt4wLzvCyDA.text: First time trying this place.  The food was great.  Had the sliders and fries.  Good size and very tasty.  I heard this place is owned by Kelly Slater which makes it even cooler then originally thought.  Great food.

FDOdkMib6Z58eo4OUt3ToA.text: This is a nice little sports bar which just opened. Their specialty is 50% bacon/50% beef burgers which adds a smoky taste to the mix. A good idea overall. My wife got the Lone Star Smoke, including onion rings, which she said was very good. I had the spaghetti with bacon meatballs which was also very good. They have an excellent selection of craft beers, as well as old standards, on draft. A little something for everyone. I'm curious to try the Mac and cheese bar. Our tab was around $40, with my wife's burger, my spaghetti and a beer each. Our server, The Todd, was very knowledgeable regarding the menu items and checked back with us several times to see if we needed anything. In summary, Slater's 50/50 is a nice addition to the neighborhood and we hope to see them do well.

fYYsPkJLNUwRBsvF1y1HzQ.text: Went with my parents. It was A bit busy but luckily got the last seats at the bar.  Hostesses were pleasant and active on getting the barstools we needed.   We were taken care of by Melissa and Freddie. Both very attentative. They were pretty busy once we sat down so we couldn't get immediate service, but they were communicative and still acknowledged us which is all we needed.  I could tell Freddie was slightly new only because Melissa was assisting him a few times, making her a great trainer. But Freddie has got all the right basic service down ez, he'll be great if not already.   Ordered the porkapalooza platter which was basically bacon in multiple ways. Was not A fan of the vinegar pork grinds as I like them crispy , will ask for it without the vinegar next time if I do order it again.  Ahi Tuna nachos were bomb, super fresh tuna. Needed more sauciness though.  And the peanut butter jelly burger was tasty. Its always nice to have an array of flavor notes in one bite.   I like the music selection, TVs, brightness and chill vibe. Definitely want to come here to watch vgk games.   The highlight of my dinner was instagramming my experience and getting IMMEDIATE love shown back. That's some above and beyond service... taking Care of the social media end right in the middle of a busy dinner shift.   Love the beers on tap, but they definitely gotta get Training Day from Reavos's 7five Brewing if they are a True vgk establishment!  I live like 5 minutes away so I'll def come back.

jPj2QKDKndavgmR5IbCtAQ.text: Tarek is a excellent server! He brought samples of beers! He explained the menu thoroughly! We got Mac n cheese bites and sloppy joes to start! I got the bison burger and my boyfriend got the b.b.b.!! All delicious! 50 beers to choose from!! Definitely coming back!

y_Jgd8PvBmxqZWd4qjiKbg.text: Cait was great, don't hate. She was never late. Her being our server, I guess it was fate. This is our review, 5 star rate!

EUojb6tqFTb-xHrcLzL9mw.text: We went to Slater's with friends excited to try a new restaurant.   The decor, seating, and overall comfort was great!  We enjoyed the menu as it had some unique options.  Our wait staff was amazing!  The only negative was the fact that I ordered my burger medium rare and it came out well done.  I had them send it back and try again,  unfortunately it was still well done.  The management team did a great job of discounting the bill.   Overall we enjoyed the experience and will likely be back.

uwQX4EIdT20uAR2Od7Rv3w.text: Slater's is such a fun place! The service is awesome! They make you feel like a guest, rather than just a customer! Freddie was our server. H was very inviting and just helpful in general! He made sure we didn't have food in out mouths when he came around, so we were actually able to put in requests! Even going as far as to telling us that we didn't have to leave if we didn't want to yet! They have board games and they actually encourage you to play and stick around! Freddie was our server, but more people than just him care to check in on us and it was awesome! Just great atmosphere, great food, and great service!

lAzp2b9i6O6pTa_S789H_A.text: I couldn't believe it when my boyfriend said a Slater's opened up the street. The beer selection is amazing, but the fooooood, the burgers, never disappoint. I'm one of those people that generally orders the same thing every time i go somewhere but the bartender Jeff said we should try the pb&j burger, I was hesitant but he offered to pay for it if I didn't like it so there was no reason not to. 10/10 it's like eating dinner and dessert all in one, and i would absolutely order it again. 10/10 service as well. Oh, I also got it a la mode    If you're a frequent beer drinker, they have a monthly membership for $30 that gets you one beer a day everyday. Worth it in my opinion. Can't wait to go back for more.

1Za-LMnTYSmtVKg_UWIrOA.text: My husband and I stopped in for our first visit and we were pleasantly surprised with the selection of craft beers! Tarek was our server and he was awesome! He brought us a complimentary order of mac n cheese balls, just so we could try it on our first visit! He really set the tone for our dining experience. My husband ordered the PB&J burger, and I ordered the Best Damn Bacon Burger. Both were amazing, although I do have to say, after tasting his bizarre burger, I was jealous I didnt order it! It was ridiculously tasty! Along with Tarek's amazing service, we were also greeted by the manager who stopped several times at our table to check on us. Thanks Slaters 50/50, we will definitely be back!

fs7T5uMCpiT6kVQazBStUw.text: What a great lunch! Delicious burgers, fries and an awesome beer selection. David and Nicole made fabulous suggestions for food and drink. It was a relaxed and pleasant environment and will definitely return.

YQ4SxScj5oXUcp_qjxdCfg.text: First time here and wasn't disappointed. Lisa took great care of us and was wonderful. If you love bacon you'd definitely enjoy this place! 10/10 would recommend   The portions seem small but it's definitely filling. Had the original 50/50 and the egg really makes it.

kOZtos9rbHTaCmwbovhJSA.text: If you love bacon this is the place for you. Their burgers have bacon in the mixture with the beef. My favorite by far is the bbb bacon burger. I suggest a double patty to give you an adequate level of the meat sweats. Two patty's on a bun with an over easy egg on top. They also have killer sweet potato fries with a pumpkin dipping sauce that takes the fries to a whole other level. If you choose regular fries they also have a solid bacon ketchup dipping sauce. The staff is friendly and there are enough TVs to enjoy whatever sports your into. I know they have a bar but to be honest I'm there for the food.

2AfrB7OdVB4tJQ2amHfIpQ.text: This place was amazing. Our server was Todd and he was the absolute best. This was our first time ever gearing of Slaters 50/50 and it was a really great experience. The service, the food, and the atmosphere are definitely worth a return visit. We will definitely visit Slater's 50/50 when ever we are in Las Vegas or anywhere near one. Oh and their 24 karat burger is delicious and don't forget to order the vampire dip and their beer with the hint of peanut butter flavor....

kx-CVYHdGKzVKsZK59up-g.text: So, I want to start by mentioning that I was only here because the majority of the group I was with wanted bacon. I however was not in the mood, at the time. My whole mood changed as we were seated though. Just by looking and reading some of the sarcasm on the menu made me laugh. I wish I took more pictures, but believe me you can't go wrong ordering anything from this place. But definitely come hungry! Our party ordered 2 appetizers, including this huge pita dip which was amazingly cheesy with that nice crispiness from a quick fry. I was already filling up from just that. (Of course it doesn't help that I have a small gut either) I ended up getting a classic all beef burger and of course sprinkled some bacon salt. There's still a lot on the menu that I wanted to try like their nachos. Hopefully next time!

_opUJN01RmWWeXGybhC4-A.text: sitting here waiting for 4 burgers, nothing special, for 40 minutes now ... place is 75% empty and a rat ran by outside in sidewalk.  Can't comment on food yet. Been to other locations and liked it.

YDlW1Ou-_-mH4F_hbVbThQ.text: I have to say that the food is very good. I had a hamburger with caramelized onions, blue cheese, arugula, horseradish sauce and cheese. It was so good that I wanted to keep eating it even though I was so full. Now something you need to know about me, I don't normally order hamburgers because of a)calorie overload & b)I just don't really like hamburgers. So kudos to Slater's 50/50 for doing a great job. However the fries were tasty but not hot. Our server was nice enough to get me some new ones but they weren't much hotter. My daughter had the chicken lettuce wraps and they were good as well.  The staff is very nice and they were incredibly busy because there was a charity event going on and I know that they were short handed, and our food came out sooner than expected and our server was lovely. The restaurant was clean and comfortable. We will be happy to go back many times

Ra0rVhqTQ116_vkDqZc1Tw.text: Fantastic beer, and excellent food!    A few weeks ago, I went to Slater's 50/50 for the very first time.  I decided to come here because they have the impossible burger, and as a person who does not eat meat, this is a big deal for me for a restaurant to have plant-based protein option in their menu.  They did not disappoint.  Our experience was stellar from start to finish.  Our server, Lisa was terrific, and she made great beer recommendations for my husband and me.   Here is what we ordered:  Sweet Potato Fries with Pumpkin dipping sauce - TO DIE FOR!  You've got to try this dish, and add this to your order if you do come and dine here.  Impossible Burger over salad with Avo; it was delicious! You can have the Impossible burger however you like it.  I just opted for the salad option.   Ahi Tuna Poki Nachos - my husband's favorite dish now.   I ordered a flight of beers, and they were all great!  I recommend that you try the Dragon's Milk - it is delicious!  We also visited Slater's 50/50 in our area when we returned home from Vegas, and although the food and drinks were great, the Las Vegas location was WAY better.  LV Slater's 50/50 had great vibes, great staff members, and overall a great dining experience for my husband and me.

TsKZy3H3Rg-aMe46qMX-ug.text: Lisa was our waitress and if you happen to have her as your server, consider yourself lucky. She is personable and knows the menu well.  Darrel was assisting Lisa and seriously... how did This place get 2 amazing employees!?  Our 2nd daughter ordered the sweet potato fries and they are the B.O.M.B!! The pumpkin sauce makes it like pie.  My husband and I had the Poke Tuna Nachos and they were really good. Good flavor and not stingy on the tuna. There was enough for the 2 of us to Share. One word...YUMMY!!! Husband also had 2 of their 50 beers. Got leave some for later. Haha We can't wait to come back!

4bDJEtWpt4NeXYktkA2twQ.text: Slater's 50/50 is one of my favorite burger restaurants in the world, and I frequent several of the locations in Southern California. The new Las Vegas branch is an absolute disaster. It's located near "my side of town" but I won't be returning for many months. Here's hoping they get the kinks worked out soon.   Everything about the space feels cheap. It's in a rundown shopping center in a not so great part of town. The location alone will likely prove to be the restaurant's downfall. The concrete floors look like they ran out of money and couldn't finish them (they're stained in the restrooms but not in the main dining area, for instance). The tables are ugly and cheap and look like something out of a small town diner. For a sports bar atmosphere, the televisions are plentiful but they are so tiny that I'd never want to come here to watch a game -- I'm not a fan of squinting. They're also stingy with napkins.   The menu is extremely limited, and they don't even have Slater's signature "Create Your Own" burger menu. We asked twice and the answer we got was "we don't want to overwhelm the kitchen but we will have them soon." Not a good sign. The prices are still just as high as the other locations; expect to pay $15 - $20 for a burger with a small side of fries.   We ordered our favorite menu item, the crispy brussels sprouts. The presentation was sloppy and careless, and the sprouts weren't crispy. Neither was the bacon. They were grossly oversauced; so much so that even my sauce-loving hubby commented that even he thought there was just too much slopped on top.    Since we couldn't create our own burgers, we both settled for the BBQ burger. These burgers were absolutely disasters. First, the server didn't even ask us how we wanted our meat prepared (guess well done is their only option?). Second, our meals were loaded with way too much sauce, to the point where I had to get up and take napkins off the adjacent table to try to wipe away the BBQ sauce on top. It was DROWNING in a sickly sweet sauce. The bacon on the burger was absolutely disgusting. It was limp and undercooked, and had a fake smoky flavor. The side of sweet potato fries were delicious, but it's hard not to make great fries.   The service was abysmal too. It was friendly enough but hardly welcoming, and they were very slow all around.   I hate to write this review but this Slater's is not good. Why bother expanding into Nevada if you're going to do such a bad job as this? You guys need to do better.

photos.caption: Photo of Slater's 50/50 - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Slater's 50/50 - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Disgusting undercooked bacon and a burger DROWNING in too much sauce. It was borderline inedible.
Photo of Slater's 50/50 - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Disgusting burger that was drowning in way too much sauce. There was sauce filling the onion ring &#34;cone&#34; too! OMG!

2FVVqXy4ki4aKKJq28Lbjw.text: Worth a cheat day! This was our first visit to (any) Slater's 50/50 and it was gooood! We started with the vampire dip (roasted garlic, artichoke, cheese) served in a bread bowl with pita and carrots, as well as the frickles (fried pickles). We devoured both and literally had to stop ourselves from eating to save room for our burgers. The vampire dip wasn't too garlicky and the pickles were fried perfectly. Home run on both appetizers!  I had the Backyard Classic (basically a burger with cheese, onion, lettuce, tomato) but subbed out the beef for the "impossible" veggie patty. I had my doubts but it was actually really good! About as close to the real deal as you can get, from plants. My only criticism is it's a tad dry, so if you're used to eating juicy meaty burgers, this probably isn't for you. But as a healthier alternative, I would definitely order it again! It's a $5 upcharge but worth it, IMO. The burger came with bacon ketchup, which was delish!  Service was also good and although it was pretty busy, we didn't wait too long to be seated or for our food.   Overall I'm glad they don't list the calorie count on their menu because my experience would be dampened, lol. We will definitely be back (on my next cheat day ).

photos.caption: Photo of Slater's 50/50 - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tastes like bacon!
Photo of Slater's 50/50 - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Backyard Classic with the &#34;impossible&#34; veggie patty

yRSmzAxURwctBS9SedGLFQ.text: This was my first time here in Vegas. I've been to the one in Pasadena CA and it was exactly as I remembered it! Really good! Loved the Brussels Sprouts! The pork belly Grilled cheese was out of control cheesy and good! Loved the tots too! Mac and Cheese balls were just ok. Still worth the late night stop!!!

Photo of Slater's 50/50 - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Best damn Brussels Sprouts ever!!!

Fc-zqVKAbmqkv8yDD4Qsng.text: The good: lot of options and variety to the menu accessible to carnivores and vegans alike. You can tell a lot of thought goes into their offerings and the concept of incorporating bacon into everything. On the meat sampler thing (they had a fancy term for this pictured in review) has a pork chicken wing that was delicious. If I could just eat a plate of those I'd be happy.   The restaurant was well decorated and the staff was friendly, though the waiter was really pushy on the peanut butter burger. He also trie to talk my friend out of ordering the sloppy joe sliders which was awkward.  The ok: the food. Everything on the menu made sense conceptually, but once it all came together it just fell shot of what I expected. A great example of that was the 50/50 original burger. The patty was cooked well but the beef/pork ratio made the patty a texture I thought was sub optimal for a burger. The other problem this burger had was the chipotle mayo was really bland. Couple that with the egg not having a way to stick to the bun and the whole burger was a sloppy mess. Near impossible to eat without 10 napkins. The prices also were ok. I've spent more on a gourmet burger, but I've spent less on better burgers.  The price point shouldn't deter you from going nor will it be a reason to go.   The bad: So many components that I was expecting to deliver serious flavor fell short. The chipotle mayo was weak, guacamole (on my burger) unseasoned, the chicharrones were really bland, the bacon popcorn soggy, and the onion rings (on my friend's burgers) were not good. I think I just had a higher expectation for some of the items and was let down.   Some good and bad here. Our group of 6 agreed we would come back if invited, but we wouldn't go out of our way to go here on the regular and we probably wouldn't tell a bunch of people to go out of their way to try it. As one friend put it, "If you gentrified Red Robin you'd get Slater's."

photos.caption: Photo of Slater's 50/50 - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Slater's 50/50 - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Whatever is in the middle of this board is legit delicious. Some kind of braised pork chicken wing thing. Idk really yummy.
Photo of Slater's 50/50 - Las Vegas, NV, United States

A2NMZAHB4kILlMRaWAa_KQ.text: If epic meal time ever had a burger place this would definitely be it. If you love bacon this place is definitely for you. From bacon salt to bacon burger patties you can find all sorts of interesting combinations here. After helping a friend move we knew a greasy burger and some brews was in need but not sure if i'd be back for the burgers.  Setting: In an other wise pretty life-less plaza that's more known for the seafood market, this place definitely adds some well needed attention. The interior is well spaced out and very inviting. You can see the kitchen from the dining area and not hidden behind closed doors. They have a large chalkboard with their beers on tap unfortunately if you're facing the entrance you'll have to turn around to see it.  Original 50/50 Burger: They're known for their 50/50 burger patties which are half bacon and half ground beef. Personally I wasn't a big fan of it, its just too salty for my liking. I got their original 50/50 because it has all my favorite things in a burger: fried egg, avocado spread, and mayo. The burger was alright.. patty felt warm than hot, and bun was too thick.  Peanut Butter and Jellousy: My friend is a very adventurous eater and really wanted to try this. It honestly tastes exactly how it is. Its a bacon burger with peanut butter and jelly in it BUT the optional scoop of vanilla ice cream takes this burger that bogs you down and really brings you back up. Surprisingly good with the ice cream   Fries:  I think it's like $2 you can add beer cheese, their version of animal style in n out fries, and I forgot the third option. Being a huge in n out devotee I got that option and immediately regretted it. The cheese look like it was sneezed on my fries and didn't even cover most of my fries.  Drinks: They have a HH and a good selection of beers. I personally the lost coast tangerine wheat, tasted like orange cream soda!  Overall: I think its a pretty cool, comfortable place to grab a couple beers and maybe share an appetizer. Their burgers are unique but not crave able.

x5PKSFr6t-Xjbac6u92LAg.text: Very cool restaurant! They had a nice bar . And a great selection of beers on tap . Couldn't go to bar had the kiddos with me.  I ordered a chicken sandwich and I loved it ! My kids had burgers and they loved as well. Waitress was super nice and helpful. I had a bite of a pepper and it was so hot I was choking . My mouth was on fire. And I love hot stuff. So she brought me a milk right away to cool my mouth off . Lol . My daughter had the birthday milkshake and she loved it ! Was super cool . Love to come back.

FEwXSB4BYNvt9lw7CZeq3Q.text: Slater's 50/50! They are known for their half beef and half bacon patties. I've never tried their other locations so I definitely wanted to try their Vegas once since I live here. Yay to no traveling!   They are located in a giant plaza with a supermarket and other restaurants. We got there at around 8 pm and the wait was not long at all -- we only waited for maybe 15 minutes?   We started by sharing their Vampire dip, which is like an artichoke dip but with a ton of garlic. It came in a sour dough bread bowl with pita bread on the side as well as some celery and carrots. The dip was absolutely delicious and can possibly be a meal in itself if you don't share. The bread was fresh. It had great flavor and the cheesy goodness definitely satisfy any cravings you may have. I would not hesitate to come back just for this dish.  For my entree, I decided to go with the "Original 50/50". It had their famous 50/50 patty with a sunny side up egg and avocado. It came with your choice of regular fries or sweet potato fries. I decided to go with regular fries but Slater's had other ideas. They decided to give me BOTH type of fries! But that was only because they had given me the sweet potato fries instead of my regular ones so the waitress gave us the regular fries on the side.   The burger itself, for me, left me unsatisfied. I was not a huge fan of their famous blend nor the flavors. All I could really taste was the bacon part of the patty because it completely overcame the beef flavor entirely. On top of that, the texture of the patty was hard to get used to. It was not tender and juicy -- it was thin and firm. I guess the taste of the bacon was so strong that I couldn't really taste anything else but that could just be my own taste buds. I ended up only eating half of the burger.   The winner of the burger entree is definitely their sweet potato fries. It comes with a pumpkin dip that gives you a nice cinnamony boost. I like sweet potatoes but I'm not a huge fan of the fries typically. However, Slater's definitely does a great job on them. They were quite yummy.  Overall, decent place. They have a huge list of beer from you to choose from. I probably won't be back for their burgers but I wouldn't mind coming back for their Vampire dip :)

Bhd9DTloqEBSGilfFR7gdA.text: 5 stars for our attentive, bubbly, honest, and prompt server Gabi! We love you!! Thank you for being an amazing server who is happy to be working there! Somehow this is a rare server to find here in Vegas!   We use to come here when it was new day cafe, extremely mediocre at best! So happy that Slater's took over and gave this space meaning!   Vampire dip! I was introduced to this "vamp dip" by our incredibly stoned server 5 years ago at a location in Huntington Beach California! He was so lit, he kept asking if we wanted to try the "vamp dip" to the point where we HAD to order it since he wouldn't stop suggesting it! Best decision ever made! Because it's bomb! I could not stop ranting to my boyfriend about it and we finally made it to a Slater's location newly open here in LV! Best part about this vamp dip over the years is it hasn't changed one bit! Still as delicious as a I recalled 5 years ago! Nice surprise! (Sometimes restaurants change what's already great and turn a great dish into a good dish...sad fact)   Lettuce cups and Brussels sprouts off of the appetizer menu are tasted also! Go and get it!!!

QjFDns9PfEkrMXbjYGl90A.text: Updated review: I am truly glad that I gave this place another shot after having a meaningful talk with the owner. Last time I came I made a review and had a nice talk with the owner of the restaurant franchise. The owner was very friendly and asked about some suggestions and any concerns that I may have had. It is very nice to feel heard, even if it's just a food concern and after hearing that there were new menu items I decided I must give this place another try. I came back with my family members and I decided to try out the new items and they did not disappoint. I had the sweet n sour cauliflower, limeade and cheeseburger bowl. Although it looks a little crazy the bowl was actually very good and added a healthy spin to a regularly known unhealthy food option. The cauliflower was really good and it truly did not seem like I was eating vegetables, which was a huge plus for my table. I still found this restaurant to be extremely affordable, which is always a plus in my book and with great staff as well you can't go wrong deciding to come here for dinner. Our waiter, Alex and the manager we saw, David were touching many tables and I witnessed David go to each table to check on everyone and I truly was thrilled to see a manager take such initiative to get around to the guests. I know before I said it was not my place but I've changed my mind after having such a great experience the second time around. Thank you Slater's 50/50 for a great meal and experience!   My previous review: This was a really good late night burger restaurant. The menu was pretty brief but I did like how it was simple and to the point especially since they specialize in burgers, beer and bacon. I ordered the back house burger, my SO ordered a grilled chicken sandwich and my mother got spaghetti. Pictured below is the receipt for all 3 items which to me wasn't that bad. I am personally not a bacon fan so I don't think this was the best place for me burger wise but if you are I am sure you'd enjoy it.

K5ljvLyWNQYhcaPqTY5kXg.text: I could probably copy/paste much of my review from last year. That means they've done a good job expanding their chain.  Slater's 50/50 is a fairly well-known SoCal chain of sports bars that has very recently made the jump to Las Vegas. They opened up on the southeast corner of Silverado Ranch and Bermuda, which is thankfully not that inaccessible for me. I'd already tried their most famous menu item and was looking forward to doing so again when I heard about their publicly advertised grand opening event.  On both Saturday and Sunday, the first 50 people in line on each day were to receive a free Original 50/50 burger ($12.99 usual cost). Unbeknownst to me, a pint of Modelo Especial ($5.00 usual cost) was added to the offer, and this did taste like a fresh Mexican lager should. It's pretty easy to sip and not bitter, but it's not that bold and wouldn't overtake other flavors. Makes me excited to try the rest of their ~48 beers on tap, especially given the affordable $5-8 price range.  Back to the burger though. The 50/50 patty is 50% bacon, from which it gets rich, smoky flavor, and 50% beef. However, I was left wanting more beefy flavor, and more juicy meat too. However, the pepper jack, avocado, chipotle mayo, and fried egg w/ runny yolk added plenty of richness, and the soft brioche bun holds it all together just fine. I liked it overall.  The burger also came with a small side of french fries. They weren't so crispy on the first day, perhaps due to the rush/pressure on the kitchen. Thankfully, they got the exterior right the next time, although they did end up being heavy-handed on the salt. The bacon ketchup was good on both occasions, so I just hope to see a little more consistency on the fries.  We also picked up some extra appetizers and sides to try. We did the "Double-Down" ($10) to get one portion of House-Made Frickles and one portion of Crispy Onion Rings. Both were surprisingly great. The frickles had a crispy batter and weren't too tart inside, and they went well with the honey mustard. The onion rings were insanely crunchy and worked with the BBQ sauce or alone.  Only one of day two's apps was worthwhile. The Bacon Mac and Cheese Balls ($7.99) are crispy outside and fall apart so quickly, and it pairs well with the Tapatio ranch dipping sauce. The Chips + Dip ($5.99) were plain and came with boring queso and strangely runny salsa. The Tots ($5.00) were average at best, so stick to the Frickles and Onion Rings for your extra sides.  Service was better on the first visit despite the larger crowd. Our server today was all over the place for some reason. Thankfully, we did receive additional napkins before having to ask on each day. Those burgers got messy with yolk running all over.  I'll definitely be back to Slater's 50/50 for the food and the beer, especially when I need a sports bar. It's not top tier from a pure burger standpoint, but the complete package has plenty to offer. Looking forward to trying the non-50/50 burgers (including the non-meat "Impossible Burger") as well as the other starters and entrees!  (UPDATE: Can't remember exactly when I came back to try this, but the Peanut Butter & Jealousy burger is pretty dang good. Try flipping it upside-down for the second bite to see how that layering hits your taste buds.)

l5ZuKR28y9uYUIY0iHKwDg.text: So much YASSSS! So excited when I heard Slater's is coming to Las Vegas !   Today's Grand Opening was fantastic !   My family and I were greeted with friendly smiles from the hostess. We had a baby and toddler, and they were very accommodating to set a baby seat for us before we sat down.  Excellent service ! We had quite a list of orders & our server didn't even write it down. She memorized every detail, impressive !  Lots of parking in the plaza which is such a big win!   Now, the amazing foooood! We ordered the original 50/50, best damn bacon cheeseburger, pork-a-palooza, and Slater's vampire dip. Omrrrrgaaat, I give it a 12/10! Everything was cooked to perfection and so delicious! Highly recommend the vampire dip!   They have a large selection of craft beers to complement the bombbbb food!   Definitely going back when I'm in Vegas, MUST swing by if you're heading to Vegas or back to SoCal

ivqICEDDJ9qXR2-vSTyBtQ.text: First off, thanks again to my server Aaron. He did a tremendous job tending to me and my date whom were dining here for the first time. rAbdUeDnIIEQ8Ygp3xAlIw.text: Had a great experience with my friend. We couldn't decide on which drink to try and Our server Aaron helped us. I had the "Love, Slater" brewed specifically for this store and it was amazing! Paired nicely with the Sriracha Burger I had. My friend had the the High Brow burger and Aaron suggested that the Belching Burger pairs well with his food. My friend really enjoyed it. Aaron knows the menu really well! He also made sure he tended us without feeling overbearing.   I really enjoyed my experience here. Wide selection of craft beers and food options. They have a checklist menu where you can make your own burger plate (patty size, additional meats, sauces and upgrading your fries). You're paying for quality, taste, and service, so bring extra tipping moola when your server provides the best service on top of your personalized burger.

RDKRisWeealu_PkoBbwNpQ.text: You'll probably have an enjoyable experience with moderately tasty food served to you by very friendly waitstaff in a nicely decorated and comfortable restaurant.  We tried them out tonight (apparently their first night open) for dinner. We ordered a Lone Star Smoke Burger and an OG Impossible (vegetarian) Burger. They also obligingly served us just the chicharron from their Pork-A-Palooza starter.  The Lone Star was good, but the OG Impossible was a little overdone and slightly dry-ish. Also, we wish we would've been given the option to have the Lone Star Smoke Burger medium rare. Not sure if how you want your burger cooked is an optional thing or not here, we were not asked.  Despite a minor snafu with cheese, overall I would give them another chance. Their burgers aren't cheap, but their menu is interesting and we'd like to try some of their other offerings.

eW1S6inVLayFDNMwVoBrCw.text: Not bad at all! On Slater's week anniversary of being open, I would consider the place a success!   We went in and found the inside busy. There is outdoor seating, but it was 108 degrees so everyone was inside. We were quickly given a table. The booths in the middle aren't anchored down so my seat was shifted several times by other patrons. It was mildly annoying, hopefully they fix that.  Gabriella was quick to take our order and was very helpful in negotiating the menu. We decide to try the Original 50/50. The burger was a small 1/3 pounder (I'll get an extra patty next time, it's an option). This thing was a tectonic mess! The egg lubricates the top bun, the avocado lubricates the bottom bun. Things were sliding every which way! The pork/beef blend is a little sweeter than straight beef. It was very tasty! With the toppings on the 50/50, flavors came together nicely! The fried had a good flavor, but were a little soggy and limp. The bacon ketchup helped save some of that mess.   All told, I was very happy with the meal. I am really looking forward to getting back and trying the Sriracha burger!
