ZVC22831iX2OHOZ0dGKOTQ.text: To sum it all up, once and done.   This wasn't a place I wanted to go, but relationships are about compromise and the bf had been asking to eat here for a while now. So, I caved and there I was looking at a menu. I would have felt better saving the calories for an In-N-Out burger.   I opted for the Original 50/50 burger. The patty was half beef half bacon. The rest of the burger had jack cheese, avocado, sunny side up egg and chipotle mayo on a brioche bun. It was just too rich of a burger for my liking. There was no acid in the burger to break up the richness. I had to ask my bf for his pickled onions from his side salad to break up the taste. And there was no crunch in my burger either so it was like eating mush the whole time. Again, I had to ask my bf for one of his onion rings from his burger to add crunch. Halfway through my burger, I was just over the taste. It was falling apart and super oily. My bf took a bite of it and agreed it was way too rich. He was surprised I even got that far. The only saving grace to my meal was the sweet potato fries. They were fresh and hot and not overly sweet. I did NOT like the pumpkin sauce the fries came with though. It tasted like a dessert sauce. I'm not trying to eat a damn pumpkin pie with my burger.   My bf enjoyed his burger though. He ordered the Lone Star Smoke which came with angus beef, smoked bacon, cheddar, onion rings, pickles and bbq sauce on a brioche bun. His definitely was the better burger. It had texture and crunch. There were different flavors throughout the burger and not just an oily taste like mine.   We also ordered a kids meal for my son. We opted for a cheese pizza with fries. What we got was definitely not worth $7. It was pretty much a tortilla with tomato sauce and melted cheese. It was probably the worst excuse for a pizza I've ever seen. Our server didn't even give us the option for my son's drink, which is included in the price.   It was a nice restaurant. The floors could use a good mop since they were a bit sticky. I don't like how the men's and women's restroom are on opposite sides of the restaurant. Our server had no personality and was just like "hey, how's it going" blah blah. It seemed like he was just going through the motions. It was pretty dead for a Saturday afternoon during lunch time. I think because the location is just wrong. Honestly, I don't see them lasting long.   Thank you, next.

ruGdrsBupR-kuDawkL2v-Q.text: Came in on a weekend night with a group. Place was busy. I wanted to really like this place but it fell short. I am bummed about the bad experience because I wanted another joint to go to. We arrived before the sun was setting & by the time it started setting the sun was blinding those of us that were sitting facing the windows. We asked if there were shades that could be pulled on the top set of windows & told they didn't have any shades for the top windows. Even with our sunglasses on we were still being blinded by the sun. Bad preparation for opening a new business & not ordering shades when your business faces (the west) setting sun.   Was informed by some of my group who have dined at Slaters 50/50 in California locations they allow you to customize your own burgers but this Nevada location does not. If this is a chain why wouldn't they have the same options? Also was informed no happy hour in NV but CA does have it.   I ordered th 50/50 buger. Upon arrival I cut it in half to eat & saw it was raw. It had a huge slather of regular mayo on it & not the chipotle mayo as advertised on the menu. I like mayo but not 1/3 cup slathered on the bun. And the egg was fully cooked instead of sunny side up (also menu advertised) so there was no yolk to break & spread over the buger which I was so looking forward to (reason I ordered it.) Another diner in my group also ordered the same buger & theirs was pink but not as pink as mine. I then realized they never asked me how I would like it cooked while the server had asked others. I sent it back to be cooked more. I never got a photo of it raw. When it arrived back the 2nd time there was no egg on it & the outside egdes were burnt. By this time all the rest in my party had completed eating & I hadn't even had a bite. Our server wasn't in sight so one of the diners with my group went to the kitchen to ask for an egg. They brought it out seperately on a plate after about 5 minutes & then someone (presume a manager) came by the table & asked if I wanted them take it all back to the kitchen to put it together. I told them no since it would take even more time & all the rest of the people in my party were just waiting for me to eat. I wasn't impressed by the 2nd burger as it still was pinker than the medium I asked for & had burnt edges. I do not like the taste of something being burnt.   Another in my group who also ordered the 50/50 burger thought theirs was too pink also but they ended up eating all around the edges & when they mentioned the color of their burger to a waitress that came by the waitress stated it's that pink because the burger mix isn't 100% beef & has bacon in the ground blend. Now I grew up on a beef farm & we blended our ground beef with other meats including pork & never had the cooked product that pink when cooking burgers to medium. The burgers are expensive with a tiny amount of fries. For the price of the 50/50 burger at $12.99 plus $0.50 cents for a leaf of lettuce & another $0.50 cents for a slice of tomato I feel there are far better burger joints in town. Most of their bugers were around $15. Another diner ordered the crispy Brussels sprouts & I tried a bite while I was waiting for my food as I was starving) & they were not cooked enough as they were pretty hard. I had actually had crispy Brussels sprouts at a restaurant the night before & they were excellently prepared. They didn't prepare correctly (according to what the menu states) the Sloppy Joe sliders that 2 of the diners in our group ordered & they had to ask about it the preparation. Another diner ordered onion rings instead of fries which I did try the rings & liked them. They weren't greasy like most places. They almost seemed like they were baked.   While they did comp my burger (which I feel is only appropriate considering all the issues on their end & I had to eat after all the rest of my group was done eating) I really don't know if I will give them a 2nd chance. If I do decide to try it again it will be at least a good 6 month so they can work on all the kinks they have.

ie7o8du5d8OZR8vBwfKu3w.text: Overall a good experience. While the burgers were good and different from any other burger I've tried, I was more impressed with the appetizer sampler. The popcorn with bacon was ridiculously good and the different types of bacon were cooked and presented perfectly.  Sweet potato fries with the pumpkin dip was unexpected and delicious.  The milkshakes looked great but were  disappointing.... they kind of seemed melted. Service was great. Lisa was friendly,quick, and accommodating. Definitely a place I would recommend!

GbzjqdTQjnJ-2HI6PHb3dQ.text: GORDON RAMSEY YOU NEED TO SAVE THIS RESTAURANT! Had dinner here. Ordered the 24 karat burger, had gold dusted bacon and a gold dusted bun. Weygu beef...I was so looking forward to this, and so disappointed...it was a BOMB, this beef was FAR OVER COOKED, no temp was asked when ordering. We walked in around 8:30, and oddly enough, the place was EMPTY.   Service was slow for not having any customers except us... The other people at my table were equally, if not more disappointed in the temperature, fineness and taste of their burgers.  They were way over done and did not taste good. We are here for 2019 Vegas Shoot, and heard this place was good, however IT WAS NOT. Slow service, NO COINS IN THE REGISTER, so they rounded up and took 61 cents more than what the bill was originally, WITHOUT LETTING ME KNOW THEY WERE GOING TO DO THAT ROUND UP.  They gave me a dollar more to compensate . The bill was $31.39...they originally brought me $8.00...$0.61 MORE than what the bill was So disappointed in this experience. I do not recommend this place. I'll throw in, I'm a grad of the CIA worked in the business for many years.  I WOULD NEVER HAVE LET ANY OF THAT FOOD OUT OF THE WINDOW. GORDON RAMSEY, you NEED TO FIX THIS PLACE.

LCG6vinCccCFakxl1SspZg.text: I was hoping this would be a great new spot for family and friends. Unfortunately I won't be going back for their food.  Their beer menu is impressive, I'll give them that. The burgers are a bit on the expensive side. Three burgers and two sodas, we spent nearly $70.  We didn't care for the Burger or fries. Fries were cold and is similar to fries from Wendy's. Burgers were small and kept falling apart. Just wasn't worth what we paid. I really wanted to like this new place because it was close to home.  I would have given them another chance but I was grossed out by their food handling. I wanted to cancel our food after what I saw but still wanted to taste the food.  They have a small open kitchen so you can see everything that goes on. I was watching intensely. I kept thinking of Dirty Dining. They have two cooks. I saw one cook wipe the sweat off of his forehead while he had gloves on and didn't wash his hands or change his gloves. He went right back to cooking. I had my food by then but that was gross.  What I had a big problem with is how they serve their fries. They keep their fries in a bowl and the waiter/waitress/whoever grabs a handful of fries and puts it on the plate next to the Burger. I saw one waiter drop some fries and he picked them back up and tossed them back in the bowl. I saw four different people put their hand in that small bowl.  That's not all. There we're about six burgers ready to be served and apparently they mixed up the burgers because one woman was touching/opening the burgers to see which was which. There were three people there trying to figure out which Burger was which. It was a bit comical.  At that point I told my family we will never eat there again. Just the thought of too many hands touching my food. Yuck!! Especially since the gloves are made to touch food only but they touch everything else too.  They have a very small kitchen and at one point there were 8 people crowded around the food ready to be served. Two men walked in from the back and talked there for a minute or two.  One woman appeared as though she just woke up with her long hair not tied back and noticably unbrushed. She was the one touching the food too. I can imagine her unkept hair easily falling into the food. I only saw one person there wearing a hair net. A smaller woman in the back.  Just the whole hygiene factor has me grossed out.  I'm in healthcare so I pay attention to those details. They were also only wearing one glove. Blue gloves. I wanted to ask if they were the proper gloves for food handling but they should be, right? We use blue gloves in the clinic. That's all I could think about too.  They are fairly new so I'm hoping they get their stuff together. Unfortunately I won't be giving it another try. If you eat there, watch their food handling and hygiene skills.

EkYyD7_H5JKGofsOYItnjA.text: We came here a week ago after having friends rave about it!  They were right on!  All the food was awesome!  We started with the bacon Mac n cheese balls which were addictive!  We ordered a couple different burgers both of which were cooked perfectly and crazy juicy!  Nicole was fast any time we needed something . We will definitely be back!

iNO6-lSEgkYhecP2_sdtNA.text: This place has a great selection of Beers on draft and very nice customer service. We were greeted by the hostess and seated promptly. Our waitress was friendly and informative as we explained that this was our first visit. She was attentive to our needs and brought our food out quickly.        The Burgers are not as amazing as their staff and menu describe. The have the appearance and flavor of a pre made patty. The Buns fall apart easily and become soaked in grease and juices from the burger. The portion sizes were manageable....However they are pretty proud of their product($$).          The Employees and Beer selection make this an option if you live in the area and the interior is loaded with Tv's if your trying to catch your favorite sporting event. I wouldn't trek across town to try it however when your in the Silverado Ranch area certainly is an option.

fo-KEPxobk7QfgQfLN6d0g.text: Wasn't sure what to expect going in. I heard good things from friends in California. The one thing I wasn't ready for was the prices. While the food was decent the prices made sure I will not return. Two of their cheapest burgers with water to drink came to over $30. Food quality was better most than other burger places but not good enough for the prices. I will never pay $20 for a burger in a strip mall.   That being said, again my only hang up with this place is the money. If you have disposable income, this is a burger place for you. If not, it's just not worth the price.

9vE2e9Z8ZxUdag_2F7CF7Q.text: Alex was amazing, loved his laugh, great personality. Highly recommend. Great burgers too!

klhnZTqaLXho9IoK1Z4qYg.text: Everyone go see Kat! She is amazing! Best bartender. Super friendly. Local gem. Glad we were able to meet her. Is honest about what to order and what not to order.

1Ppn88FpQZ4gKsENDiRdLg.text: Visiting Vegas for Super Bowl and went to Slaters to watch the game. I'm pretty picky when it comes to service and we had GREAT service. Everyone was friendly and Ana was such a great host. Our weekend has been super enjoyable thanks to the Slaters 50/50 team!

52BgB3FBzHFuAJ6LuXinsQ.text: Oh. My. Goodness. The 50/50 burger is outta this world. And the Pb and jellyousy burger is really great!!! Aaron was great!!!

30XuZum16jsoJ2-oyE_i_g.text: Yes. Eat here. Yes.   Thank you Kat for the incredible service and recommendations! Absolutely loved my Lone Star burger. One of my top tens. And the sweet potatoes fries! Holy shit. Didn't get a chance to try a shake but definitely coming back for one.

ffvHyuwF5eVaARqcg1yTzg.text: Three of us met here for dinner recently.  We tried a number of items and shared everything.  Even with that, there was some food left when we were done--something that's rare for us.  We ordered:  1)  Pork-a-palooza--Bacon Salt & Vinegar Chicharron, Salted Caramel Bacon Kettle Corn, Sweet & Sour Agave Pork Wings, Crispy Pork Belly with Jalapeno-Bacon Jam, and Slater's Giardiniere.  2)  Bacon mac and cheese balls 3)  Best Damn Bacon Cheeseburger and regular fries 4)  P.B. & JELLOUSY burger--Black Canyon Angus beef, thick-cut bacon, natural peanut butter and strawberry jelly on a honey wheat bun with sweet potato fries and pumpkin sauce.  We also got the dip of vanilla ice cream to go with the burger. 5)  Bacon Chili Crunch burger--Black Canyon Angus beef topped with melted cheddar cheese, Slater's bacon chili and a crunchy layer of potato chips on a brioche bun with lettuce, tomato and red onions. 6)  Ultimate S'more shake--Toasted marshmallow shake, marshmallow fluff and crumbled graham cracker crust, topped with toasted marshmallows, chocolate syrup and a campfire roasted s'more. 7)  The King shake--Peanut butter and roasted banana shake, with peanut butter and bacon crust, topped with caramelized banana, chocolate sprinkles and smoked bacon. 8)  Happy Birthday shake--Funfetti shake, vanilla and Jolly Rancher crust, topped with sprinkles, Twinkies and a cupcake, finished with sparklers.  Slater's 50/50 means that their burgers are half ground beef and half ground bacon burger patties with some strange (different) combinations making up some of the burger choices.  The mac and cheese balls were like I've had before but the pork-a-palooza platter was really good especially the crispy pork belly with jalapeno-bacon jam.  By reading the descriptions, you can see that all the dishes have bacon in them in some way or another.  The only burger that was a bit off-putting for me was the P.B. and Jellousy.  Peanut butter didn't do it for me with it's mixing with jelly and the burger.  All three shakes were very good.  They all had good flavors but my favorite was the s'more shake.  Really good flavors.  Next was the King shake.  Service was excellent.  They moved us two times so that we could be out of the sun.  The restaurant faces east/west and the sun was going down and coming directly into the west facing windows nearly blinding us.  Shades are on order but they are a custom size so it will be a bit.  That will help.  Alex, our server, was top notch.  He answered questions, took our orders, and coursed the meal between the pork-a-palooza and the burgers.  It's an interesting concept and a very tasty one.

DbeJVpmN4Cz4xlwo8aGwlQ.text: Amazing, flavorful burgers with the ambiance of a sports bar  I tried Slater's on a Saturday afternoon during the Dodger game and I enjoyed the ambience of this restaurant. This is definitely not a place to enjoy a quiet, romantic meal, but rather expect a great burger with massive flavor for a great price. The only thing stopping me from rating this place a 5 star is the attention that our server gave to us. I had to get up twice to ask for extra napkins and to refill my water. The server did not follow back up with our order at least once.   Pros: amazing burger wanting me to try the exclusive whale burger; amazing 50/50 patty  Cons: par, bar style service

photos.caption: Photo of Slater's 50/50 - Las Vegas, NV, United States

2FeATU91QYwpsdY1XLAcDw.text: Finally a bar/restaurant that will have staying power at this location.  50 unique beers on tap.  Amazing burgers!!!   50/50 bacon n burger!   I've only tried 5 so far but they've all been amazing.  Great food and incredible service.  The manager even came around to ask how we were doing and to offer any feedback.  Super friendly and recommended downloading the app.  Thank God I did!  A rewards program that you can actually use!   Team all that with the super friendly and personable bartender Kat and you have a winning combo!   Kat is fun, outgoing and super attentive.  I think I just found my new favorite spot!   Thank you.

photos.caption: Photo of Slater's 50/50 - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 50 awesome beers on tap!

pOD3eUaabyGzuVP5iv2Jwg.text: This place is definitely cute! They have board games as well and beer pong and cornhole! Our waiter was extremely nice(Freddy). As for the food, I totally suggest getting the vampire dip! It's beyond amazing! The maple bacon wings were great too but my wings weren't cooked all the way.As for the entrees, well my order was wrong. We used the sheets on the table to order our burgers but it seemed like the sheets were not identical as it causes some issues with our orders. One sheet will tell you burger sizes are single double and triple patty. The other sheet just has weight of the patties on there. Of course mine had the weight in there and I ended up with a double patty. That didn't really bother me. I was missing the bacon, mushrooms, and beer cheese from my order. Then I was given my missing items and had to add it to my burger in my own. For $26 dollars that was kind of annoying. I was just there to have a good time so there was no need to cause any drama about it. I really enjoyed our waiter and just wanted to leave. My experience was not the best when it came to the food but Freddy was a delight.  Update: Sooo update. We went back and had an absolute BLAST. Our server Tarek was amazing. He didn't realize we were coming back because of our last experience. Once again the vampire dip is a MUST HAVE!!  My burger was made correctly and Tarek even helped me create a delicious combination! Also that Burger with the pineapple and spam?!! That should be there all year! Thank you so much. We are definitely coming back.

GL8znv4hNiTZutiLIuH5Cg.text: I've had Slaters before in Cali but I dont remember loving the burger and now I remember why. It's the 50/50 part.  First of all, the Vampire dip is a 100% must have if you like spinach artichoke or garlic. The bread and pita are a perfect vessel for cheesy goodness. I cannot say enough how much we liked this one.  However, none of us really loved the burger, and it was mainly because of the patty. The 50% beef and 50% bacon idea is a little too salty and doesn't have a pleasant texture. I've simply had much more enjoyable burgers than this. Perhaps I will try the regular patty if I go again but I'm not sure I would because it is on the pricier side for burgers.  I actually enjoyed the sweet potato fries with the pumpkin dipping sauce more than the burger itself. The regular fries came with an odd ketchup that I didn't really like - it was too sweet without the tartness.  All in all our experience was average at best. I can't recommend it over Bachi or Steiner's for a burger, but I could be tempted to go back for some Vampire Dip.

tqL496uUxUzGPjoeelYd-w.text: I absolutely love love love this place! their impossible burger is the best I had in a very long time! their beer selection is phenomenal and so is the service of our favorite bartender Freddie! He is the best! awesome personality, approachable and super professional! One of my favorite bars nowadays because of him! Cheers mate, Salud!

xXs6MVFNkvVgmuqY3n7WeQ.text: Found another great new bar in Vegas.  In a area that was much needed too.    It's a very cool place with a lot of beer on tap and great food.  The service is pretty legit too.    We came here and had a burger, tots and the "pork-a-palooza".  Everything was great and I'll have to come back soon for the desserts.  The people at the next table had a mouthwatering huge shake with all kinds of stuff on it.    I enjoyed a couple great beers and was most pleased to find Boulevard from Kansas on the menu.  Awesome.

K5v342Q4lm-D9E7NTdcp5g.text: Great spot in SW Henderson, not only for burgers. Great selection of beers, as well as other menu options. Great entrees and salads. Freddie was the bartender the night I visited. Great guy! Offered me a selection of local beers.

4fWyJtsbojXhnoC5HIwARw.text: First time here!  I was pleasantly surprised!  The burgers are fantastic!  The service was great!  We sat in Kim's section!  She helped answer our 50 newly questions!  We have already figured out what to try next time!

jhZwpv1mZF1mKjIuYHxFuA.text: As much as the food was super delicious, I have to share my not to great of customer service in which my group and I received today. Definitely at most *2 STARS FOR THE SERVICE. Our server, Raina, was far from personable, friendly and genuine- slightly shocking because no where during our visit were we rude or showed any dislike to her. First of all, there was no real welcoming smile, and when we told her it was our first time she still showed no enthusiasm, as if she didn't wanna be there. Biggest pet peeve was how long it took for her to deliver my husband's drink from the bar. She said twice how she would check on and deliver his drink, yet we saw it literally sitting on the bar counter for almost 10 minutes. Like seriously?- oh and mind you it was not busy at all, with maybe 3 other tables in the entire place. Next, she made it super awkward when we asked for take out boxes, and when we only used one of the three she had asked if we wanted to keep the other empty ones and had this weird attitude? Idk, it was just super awkward from the get go and she truly ruined what I thought was going to be an almost overall 5 star experience.  If you're someone like me, I'm very keen on the complete experience, it's not just food for me- it's how you make me feel during my visit. Don't get me wrong this wasn't the worst server I've ever encountered but she made it THAT memorable in a bad way that I just have to share.   Moving on to the food...  We tried the following items:  1) Slater's 50/50: 5 Stars. The party is 50% Beef and 50% Bacon! Yes you read that right. The patty is cooked to perfection with a nice medium rare pink center. This was so flavorful with a mixture of textures like an over-easy egg and fresh avocado. I would totally order this again.   2) Nashville hot dry rubbed wings: pricey at $11.99 for 6 wings. Worth it? If your in dyer need to eat wings otherwise spend your paper on a burger.   3) Spicy Artichoke Dip: very, very flavorful but rich and heavy. Would I splurge on this again? No.   Besides the lack of customer service received, the food is pretty good and I won't let the lack of customer service stop my from visiting again.

kQYdbWC91cxOQ31ZIgY0dg.text: In California Slater's is one of my favorite restaurants, do not waste your time going here! My family came in to eat late Friday afternoon and was seated promptly. Then we sat there for 20 minutes with out ever being acknowledged by staff, other people who have been seated after up already had water, drinks, and had ordered their food. We tried to flag down a waiter and every one just kept walking by to attended to other customers!! No help no service after a long wait we had to leave, I had a toddler who was begging for water and we couldn't even get that. Do not recommend! Not family friendly, not worth diving from north vegas. Go somewhere else.

By9k-NNCINIQW4JiEW7DkA.text: I and a friend have been in a 17 year contest to find the best burger in the US...thanks team Slater I just won...David had to admit that this was a great burger and best so far in 17 years...an excellent waitress Lisa recommended the Hi Brow...the burger bacon mix was excellent...served cooked to perfection and as much as we both hated to admit....beat those great burgers in Texas...the manager came by and another waitress Arielle all followed up....thanks great burger...

i9-Wi7jO07YibRUMtE7rXQ.text: Large list of rotating beers, giant milkshakes, and burgers mixed with bacon. Need I say more?  Came here with my husband late on a Saturday night and had wonderful service from Freddy.  This is not our first time here, nor will it be our last.  Try the Vampire Dip!

06ceZ0wkNaWRndYO74PhgA.text: Food was pretty good tried a flatbread, Mac and cheese bites and my friend had a burger with fries. Service was a little slow but would deff come back and try again

i1d-uOsc4_B0GI5oY6apIw.text: My boyfriend and I had to update our review tonight after returning.  Their happy hour is awesome 2-5 and 9-close Monday through Friday! We are absolutely blown away by the bartender, Freddie. Not once did he ever feel like asking for another beer was forced. He kept good conversation and seemed to really love being here. Our food was sooo good and I'm so happy that they now have the option to build your own option that they didn't have when we came here for their opening. We are Vegas locals and cant wait to come back and enjoy a knights game and have a couple beers.

e5H_Buamb9oRfTYommokUQ.text: Freddy was the best!! Super friendly and offered tastes of all the beers I wasn't sure about.   Maple bacon beer would be great with pancakes!  Vampire dip appetizer was ! Nashville Chicken sammiche was !  Will come back! Do recommend 10/10!!

oDdqhPMOjDP6g7L2zWE1pA.text: Always order the same thing, with a variation in entree. But this time I was totally disappointed with my salad, Buratta strawberry salad with arugula and kale. This time they forgot the arugula, only so much kale you can eat and the buratta was thin.          Sure Andy at 50/50 and by the way it has arugula

GsqBDiAqkNckpAnvH1RkgA.text: This place was absolutely amazing! We pretty much decided to go fully out of the way from the strip and had our first Vegas meal at the new Slater's location and we WERE NOT disappointed! The service was excellent and our server Kaitlyn was super sweet and accommodating. We had wonderful conversation and the staff was very Informative about every menu item. This was unlike any other place I've been to! The food service and atmosphere was fantastic and would love to come back again. I'm from New Jersey and only pray a Slater's opens up near me sometime in the future!

tab7BONW0iJVDo83WO2wtQ.text: Renee was a fantastic server. Very friendly and courteous. The food at this place is great! Katie was also a great bar tender as well as the small latina bar tender.

m7-OglB3-5GPAR6TbtIClQ.text: I had a wonderful experience this evening.  The staff was amazing our server Tarek was outstanding   A great asset to your company. The food was delicious. Everything we ordered was awesome. We will definitely come back.  Highly recommended

rtbA-MtIUziim_AnHuUSgw.text: I ordered a strawberry and burrata salad Friday afternoon on the 12th and got home to find not one drop of burrata in it. I called and spoke to someone who then put me on hold to find someone (not sure who). Then another lady comes on and asks me what I'm calling about. Like seriously? I just explained it! Ridiculous. Amateur hour. I hope the owners train their staff better than this. After being frustrated with those two, David the manager called me to apologize and offer a replacement. Which was fine but I wish I didn't have to go three people deep to figure that out. The people answering the phone should be trained on how to talk to customers. The salad that I did get was pretty good. Would've been excellent if I had my burrata! Anyway, David called me later on and even offered to deliver a salad himself personally. Which I appreciated. I still think there are some issues but at least he went out of his way to find a solution. That's something.

7zjeF5vRZxh_jXhomKmI-w.text: To be honest the place smelled really bad when we went in. My 14 year old son said "it smells like most bars" to which I asked... you've been to a lot of bars? Anyway we say down to eat. My burger I think they called it the best damn cheeseburger had supposed to be caramelized or grilled onions. They weren't very cooked either way. The burger patty itself was really tasty. Best part of the meal for me. My sweet potato fries were cold and instead of the pumpkin sauce they brought me the same bacon ketchup that my son had. When I say cold I mean not any heat to them at all (fries). My son had the 50/50 burger half beef half bacon ground. He liked it. I thought it tasted like bacon fat. Rich and kinda gross to me. And the regular fries were hot but probably frozen and nothing great. The bacon ketchup was lackluster. When he bit into the burger everything slid out of the bun. Egg avocado and patty. He had to reassemble to continue eating. Overall I won't be in any hurry to go back here. Was expecting to get sick from the food which did not happen luckily.  Hot food served hot please.

N_Mi0W8he79ZnproxaO3CA.text: Great place !! Todd was our server & was great!!! Draft beer selection was great. Yummy bacon action!!

gqRXlxMJqvrXg95aho9pkQ.text: Cat was AMAZING! very attentive even when SUPER busy. Loved her personality. Definitely made our dining experience great. Plus the food is DEVINE!

fjYJ1H98lljqnqmcevO7NQ.text: Had Kat as a server and she's amazing!! Definitely visiting again. Great service and great food! They have a ton of drink options and your most definitely will not be disappointed!

6DRqWbU_52JlnjBoDRipcw.text: Vampire dip is all I've got to say. That stuff is gold!  In fact I prefer most of their apps to the burger itself. Good place to go for football Sunday (come hungry). Was very excited to see a new location open in Vegas as I used to live near the Huntington venue. They are also available on Postmates if you want to order in.

PJ8VRZ38wfoJTFwcDTAZ6Q.text: The food was good, went for lunch so I didn't have any beer. They had an amazing selection of beer on tap. Will go again for dinner to enjoy a few selections.

Cns_HcG7-nSeXGfSrcGK4g.text: If you are in the mood for bacon - you will get your fill from Slaters. The place is cool and has so much potential to be a really great sports bar. It has a great beer list that is really solid and a buy one get one free during a game is a good promotion. You just have to double check your bill to make sure they follow through on this. The wings are good. The use of the Hot liquid cheese is good on some items, but on the star items of the menu it is a little disappointing. Onion Rings were also very good and shakes also were very solid.   Service is a bit spotty. The burgers are where this place should be making a big name for themselves and for the money spent - a $10 + burger and not being a bigger burger cooked to medium rare than a In & Out Double Double - which is actually better straight up. I would think that if you are getting a burger that costs this much, the server would ask how would you liked it cooked - when this was not asked - it should have been a heads up that something was a miss. A brioche bun is great, but not having the star of the show being much larger a single patty that compared to Wendys just had to be a mistake. It was tiny. Seriously, this hopefully was a one off experience on the burger side. as the place if they turned up the volume when it comes to big games - has the chance to be a run away hit to watch a game at. Adding thick bacon to a burger that is nearly as thin as the bacon as your lead burger - there has to be some room for improvement. There is too much potential not to fall into the trap of the Planet Hollywood expensive hamburger at what should be a really cool local sports bar just because of bacon being the star of the rest of the menu.    Slaters has so much potential, I hope we were an outlier when it comes to the experience. The menu could be up there with a Culinary Drop Out if it improves and will be a run away hit over other places in Vegas to watch a game.

Wy3ixOXIHHrPMWH_YYWCkA.text: I've been to the San Diego location 6 times and this one really let me down. I was excited about Vegas finally getting their own Slaters that I raved on and on to my friends and family about it. To keep it short the food was not quality. The buns were soggy, burgers were flat. The cook had the audacity to burn all of our patties and still serve them to us. Even my daughter's sliders were burnt. My shmanimal fries had maybe 5 crumbs of bacon and did not contain the sauce that comes on them. They forgot my gf bacon on her burger too. This location lacks the customization aspect we got at the SD location, the menu has no pictures of their burgers on it and they don't even ask how well you want your patty cooked. I'm sad and disappointed. I hope this location improves so I can enjoy Slater's more than once a year when I go to California. That being said I appreciate the manager addressing us and hope she can find and train better cooks. Any cook who loves what they do will never serve such a disaster to their guests.

lvJ9Qm8qi4ljl027ZaqNPw.text: We seen this restaurant on the 3 news morning show and thought we would give it a go. Place surprisingly for lunch was not all that busy and we were seated right away and drink order taken. We ordered water with our drink order and never received the water and beer had a huge head so I lost a few ounces of beer. So I am paying for foam and I here "the next will be better"  So that was the first screw up, not by are waitress but the person delivering them. Placed are order for an entree and it came out wrong and warm. "Not good" Main course was delivered warm and cold on the same plate. Salad made with wrong dressing, 50/50 burger had no flavor and warm, fries cold. My spaghetti and meatballs had little flavor, tiny meatballs that are warm and overcooked cold spaghetti so I suspect the meatballs are cooked in a microwave. Our waitress was very apologetic and kept saying "Next Time you come back"  We eat out quite a lot and I assure you we will not be back even if we are offered a free meal.

_sU49icdWmV986mABp4TCQ.text: If I could give them negative 100 I would..everything was terrible and they got nerve charging $15 For a burger..Go to Jack in the box next door..much better..this place will be out of business within 6 months with their terrible food and extremely high prices..

HCThhyRXF9EkGs2M84jVwQ.text: Best experience thanks to Ish and David. The food was amazing and they had a great selection of beer. Oh ya and all the bacon  ! Thanks  guys

uXmQEPPQTC89RjdOPj182w.text: First time here ! The food was incredible and service was amazing! Ask for Lisa when you come in bc she was the greatest server !

ZYiiMswImRU4-GfPD0oXVg.text: Seriously....as a bacon lover this place was amazeballs!! Sat at bar and the service was amazing.  They definitely have not only the coldest beers and the porkiest pork-a-palooza, but the dirtiest martini ever! Thank you everyone. This place should be slammed!  3 great TVs and multiples throughout the place for watching all the games!

Wf9-jNyyXMTjfmRk7esS1Q.text: Try the porkapaluza. The pork belly is my faveeeee. Shakes were perfect. Out waiter Todd was fantastic other than him being a Packers fan everyone was nice. we'll be back to rep the Steelers !!!!!

fI0CtQADcLqPoXuC3v5sNw.text: Went to Slater's last night and the experience was exceptional! Lisa was our server and took great care of us. The food was delicious, and the beer selection is awesome. My only complaint would be that we didn't know about it until now! Otherwise we would have been in sooner. Better advertising to let the rest of Las Vegas know you are here!

HsB673vX27uQzbJM1Sue8g.text: Portions weren't as big as I would have thought for the price but I did like the food. The kids meals were pretty dinky for $7 . The service wasnt the greatest but not terrible either. There was some unique things on the menu, I would possibly go back .

F8QSpwoK0P4aRvNUZrhlDg.text: We've been to Slater's in SoCal and loved the experience all 'round.  No different now here in Vegas!    Everything from the hostess greeting to the Beer Tap Tunnel and the happenin' ambiance.    Then we meet Gabriela.. this girl is awesome.  The service, the laughs, the beers, the food.  Not to be beat.  Just order the Vampire Dip and Balls.. then the Original 50/50.  Don't mess with perfection - that's why it's called 'perfect.'  Welcome to town Slater's.. we'll be seeing you again very soon..

bwx37UWSgqVf92GsHfVeeg.text: What can I say about Slater's 50/50... if you like Bacon, and I know you do, this spot is for you. I had the B. B. B. Bacon burger... one word mmmmmmm, the staff was friendly, the portions are generous. This restaurant is in a strip mall, but Is fantastic on the inside... let's all hit up one of my new favorite spots! Only oin Cali, Texas, and right here in Nevada... great place!

photos.caption: Photo of Slater's 50/50 - Las Vegas, NV, United States. This is a fantastic place! The food is to die for, and the TVs are everywhere, if you miss this place, you are missing out!

tmSPyZQhE6vndIwhHdelzg.text: Always a great time! Love how amazing the staff is here!!! Great place for a drink on draft! Food is also great! So excited we finally have a slater 50/50 here in Las Vegas !!!! Must try!

v0eCaPxVccXfTNcGN-kqVw.text: They didn't have any lunch specials very overpriced I split a burger with my sister and we got two sides of macaroni cheese balls bill was 37 bucks looking wrong the food is super good but not $37 worth!! one hamburger two sides and one drink

photos.caption: Photo of Slater's 50/50 - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Not worth $37 overprice splitting a burger with my sister
Photo of Slater's 50/50 - Las Vegas, NV, United States

HqbYSOF7DvkoKmrMzBG2TA.text: Everything on the menu is delicious and the service is exceptional. Our server Sega was fantastic and I'll definitely be coming back. I recommend the bacon burger, the chicken strips, and the sloppy joes.

RvM7JT1mb_r0qN2dbDmdfw.text: Went here for my birthday dinner and I was not disappointed!   Now let me preface this all with I was under the influence of low dose edible marijuana. (It was my birthday and I do what I want.)   I've been to 3 other Slater's locations, so I knew what was up with their food. If you don't know, it's delicious. 50% beef, 50% bacon burger patties is a brilliant idea and has yet to disappoint. Before I went in on that though, we started off with their Vampire bread bowl dip. GOOD GOOGLEY MOOGLEY was this good! You get pita chips to eat with and some veggie sticks to put on the table next to yours as decoration. Order it and thank me later.   I can't speak about the prices because of previously mentioned reasons, but also, it was my birthday and your tab should be picked up by those that are with you on your day. That all said, this is a "shut up and take my money" kind of place.  I don't drink, but they did have a pretty incredible beer selection along with some foo foo drinks for those that are into that. (Don't act like you don't know what I mean by foo foo drinks)  Now, everything's been super positive, but I gotta mention a couple awkward things that for me, warranted a start deduction. First, we were sat directly next to people. When our waitress came to see them, she had to really squeeze and she was a pretty fit girl. If I were to have stretched my arms, I could've given the woman next to me a wet willy to her opposite ear. For me, I don't like that. Not when there was other space. Next, there was a weird moment where our waitress came, took our drink orders and got them. But in the short time she was gone, another came and was talking to us. No biggie. Thought she was just given us the Slater's breakdown of what they're all about. Then as she was asking us what we wanted to drink our original waitress came with them. They had a weird interaction and the second waitress all but stormed off. In the state of mind I was in, I thought it as funny, but in recollect, really awkward. Lastly, we almost ate the table next to us's food. (Us's? Lol) they brought us theirs and it was almost our order. Luckily we didn't touch it and it was sorted, but I feel like if we weren't seated so close to someone who clearly had gotten there a few minutes before us, it would've been completely avoided. Those things individually wouldn't have warranted a star deduction, but all together, had to drop it like it's hot.   TL;DR Food good, prices fair, seating situation awkward.

bPC0PmWaXqBP7gXo5FsOQg.text: The only memorable part of my meal was the pumpkin sauce, and how it reminded me of thanksgiving. Other than that, I wasn't impressed. I had the bison bacon burger, in a lettuce wrap. It was quite messy. They use an abundance of sauce on their burgers, so trying to pick up my burger was not going to happen.

Cqkk18zbfOD0BkiRDwvsnA.text: Super cute local spot! Their Mac and cheese balls are amazing! We have had the pleasure of having Freddie taking care of us a few times now and he is absolutely amazing!! They also have a delicious breakfast menu and BOTTOMLESS MIMOSAS on the weekends!!! :)

bGRYzGqI0oijiIwB1lbejw.text: I just had my first dining experience at Slater's and it was so much fun! We sat at the bar and that place has such a friendly neighborhood vibe. Kat was our bartender/server and she made us feel instantly welcomed, made us bomb drinks and recommended some delicious items from the menu- definitely recommend this  place and can't wait to go back!

owS4YvswH78Q6o8aeRBaog.text: We always  look forward to coming back to this restaurant. Our server, Tarek,  remembered us and our orders from our visit several months ago,  which was amazing. The service and the food  was great and we look forward to coming back soon.

b7jLSkU_t7KsXieY87CcMA.text: Love this spot since moving to the area... Everyone is great!   Genesis, Katie, Taylor, David, Kat etc.. Bottom line, the staff make the location a place for me to want to be..   Food is great if you're looking for the burger variety. Recommend the vampire dip and resonate ipa.  Come on down!

BR6w2qw-Gqjv8XiYF9hB9w.text: Great food and beers!  The burgers are completely customizable and are really quite delicious, especially the vegetarian options since there really aren't many at most burger restaurants.

xW2GtCtAt3v-OWwu5TpFDw.text: Fantastic place to eat, hang out and watch the ball game.  The staff is very friendly and ready to greet you when you walk in.  The beer selection is huge.  Food is great with the beer.  The owners make you feel welcome.  Recommend this place 100%.  Be back soon.

ikhcLRmAySXnvBofC0n_mg.text: Cait was our server and was amazing!!!  Totally love the bacon salt too!  Bison burger was delicious... will have it again.  Our new place for great burgers and atmosphere!

photos.caption: Photo of Slater's 50/50 - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bacon Salt... yessss!

-ituB7_Z7k-5KS3VBxgfcQ.text: New business in Vegas so I hope the management team sees the review and works through the kinks. The service would benefit greatly from some support staff. Mainly a food runner/busser. A host to greet. And especially having a manager presence on the floor. I came in as a party to 2 on at the end of service on a slow Halloween night. I'm not going to go into great detail being that I've been in the industry for 7 plus years and may be more observant then typical guests. Also it's a burger and bar spot. Nothing crazy. But when the burgers are 15 bucks, off strip, in Henderson it's gotta come through with some quality food.   We each ordered two different 50/50 burgers and fries. Was warned prematurely about how they will come out with some pink in the middle. All goods. Having an open kitchen window means I can see exactly when my burger is up dying in the window. Burgers sat for awhile while the server was in the back making shakes i assume. Greeting other guests and cashing people out. Mind you it was a slow night. So we watch as the burgers sit in the window. Maybe we're waiting on some fries to complete the order? Nah the fries have been done and sitting in a silver bowl. The server eventually throws the fries on with his hands and here comes the food. My burger had an egg that was popped by the knife and lands at the table in a pool of yolk. Oozing chipotle aioli everywhere. Way too much. The avo spread stuff was all over the place as well and was quite bland. Bread was stale and crunchy either because it's old or because the heat lamp killed the food. The fries were so floppy and soft. And the burgers were super pink. Like all pink. My lady couldn't stomach hers so she left hungry. Luckily they took her burger off. I managed to get mine down because I was really hungry. But we ordered them medium. Curious as to why they're so pink? I've had all pork burgers before and they can be cooked up to temp. No one working had an answer as to why they are so pink and soft. All anyone kept saying was it's half pork half beef. But when you cook ground pork it changes color right? Like beef does? The server was not good. The other girl working that came to grab our plates as we left was very nice and apologetic. Obviously is considerably more personable and experienced then our server. Would post as one star if it wasn't for her. I hate doing this but I figured I'd share my experience. We will not be coming back.

BD5sGYC_c28D9rhBi1MeEw.text: Nice hangout spot with games!  Music is a bit loud with a few tvs for sports.  Not too impressed with the food, but then again I went really really late (10pm).  I did however like the Veggie Flatbread.

j2jVoB2kMLGREoxtlM7Ccw.text: They just opened in our neighborhood and why not go try it. Went on a Thursday night and it was good. We decided to get the sloppy joe sliders, bacon Mac and cheese balls, and the pork a palooza. The sliders were juicy and the the bread was soft Hawaiian bread. The cheese balls were good but you need to dip the sauce. The pork a palooza was great. The chicharron was the first thing we tried and I told myself next time I go to the Latin market is to get some chicharron lol. The pork wings was good but kinda dry. The bacon  jam and kettle corn was on point. I did not eat the giardiniere because I wanted the bacon lol. I will be back to try one of the burgers but overall the food and service was very good.

W4LMY4toGmLnFYCYuWzWng.text: Went in today (7/25/18) for a soft opening, and was most definitely not disappointed! Understandably they were still getting everything in order but everyone from the front desk all the way up to the manager were very helpful and friendly! Our server, Alex, was very knowledgeable and helped make our decisions easy. I tried a PB&J burger with a scoop of ice cream on it and it was so much better than I could have hoped for! The flavors mashed so well together and the fries came with "bacon ketchup" which was delicious. I will definitely be back to try more things (or just get that same burger again every time) and to try the milkshakes!

fW9Iut8ZIQ0-j6SOv7D81g.text: This has been the third time here and it gets better every time. The brussel sprout appetizer is amazing. Their shakes are a meal by themselves! Nicole always gives us the best service and recommendations.

Woo-FJgJbV-VxJkzkzTTBQ.text: This place was so good! I ordered the BBB Burger and Jeff was our server. He was so helpful and knowledgeable about the menu. He was so kind. The food was amazing. Especially the bacon ketchup (my friends didn't enjoy it as much because of the sweetness). I would definitely recommend this location and ask for Jeff.

AFqD4jYJ_ZmBQmnzC-fAlQ.text: I love David!!! He is the reason I came back, and brought my girls! DRAGONS MILK FOR LIFE

BdsHm59tWbhfdS0WxFM0jg.text: This was amazing and my boy Tarek was a complete legend. Every piece of food consumed was thoroughly enjoyed and the gold burger was super schmakin. High key recommend this restaurant as it is really good and service is also.

L1kZk_b9FeuCMZeMDV_bXw.text: Rich delicious perfectly prepared food. Double fried chicken wings were heavenly. The original is a Great burger. What a flavor profile! And mopping up yolk and avocado with the brioche bun is a joy. Great service and presentation. The side salad is beautiful and the blue cheese dressing had hunks of cheese the size of golf balls! Top 5 burger all time.

rJdnwgX60_tVjIIvBz8OwA.text: Great place for a burger, I've gone to the one in San Diego and this place has the same quality but with less people. Loved our Lisa's service.

9Pei-BJXoQv8Ql6b5w_CTQ.text: This was our first time here. Place is pretty cool and the menu has you wanting to order everything because it all sounds sooo good. I had the 50/50 burger and it was delicious -- the meat patties tasted like they were freshly made and buns were super soft. We also ordered the nashville hot chicken wings which were tasty. Unfortunately we didn't get a chance to try the shakes but they look amazing.

ENuze5EjrdUWzrySHdIRCQ.text: Quality food with excellent beer selection right around the corner.  Staff was friendly and service was great.  Check it out.

jIJNcHbjZ6HPTYTMy1GVzw.text: Gabriela was such a friendly and attentive server! David the manager was also great, as he made sure every table had their water re-filled and even gave me a sample to try their other non-beer beverages since I told him I didn't care for beer too much. I really enjoyed their watermelon beer but I'm sure there's more I just didn't try! Place was big and clean! They were busy since it just opened but didn't wait more than 15 min as they estimated for our party of 7! Their menu is all about their burgers and brews. I had their Hi-brew burger which was bomb! Their buns were nice and soft, and meat so juicy! Tried their Mac n cheese bites which were crispy and hot inside just the way it should be. The dipping sauce had a perfect spice to it and we asked for more to dip our fries with! One negative I will say is their French fries maybe because they had to make massive amounts to accommodate the people there but a bit on the soggy side and they don't give you much.   We got the s'mores milkshake which was yummy, but a bit runny and not as thick as a milkshake should be! I'm not a bacon on everything fan but if you are, this is the place to eat!   We will definitely have to come back for the awesome ambiance and food! Great for large parties and families! Finally a great burger joint down the street!

UfMPAdguavVUUO19AT30uw.text: We ordered through Grubhub and got wings, vampire dip, frickles and onion rings.  The food came promptly, the order was correct and the food was good.  The reason I am giving a 2 star is because I felt straight up ripped off on the chicken wings.  $12 for 6 wings.  Yes you heard me right, SIX wings.  $2 per wing, what a joke.  They were good but not that good.  I will try them again and write an updated review on that experience, but first time around was disappointing which could have been avoided my them being more clear on the item descriptions.  If they told me they were going to only bring me 6 wings I would have ordered something else and probably enjoyed it.

oVmzWZNs7GWZX-xtScjWoA.text: Just enjoyed the bacon cheeseburger with the impossible patty and gluten free bun.  It was juicy and delicious.   GF bun was soft...   Nicole was our server and gave outstanding service.   Will definitely return.

6AiTnjtVxaB0WfIXD00Icw.text: I haven't tried their lunch or dinner options, but as for the breakfast the service was poor. The server acted like any request was a bother. He didn't ask how we wanted any of our orders, just assumed everything. We didn't want to ask to exchange the runny eggs because he would again act bothered. The food was OK, but the morning server needs to show some enthusiasm

SLyPBbYiMLnGaBR4G5pv2A.text: I got the buffalo burger......which was really good....and the sweet potato fries.....which were kinda mushy.....and the Vampire Dip......which was pretty bland.  You'd think with a name like "Vampire" it would at least be spicy.  It wasn't.

4HejUkuzIhwG9H5lN4BvFw.text: Yes!!!! So happy we have one here! I've been going to the one in Huntington Beach for years! Love their burgers. Unique concept of 50% hamburger and 50% bacon. Fun place, great food and awesome staff.

DZGRuWaSOcVLW7nvo-5WPg.text: Great food. Great service. Great beer selection. The club thing is cool, 30 bucks and you get a beer a day, pays for itself in 5 beers, that's awesome! The hi-brow burger was delicious, meat cooked perfectly, great horseradish aioli, bacon jam and arugula.

_5dP7yubdlMlbMK7K-dCOQ.text: Great atmosphere, great burgers. Todd was an awesome server. Recommend the OG 50/50 burger. It was tits!

K8PfEE-8q0eQ1EVXfvwJtA.text: This is by far the best local hangout for REAL beers and phenomenal food!   Melissa the bartender is awesome and knows more about beer than any bartender than I've ever met.  Skip PTs or Bounty Hunter or any other smoke filled place. This place rocks--best beers, best burgers, and best wings. Give it a try and you won't be sorry.

5v-g2QDdemBx5roB1EiRxw.text: Tonight was our first visit to Slaters 50/50. Great food,great atmosphere and awesome staff. David made us feel like family and Lisa was a great server. We'll  definitely be back with friends. Thanks for a fun night.

zb6O74RGbvuENiC38A7hYA.text: This place was amazing!  Took my son for his 8th birthday. Our server Lisa was awesome, super attentive even though the restaurant was slammed. All of the food was great. Even the salads were tasty.  Don't skip the sweet potato fries with pumpkin sauce--to die for!  So glad this restaurant is on our side of town, but it's worth the drive for the food.  Also...if you drink beer they have a great selection. The specialty drinks also sound good. Check this place out, you won't regret it!

qmkcWpkNz2oTLdtsbnX3TA.text: Ordered the house burger blend. They came out looking raw so was very skeptical and asked the server to Re-make using traditional ground meat. They came out much better. We asked to add lettuce, tomato, and pickle. When the bill arrived, there was a $1 per each additional item on each burger. So 2 burgers with fries, 2 beers, tax and tip totaled $55.00! Sorry Slater's but it's one visit and done.

fs_G6FXFNAop0TeDCkUFiQ.text: So excited to have Slaters in Vegas!! The food was excellent as expected and the service was even better! Our server Nicole was great. She took great care of us and made perfect recommendations! Try the PB Jellycious!

rVi7ifgFqFXTxZbJ7r9pQw.text: The service and food were awesome!  It's a non-smoking restaurant with crafts beers, no gaming, but that's ok. There was a kid menu.   We had the 50/50 burger with a side of bacon ketchup and it was GOOD!!!  Our server, Aaron was great too.  We'll be back

ffwGXJ4aebbrX24jSlYcaw.text: Great food, awesome beer and Kat is awesome!! Love Juice and Paleo Porter are must drinks!

iPFsiQj11MJxlnwe9STx5g.text: Still a big fan of their burgers. Got the bison & bacon but the extra patty made it difficult to eat, one patty would have been perfect. The ultimate BLT salad was delish, it's enough to share with four people. The bacon salt goes with everything, I bought one to take home. Beer sampling is a fantastic, the manager was super friendly and offered us tons of samples. I am not a beer drinker but it was nice to try ones that were infused with coffee. The ahi poke salad was also delish, but I would rather have it without the crispy rice noodles.

3F8RisOZSXI-GrXA1wZHCQ.text: Disappointed big time. For a burger place the burgers were terrible. Our waiter didn't confirm how I wanted mine cooked and the menu said all 50/50 would be cooked throughout- yet both my wife and I had raw meat. Hers was actually cold in the middle. We never saw our waiter again to tell him, not that it would matter. The atmosphere is very loud. With a fooseball table when we walked in I knew I was in trouble. This is a place parents bring their kids so they can drink and let kids run wild, I guess. The screaming and noise was awful.  The Mac and cheese balls were ok. Very dark, little burnt but okay. When I got my bill I just wanted out so paid as fast as I could. Will never be back, even IF the food was good I'd avoid it because of how loud and awful the atmosphere was.

7IQFVTleuM4TPtwlbNsacQ.text: About four years ago, over Labor Day weekend, while living in Saint George Utah I decided to go for a drive and found slaters 50-50, after driving 6 1/2 hours... This was one of the best burger shops I have ever  been too, service was amazing, the burgers were outstanding, and they even had a bacon shake that was awesome. Definitely worth anybody's time and money, You won't be disappointed.

r8nZQ9lawlx452ZVPCls6A.text: This place was awesome! I came in with high expectations as I've heard great things and left completely satisfied! The menu has some really cool items I can't wait to try on my next visit. The waitress was very kind and answered multiple questions about menu items we had. Thank you Slater's!

photos.caption: Photo of Slater's 50/50 - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Flashover Burger

iccPPppLSkFCdR9d25Fpag.text: Came here for lunch not too long ago, I had been wanting to try one of those 50/50 burgers for awhile. The place was not too busy and we had great service for our meal. The 50/50 burger was not as amazing as I had hoped, I pictured a fat juicy bacon flavored burger but the patties are actually very thin and not juicy at all. I would not order it again BUT everything else was amazing. The fries, the sweet potato fries, bacon ketchup, and the ranch dressing (I judge places by how good their ranch is) were all so delicious. I would go back if in the area, I need to try some of the beers next time. They have so many different beers

V1WXl0qr21wQSUrPG_87vQ.text: Ask to sit in Cait's section- she is nice and will take care of you.  Impossible burger is on point! I ordered it Original 50/50 style and it was yummy. It came with avocado and fried egg. It was so good that my little guy who ordered sliders ended up eating half of my burger too!

px7BFzPbJEg1sWCa6JnCZg.text: Omg food coma! The mac & cheese balls were delicious (thanks Nicole F.!) I created my own burger, and I must say the highlight was the addition of Vampire Dip as the cheese option - it was toasted and sooooo good! Aaron & Freddie were great, and very friendly to have as our servers. We will definitely be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Slater's 50/50 - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Custom turkey burger with 2 kinds of bacon, Vampire dip, and potato chips! Beer cheese fries on the side, with a Hazy Little Thing IPA.

El5prbibLYnLoS3gTlHmpw.text: Was late, I was tired, wanted to order out, so I said hey lets give them a try. SMH...  I should have really paid attention to the menu, Ingot the "Original 50/50 " no avocado or egg, and I ended up with a patty, cheese, and a bun, with chipotle mayo that was VERY bland... not to mention the bun was bigger than the burger, and I guessed it right  1/3rd patty, my bad I thought it would at-least come with lettuce and tomato nah..  But heres the thing, I ordered the spaghetti and meatballs, it was MEH, typical delivery spaghetti, but the thing is the meatballs tasted completely different than the burger, like they had a strong smokey flavor to them, as the burger just tasted like a great value frozen patty, I'm convinced the burgers are frozen, and they add liquid smoke to the meatball mixture cause bacon has a smoke profile but not that damn strong.  Lastly, i got the fries bacon chili cheese style... BRUUHHH.  That mess tasted like some canned hot dog sauce topped with some nacho cheese smh   I dunno how this place is rated so high, the food is not good at all, maybe most the folks had a few of the many beers they offer before eating ....

Told our waitress Arielle who basically did nothing but joke with the staff in back. No management came by after discussing with our waitress.  Very disappointing. Not worth the hype.

The dip that came with the fries was perfect, but it wasnt ketchup.  I ordered the double patty and did not regret. Check in for beer.  Highly recommend the dragon breath

ajYqpHReDLeQdg2SqU01Wg.text: Stopped in with colleagues for monthly Happy Hour, however, not real HH specials apart for 2 for 1 on cocktails. Impressive craft beer selection on tap and bottled. Only tried the Southern Pimento fries, a bit messy but good. Our waitress was very friendly.

photos.caption: Photo of Slater's 50/50 - Las Vegas, NV, United States

_5fQ74_zt3vHcvxze6IswA.text: Meh. It sounded better than it was. Burgers, bacon and beer. Score on the beer. There are so many on tap I did not bother to count them!  Plenty of tv screens for any game you wish to watch. No gaming and no smoking, so I'll call that a win. But I stop there. Got the "crispy" Brussels sprouts which were not crispy but loaded with oil, sauce and bacon. They were good but a healthy food gone bad. The burger-oh no. Got the 50/50, half beef half bacon, patty. I was concerned it would be overpowered by the bacon but in fact it was hardly noticeable.  The patty was much smaller than the bun, realized in the final bites when I was finished with interior and left with extra bread. Sigh. The burger was a bust. Two of the three words in your "gimmick", one would think you would be focused on making the best burger in town. This one will not win any awards.   Want to really blow up your calorie count?  They do have an impressive looking milkshake menu. Saw one come out to a teen at the next table.  I'd love to be 15 again and indulge, but these days I battle the bulge in a daily fight (I win), so it is a pass.   In closing, I will walk here for beer and the game but eat elsewhere.

photos.caption: Photo of Slater's 50/50 - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Wear your gear for free beer!  Saving grace.
Photo of Slater's 50/50 - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Backyard Classic Burger with 50/50 patty. Sweet potato fries and beer.
Photo of Slater's 50/50 - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crispy Brussels Sprouts are a brilliant starter!

k62fTqXz6cG7csro8G40Ew.text: I always appreciate a place that can make a good burger. We tried the bbb burger and it tasted like they ground, seasoned and formed the patties themselves. I love when a burger tastes fresh and unprocessed. It came out perfectly cooked and seasoned. We also got the tenders, they were delish, reminds me of homemade tenders. They were fried to perfection and had just the right amount of crunch. The waitress was friendly and engaged with us. We will definitely be back again.

PJKrlmIQO0M5-uIK5Dkv7Q.text: The food was so good!! As a vegetarian it was great being able to build my own burger with the impossible patty. My boyfriend is a meat eater and absolutely loved all the options and the Hawaiian burger he ordered. The only unfortunate part about the visit was that the AC was out, totally not their fault but I look forward to going back when the AC is back on.

IrEfcFg1uNW18eYNk4OlQA.text: Best Burger spot in Vegas hands down.. Kat is amazing with all the Beers on Tap she will find you 4-5 new Beers that will be your new fav. This place is  for OTS(off the Strip).   BONUS no smoking  Freddie behind the Bar will take good care if you also.     You can't lose at this place !!

photos.caption: Photo of Slater's 50/50 - Las Vegas, NV, United States. At the bat with KAT

KKvbV066EkIxMelhG4Fqag.text: Another visit to one of my favorite California chains, now nestled inside the Silverado Ranch area :)  Arriving early to try some of their newer brunch options, all time favorites were also ordered as well as a new "Vegas special" burger :)  The latter known as the "24K Burger" : 1/2lb Australian Wagyu Beef Patty, Brioche Bun dusted w/ 24-Karat Gold, Billionaire Bacon, Bacon Jam, Baby Arugula, Roasted Garlic Aioli, Truffle Cheese, Demi Glace, Sweet Potato Fries w/ Pumpkin Sauce. The show stopper, underneath the unnecessary gold dust is a well crafted burger, great quality meat, rich & fatty! Bacon jam adds some sweet to a very complex & delicious burger :)  For brunch, you can't go wrong with either :  Fried Chicken & Bacon Pancakes : Fluffy Pancakes w/ chunks of Bacon, Fried Chicken, Country Gravy, Sunny-side Up Eggs & Maple Syrup. Quite a bit going on, just dig in lol.  Pork Belly Benedict : Crispy Pork Belly, Poached Eggs, Chipotle Hollandaise, Freshly Baked Buttermilk Biscuits & Tater Tot Country Potatoes. Great brunch choice, love the tots, crisp pork belly marrying into the hollandaise.  And no matter the time of day, Garlic fans...don't forget to order your :  Slater's Vampire Dip : Roasted Garlic, Artichoke Hearts, Melted Cheese, Sourdough Bread Bowl, Crispy Pita, Carrots & Celery. A must order every visit, "vampire worthy" garlicy cheese magic in every bite!  Enjoy!

hTsRkKyt4xQIcos2c31wHA.text: Very interesting menu, great variety of beer to choose from! Staff were friendly and helpful!   Good ambiance for hangout with friends and family!

X0_cJQ4-z-GAJ2Zt3hNhbw.text: Originally opened by Scott Slater in Anaheim Hills in 2009, and now occupying 467 East Silverado Ranch Boulevard since July, it was in search of someplace showing the NCAA Tournament that Slater's 50/50 was visited on Sunday, a "Wake N' Bacon" Breakfast beginning at 9:00am on Weekends strangely ending at 11:00am but owner Andy graciously agreeing to prepare a couple items thirty minutes late in addition to some of the Lunch & Dinner choices.  Famous for their blend of 50% Beef / 50% Bacon, and now inhabiting three States including their lone Las Vegas franchise, it is between walls of taps that guests enter suite 100 of the Southeast commercial center, a hostess podium straight ahead offering seating at a banquette with full view of at least a dozen televisions plus the bustling kitchen.   Showing sports with the sound off, pop radio overhead loud enough to be heard but not disrupt, it was with greetings from an inked female sever who stated Breakfast ends "at 10:30" that Water was poured and menus distributed, her apologies noteworthy as she tried to make the situation better by offering alternatives including some specials.  Disappointed but not dissuaded, miscommunications overcome while Appetizers were being prepared, it was beginning with a stack of Onion Rings and Slater's Bacon-imbued Fried Macaroni and Cheese that light Batter proved noteworthy, a follow-up of Ground Beef and Bacon with Potato Chips added for crunch also enjoyable and certainly better than the average family's "Sloppy Joe night."  Convinced to try the Vampire Dip by two regulars, fears of late-day reflux unfounded as the roasted Heads are nicely tempered by a Cheese blend and pureed Artichokes, it was finishing off all but a quarter of the Bread Bowl that The Slater's 50/50 Hot Dog arrived, the eponymous ingredient here packaged thick and snappy with a Sonora-style wrap plus plenty of Condiments so that diners may dress it as they like.  More impressed by Slater's Fries this time, both classic Spuds and those made from hand-cut Sweet Potatoes crisp and well salted, it was at the request of a friend that Slater's $24 "24K Burger" arrived spotlight-ready, a dusting of edible Gold making for fun pictures while the Sandwich itself shines thanks to finely-ground Australian Wagyu that stands up well to truffled Cheese and Bacon while the buttered Brioche Bun maintains its structure admirably in the face of Aioli and Demi-glace.  Waiting a bit longer for Breakfast items, made-to-order Hollandaise with more smoke than heat largely responsible, it was likely an effect of time that saw "crispy" Pork Belly a little flaccid atop Buttermilk Biscuits, though Tots in a tangle of Onions and golden-fried Chicken with Two Pancakes, Country Gravy and plenty of Bacon proved well-worth getting up early on a Sunday for.

srWUe3iPB_rtHyA6jyhswQ.text: We celebrated our Friday with a trip to Slater's 50/50 on Friday 8/2/19. We arrived around 8:45 PM and the place was hopping. We sat at the bar where we were greeted by an attentive, empathetic and fun bartender. She was upfront about it being busy and she was honest about how to expect a small wait. She made sure to give her patrons their drinks first to keep them happy and quickly added food orders after that. Of course the food and drink were delicious and on point! She was working hard and continually thanking everyone for their patience. For the most part, everyone around us was friendly, happy and rooting her on. Thank you again, Kimberly, for a great last minute date night. You truly were the B-B-Best!

IyQZ5w4F_hDr3gkYuy2WQA.text: This is our first time at Slater's. Tonight was trivia night which i think is genius! The food was out of this world and the shakes are incredible. If you haven't been i highly recommend you go!! Tarek and Nicole were amazing!!

BqSxekpw_oui77uirxLsbg.text: Great place to enjoy with the family.  We stopped in with our two boys for a beer and some dinner.  Nicole helped us out and was great!  We'll be back soon!

qGwUxm_ZPaEnAqcqjXHmiQ.text: OMG - fabulous burgers and sides. I wasn't brave enough to order a shake or dessert but those I saw pass by looked AMAZING! Friendly service for a full option menu at very fair prices - can't wait to get back and have already started touting the venue to friends.

Kmwe_qUZoDwlBXg7-rpMxQ.text: Let me say that I'm not a huge fan of bacon (unpopular, I know), but I will keep coming back to this place for the bacon. Which is good, because it's in everything, and it's amazing. The burgers are delicious, the Brussels sprouts are killer, and they have a solid beer selection. Our server Kat was fun and friendly, and the bartender Katie can draft a mean sour. Or at least half of one... Consider yourself lucky if either of them are around when you go, and definitely try the 24k burger.

ay-XN8nvUUYvsHrhAsDRDw.text: Burger infused with ground bacon? How could you go wrong?! The bacon milkshake wasn't my taste but the burger was awesome and the bacon salt on their fries were amazing! My girlfriend definitely enjoyed it a bit more than I did because she's a bar fly and I like quiet restaurants but the food was amazing!

9a5swL8xYCBEMGY8X5b9eA.text: Kat was the best bartender! She knows her beer and helped me find vegetarian options on the menu. She is badass and I'll be back to hangout for happy hour with her. Best service.

AyixC4OtoVaLGKoDN_UspQ.text: I don't know where to start....the never ending choices of beer, the amazing service, the mouthwatering food! This new restaurant has quickly become one of our favorites! Dining in is always fun, I enjoy the ambiance and my husband loves watching all the games. Good for kids too! Every server we've had goes over and beyond our expectations.  Must try :PBJealousy the sweet and savory mixes so well in this burger I crave it pretty regularly! The vampire dip is also one of our favorites as an appetizer. The Nashville rub wings pack a punch of flavor! There is a golden Knight beer that we found here that is a must!  We also order them Uber eats for those days we want to stay in.

ePJP51iqWqBmdkD_EGsGJQ.text: This place ROCKS! Haven't eaten there yet, but the networking event, with exception of the Realtors event, have been well attended.  I get the Realtors not attending. These guys bust their rears all day long and the events start to late for most.

kySq1X4rULRCqhCiEAyX-w.text: Pb and jealousy burger awesome ! Waitress Katie great service and recommendations. Food had much more flavor Vegas strip restaurants.

hHioN1wEF1nfsLo5Ydlpcg.text: Went to Slater's 50/50 for celebration.  Waitress was sober and pleasant, food was good and different than normal burgers.  They had kids meals which ours loved.  Many of the burgers were upscaled burgers from local places but on steroids.  Atmosphere is very sports pub but not as dark as some I have visited.  Worth a trip to the south end of town.

i0sP4nSzc_Mk9oenuiOVBQ.text: Awesome burgers and a great selection of beers on tap. I will go back often. The only down side is that it gets pretty busy and they don't offer reservations.

WD07L47PA1iqAib7cnJGAQ.text: Great service and amazing food. Glad they opened one here in Las Vegas, finally. Right when I move back here! Ask for Genesis, she's all sorts of fun. Great personality, funny, and overall amazing. Thanks!

7KQcm-FV1q-bb2qsdobrNw.text: I love my fancy burgers and I think I've found a new place in town to get 'em! Been to Slater's 50/50 twice in the last week. Went in on the review recently from the Las Vegas Weekly to try the recommended vampire dip. So good! I'm not a fan of sourdough as they usually serve it in a bread bowl but they were nice enough to replace it for me. More cheese fondue than avocado dip, but I love it. Came back with a bigger appetite to try a burger. On recommendation from Genesis I tried the P. B. And Jellousy. She told me it was her favorite as well as the dip so it tried it. A bit adventurous even for me with Black Canyon Angus beef, thick cut bacon, natural peanut butter and strawberry jelly on honey wheat bun. Just the right balance of delicious flavors instead of making it over the top. The sweet potato fries with pumpkin sauce were also groovy. With definitely be back to try more recommendations. Such a great experience.

soqL-MrvpBtFpbTMYzHK2g.text: After eating here last week I know 2 things are True: 1) PB, J and Bacon on a hamburger is F****** delicious and 2) our server Lisa was sober as a judge.

bVLkdJWm9tCaTVIzFxMaDQ.text: 2nd time here. Wait for food was extremely long on first visit, food was good.  Because of long wait, we were given $10 coupons for future visit.  Just left on a Friday afternoon at 4. Again long wait for food despite being empty.  Ordered grilled chicken sandwich. Wheat bun was hard as a rock & chicken extremely dry.  Hamburger just so so this visit.  Glad we didn't pay full price due to coupons or would have not been happy. Server Stephanie was nice & attentive.

QRl-fNUy-_I9tdmGrfXx6A.text: Slater's was a good surprise. I really like the renovation that they did on the inside and all the tap handles in the entrance were awesome. We sat at the bar and both of the young ladies behind the bar did an excellent job with customer service and conversation. We ordered the vampire dip, Brussel sprouts and the PB&J burger. Everything was very tasty, the burger was a bit over cooked. Overall good experience also good beer selection and Sunday ticket.

SAlxKed0gJ_ifW78xBA74A.text: We ate here for the first time and were very impressed with the food and service. Our server Kat was awesome!! She took her time reviewing the menu and making recommendations. Hands down best burger I have ever eaten!!  The atmosphere is fun and laid-back. The place is very clean. Dave the manager checked on us to make sure our meal and service was to our satisfaction. We greatly enjoyed talking to him. We will definitely return to this wonderful establishment very soon!

Go in and see Tayler the Bartender she has amazing service and is a Las Vegas Native with a personality to match. Not to mention beautiful. The only reason why I didn't give this place 5 stars is only because there is NO HAPPY HOUR!!!!! Which is important to us Vegas locals especially when you first open so we can find out more about it. Also the windows needs more shade because I basically had to wear my shades at the bar. I'm sure management can fix this easily. Comment cards would help as well. CKczDmWM2r3WQqW868Xsbg.text: Trying Slater's 50/50 for the first time. Hubby wanted to watch GSW game for date night and this popped up on Yelp with a pretty good star rating  near home so we decided to give it a try. Atmosphere seemed pretty laid back. The hostess greeted us upon entering and we were immediately seated at the bar. Freddie our bartender and waiter introduced himself almost immediately upon us being seated. FREDDIE IS AWESOME. He was very helpful when we couldn't decide what to choose. And he knows how to mix a great cocktail. David the manager was great as well. He was very involved with what was happening around the restaurant and making the patrons feel comfortable. We ended up ordering the Slater's Porkapalooza, chips and salsa and 50/50 burger. It was all tasty. My husband being a pork fanatic enjoyed every bite. Kind of sad that you can't order the Sweet & spicy agave pork wings separately because they are DELICIOUS. We will definitely be back again.

TwMLMVs0nFi2MyxKDry-2g.text: Pb&j burger with bacon and ice cream is super tasty. Lots of beer options. It was crazy busy and there were some issues with our large 6 person orders but the waitress did everything she could to make it right. Definitely polite staff but, while you make your orders be sure to be clear on what exactly you want.

Tarek our  server was fantastic,he explained the menu since it was our first time there and brought our drinks right away and kept coming back to see if we needed anything durning our meal. We had the backyard classic and they were delicious. Tarek was very attentive and friendly. We will be back again. The atmosphere was nice there where you can enjoy eating your meal.

She was very knowledgeable about the beers and she let us try a couple different beers that she suggested for us. They have a Tangerine Wheat Beer that is phenomenal. Food is great too. We will be back!!!
