Jeff the bartender is great, he recommended the PB&J burger honestly one of the best burgers I have ever had! It's so accommodating since it's so close to where we live too! Definitely going to be a regular spot for us! And will come back for Jeff!

ktENUAWYQj5kclR4HzlTsA.text: Let me start by saying do not let the size of this place deter you from going.The food is phenomenal and the staff is great too!I am not sure if the tall,Colts fan gentleman is the owner or manager or both but he definitely aided in our choice to return!Atmosphere is relaxed,easy going with a touch of a sports bar!Btw bacon central is located here...so good!Try the pork a palooza!Give it a go...Seriously!

u6lzkjq5PlTzK6x9Ln2-Og.text: Delicious! I highly recommend the strawberry pop tart milkshake and sweet potato fries!

D6Is8wzVOBQ8QyhPCElVDw.text: A must try. Awesome food, great beer selection. Thanks Jeff for the recommendations on our food order.

2wRZBICxnUH4taWNpVaG4g.text: Went around 11:30 on a Saturday. It wasn't super busy so we got sat down right away. They have a great selection of beer. We had the fried mac and cheese bacon balls. Came out super hot but didn't stop us from diving right in. Husband got the BBB burger and I got the original 50/50 burger. Both were fantastic and the bun was super duper soft! I got my fries covered in beer cheese. So yummy. I was hoping to save room for ome of their awesome looking shakes but was so full i had to pass. Next time I'm starting with it. This is a must try place.  I know we will be going back for sure.

dXa1X6naNv7GlbIL09E02g.text: My boyfriend has been a huge Slater's fan for years, and I am a recent fan. We previously only used to visit during our annual trip to Anaheim, but were both excited to hear that we were finally getting a location here in Vegas! The new location did not disappoint. The burgers are delicious and there is no shortage of bacon. The servers are very attentive and friendly and the atmosphere is super laid back and fun. Overall, it's definitely one of the better sit-down restaurants in the Vegas valley.

JKS73YyX1JXFMMUe6Jl84w.text: So disappointed with this new restaurant that took over for our favorite neighborhood breakfast spot. Ordered the sriracha burger, where do I start, for as much sriracha as the description states, it had no flavor of sriracha. Which, I really wish it did, because the actual flavor of the burger and bacon was disgusting, tasted like old grilled shoes.  That's the best description I can come up with. I did not finish even half of a half because it was so gross.  The second order at our table was the BBB Burger. Well, he's been sick since eating that burger and that was about 24 hours ago.  The taste was pretty much the same as an old shoe. The last item, a kids pizza. The owner or chef or manager, whom ever is in charge of the menu selections must not have children. You don't change a basic thing. My child who loves pizza wouldn't even take more than two bites. The sauce is super sweet and the crust was so thin the cheese and sauce just fell off when you picked it up or tried to cut it. So he ate French fries which were the only thing that were actually enjoyable besides maybe the onion rings. So one star for the sides. I was going to order a shake, which looked amazing but after spending $50 on food that none of us enjoyed I wasn't going to order anything else. All in all, will not be back.

lTfPlVj2-wdQZbDi932A1A.text: BACON, BURGERS,  AND BEER!!  What's not to love!! Checked this place out the other day and was not disappointed!! Beer selection is very good!! Glad to see the support to local breweries!! Poke nachos and loaded fries were good!! Looking forward to next visit to try the Burgers!!!

cc3OGOZ5Q4yK3Gs_S03mzQ.text: This was my first time coming here! I heard about it from a friend that was from california and they said the burgers are to die for, so obviously I had to try them out myself. Alex was my server and he did a fantastic job with everything from recommendations to the actual service itself. I got the burger with the bacon chili on it, and although it was kinda messy, it was completely worth it. Overall it was a great experience and I can't wait to come back and try one of those shakes!

POz08JubJeyKfWwXEoQ54A.text: This place is awesome. Just like I remember growing up in Anaheim Hills. The bartender, Katie was wonderful, attentive and engaging. She was happy to be there unlike some bartenders I've run in to in other establishments. Everyone must come try this place!!!

wqREzXTDYpmH8e91Dl3lAw.text: This review is strictly food based.... so i seen this place on my way home from work decided to go and give it a try.. the restaurant is super clean and nicely decorated... cool spot great beer selection service was good but the burgers were a HUGE disappointment... so the burgers are half beef and half pork.. you would think being a burger place the burgers would be good. Not the case, burgers get no temperature all well done had absolutely no flavor it seemed like the burgers didn't even have salt and pepper on them and they were dry not juicy at all ... i was expecting more from there burgers... shakes look amazing... save your 16$ and go to in n out lol

3kCo64QR0iO_Fz-DGLtRKQ.text: Was there last night and after hearing a friend question the price for the burgers, thought it may have more than a fighting chance to make it.  Positives: 1) Solid Sriracha burger - although it wasn't what I ordered, I would certainly get it again. 2) Sweet Potato fries - a very good fry, not just small pieces overly deep-fried. 3) Pumpkin dipping sauce for fries - just wow, a home run. 4) Very good beer selection. 5) Bartenders were very friendly and patient as we took our time with the menu (darn 1st timers).  Negatives: 1) Got the wrong burger - bartender said it was one of her favorites, think she just had it on her brain, honest mistake. 2) Fries were not hot - luke warm at best.  Overall, thought it was a huge upgrade over the prior tenant.  Can they keep it filled nightly, remains to be seen, but I will definitely be back.

Jj4ojld35on4lforlXzkgg.text: This was my first time here. The ambiance is nice and relaxed, amazing beer selection, and the menu has so many options its insane. Almost everything has bacon in it! Our server Gabriella was super helpful by guiding us through the menu and explaining the 50/50 patty option on the burgers, 1/2 bacon, 1/2 beef but they also have veggie and Turkey burger options as well which is great for people that like healthier options. The beer selection is outstanding and definitely worth checking out, I dont live close by but if I did I would totally do the $30 for a beer a day plan which is really cool. Melissa was also super cool too and brought us some beer samples which were tasty.. I'll definitely come back and check this place out..

e_JWk4HUl_-KYV56A8gKoQ.text: I love this place. Perfect for people who love burgers and BACON!!! I ordered the B'B'B' Bacon and it was so good. Will visit this place again soon.

loI_mAmRjvNvVjmTFxAFmQ.text: This restaurant has something for the entire family. The food is excellent but the service is even better.  Chloe is the best!!!! She was extremely polite, knows the menu and aimed to please.  Whether you want a hefty burger, chicken wings, spaghetti or Mac & Cheese you can't go wrong.  Just bring a good appetite, leave the calorie counting at home relax and enjoy!

yoa4JFicRZO_Bm2wSdD_Mg.text: This place is great. We started the porkapalooza and it was amazing. The burgers are very good and the beer list is impressive. Our server Lexi was the best. Highly recommend!

pomcnBT-21HayIsajLrX5Q.text: Great lunch today. They have been open about a week and everything seems to be running smoothly. Dave, the manager stopped by for some great conversation and introduced us to a Vanilla beer by Crafthouse. Our server, Todd, was very attentive and knowledgeable. We will definitely be coming again.

JNZnX9ZjFDwY_F34vRtsUA.text: Tried Slater's today and I must say the worst part of this restaurant is the fact that EVERYTHING on the menu looks delicious and it's hard to decide what to order. However, I ended up ordering fried bacon Mac and cheese with fried pickles for an appetizer, and I ordered the Hi-Brow Burger. The burger could do with a little less arugula however it was absolutely phenomenal. My girlfriend ordered the Lone Star Smoke Burger and she really enjoyed it. They have a large menu with an even larger Beer list. Definitely glad this place recently opened up, it's absolutely a place I will be going to not only try all the burgers but all the beers as well! Can't wait to go back!

uEcsPYmlT_kpoclI6pO1RA.text: Was pleasantly surprised . Thought it would be another burger joint.  Definitely not . Great atmosphere . Good service and really good food ! Will definitely be back

rgLg5llJwIVRLVPnN86ubw.text: Unfortunately went there last night!!!! Most of the servers and staff were just standing around. Looked very disinterested in being at work. Ate our food and wow, NOTHING SPECIAL. $ 15 dollar hamburger that you can get for half the price at Freddys or In-and-out,  and would honesty taste a whole lot better. Management was NO where to be seen and our server was an obvious buddy of his because the only reason I saw the manager was because the server mentioned something. Even when the manager came over, he said nothing to me lo ike you w ou uld expect,  like is everything ok, how was your meal, there was nothing...   Paid the bill left a tip and asked for a business card so I can let someone in corporate know how guest are getting "taken care of" at the Henderson location....... Look at several other reviews,  there are MANY other restaurants in this town that I am sure you would be much more happier with....

-u7dFjC8eLWu2a5fz7xPIg.text: Let me start by saying our server Melissa has been phenomenal (we've been here 3 times since they've opened and have been lucky to have her every time). The service was prompt and her recommendations were spot on. The food was also spectacular. Those 50/50 patties are to die for. I'll definitely be coming back for more!

_grXM3HqMlxmtTt4xZ39JQ.text: This is definitely my new favorite burger joint. My friend & I took a seat at the bar & we had the most awesome bartender. His name was Jeff, he talked us into trying something we would never think of trying... the PB&J burger & it was incredible. Can't wait to go back to see Jeff & try something new again.

cianlynLrLK5VgXyjZXi4A.text: Excellent food, great service and plenty of options if you like to drink beer. The wings are amazing and  they have flavored beverages that will quench any pallet.

OYpxwk9v1CevzrnhUceIOQ.text: Bacon, bacon and more bacon! This place is amazing! We were so amused by Lisa! We can tell she loves her job. She's happy, informative, entertaining and most of all honest. Lisa held a wallet & kept it safe that was left at the table by my sister. Thank you Lisa! This is our new favorite place to eat. Yummy food! Super friendly staff! Lisa, you can lighten up any room with your wit & humor. Thank you very much. We truly enjoyed you. See you next time we come in!

Y0fJCpsCAUTQmS91MCT5_w.text: This is one of my new favorite spot in Vegas to grab a bite to eat and to hang out with friends. Let's talk food as a starter our server recommended the vampire dip super cheesy has Roasted garlic and artichoke hearts comes in a sourdough bread bowl with carrots celery pita chips it's to die for definitely something you have to try, for burger I ordered best damn bacon cheeseburger it has Black angus beef with thick cut bacon, grilled onions, American cheese, lettuce, and thousand island on a brioche bun . ZrZhUk-v8qBmSNn0TstQLg.text: The atmosphere and staff is great.  Gabby was our server and she recommended vampire dip. She also was very attentive and got refills quickly. Great job Gabby!!It is outstanding. All good was tasty and I will definitely be back.

idR3s0OT8nsb6J-6RbW3LQ.text: Decent burgers, fries, and shakes.  Chicken lettuce wraps had very little chicken.   Service below average.

ffYpbBr8IwfAR3y6C_xKYg.text: Save yourself the regret .  It's bad bar food with Las Vegas Strip prices. From appetizers to entrees and burgers was bad. Im not trying to be mean but i don't believe in letting other people spend hard earned money over priced bad food. I can make the best of a bad meal but I don't think this place will be around much longer and you can feel and see it in the staff. Nothing personal, no one upset me, it was just that bad. Sorry

bMXrY-W1bX6dUDzCMSM4tw.text: You ever go somewhere for the first time and it's awesome, and then every time after that it goes downhill?  Well - that's NOT Slater's 50/50! The customer service here is amazing every time we come in!   We kept Lexi on her toes last night with 13 of us - separated into 3 different checks!  Every order came to table correct, hot, and delicious! My Pork Belly Grilled Cheese was delish and oozing with pimiento cheese!  My little had the BBQ Pork Belly flatbread - she loved it - I was secretly hoping she couldn't finish it so I could bring it to work today and SCORE!  She left me 2 pieces!!!  I will be ordering that next time. Hub had the Sciracha burger....and was asking about the 50 Alarm Burger, but thankfully we talked him out of that. There was also plenty of Dragon's Milk rounding the table. Ask for a sample when you go - you will thank me later.  Don't be scared - it's dark, but so good.  I don't even like beer but Dragon's Milk?  Yeeessss.    Thanks again to Lexi for the awesome service and for putting up with us!

dhi8spwZJNq0B0RXmtQRkQ.text: Kat is the best server at this place!!! You need to try this spot for the lettuce wraps, they are amazing

xq-0MfCvgDIedXylImgb-g.text: Our server freddie was da best the food was good to bad they were out of bacon lava cake though

2unNnFr6WC7RL5-7Dz68yw.text: Great burgers and flatbread.  Tons of beers on tap. Service was great.  The setup could use some work. The way the tables are set up didn't make me want to stay for additional beverages after dinner but everything else was great,

MrWuLoItht1_IjZQFT8IeA.text: Tried the Slater's in the LA area a few years ago and gave this new location a try. We got the BBB and Hi- brow burger with sweet potato fries and Slaterized fries. All tasty, but the food came out room temperature. The fries were not steaming hot fresh and the cheese on the fries solidified- probably from sitting out too long. The burger patties not piping hot either. Even though a food runner delivered our food, it got to our table too late. Food needs to be delivered to the tables as soon as it is ready and not let the food sit under the "heat" lamp. Overall restaurant appears clean, decent service and kid friendly.

9ZYPzK97SHeZ3bWN_0iGxQ.text: Our server Freddie was really helpful and always made sure we had everything we needed ! He's really nice and funny, so if you're seated in his section you're in luck! The chicken wings are really good and so are the sweet potato fries ! He'll really help you choosing something to order !

LD8AOv7YcyDTctGXLtU5eA.text: Fantastic food! Great gourmet burgers, awesome appetizers and delicious shakes!! We made our way around the menu tonight and started with the mac & cheese bacon bites, and the double down with freckles and onion rings, some of the best fried pickles and mac & cheese bites I've had! Went on to burgers and ordered the Bison burger, Crispy Chili burger, the Original and the PB & Jealousy al a mode. My mom and I split the Original and Bison both absolutely amazing! Great flavor profiles, different but so worth it!  The king shake was something incredible! Full banana, covered in bacon, peanut butter, whipped cream and peanuts...oh my!! We will definitely be back!!!!!!

hAtcWMxwpW3G7nx2jL47JA.text: I have been waiting for Slater's to finally open and now I'm here. This joint is jumping. I ordered the Original 50/50 burger and it's tasty. Half beef half bacon patty with chipotle mayo guacamole and a fried egg on a wonderful brioche bun. All the burgers come with fries and bacon catchup. Flavor explosions abound. If you need salt the bacon salt is on the table. I also ordered the maple bacon old fashioned cocktail. Awesome!! Really my only complaint is the french fries aren't crispy. They are soft and not very good. They put so much thought into the rest of the menu and they totally forgot the fries.

I got the Best Damn Burger, the Slater's Spaghetti + Bacon Meatballs, and the Strawberry + Burrata Salad. I loved the bacon meatballs!!! And I liked that there were lots of it, instead of 2 pieces like most spaghetti and meatballs. Wish they did cause the sloppy joe sliders were just ok but nothing I would order again. The onion rings were crispy and good, but, should have been served with the bacon ketchup (???) instead of just bbq sauce. The guiness  chocolate mint shake was adequate.  Overall, I am unlikely to visit again.

XMC_lv8mes9wjn1ArKdUDQ.text: Went there for my birthday on a Wednesday and it happened to be trivia night. I was pumped, but was there at the tail end so decided to sit it out. Sat at the bar and Cat served me and my girlfriend up with a fantastic birthday feast! I ordered the 24 karat burger and do not regret that decision for one moment! It was excellent and I was rewarded with the last lava cake with bacon that they had in the back! My boy who served me last time (Freddy) hosted trivia. He did a wonderful job and hooked us up for my birthday with a sparkler in my cake! I've been to the Pasedena Slaters and Vegas beats it HANDS DOWN! Met the owner and he took a pic for us! Will be back every Wednesday! Worth the drive/taxi from the strip!

WgVEvfufAiB8gZv-D-klng.text: Great selection of beer. Atmosphere is great, defiantly a neighborhood Bar with great service. Lone star burger and PB& Jealousy burgers where amazing. They have vegan options which is nice too. Service was quick too!

IlaFk0EnjW9I-RWCBqVo4g.text: Slater's 50/50.. that name is telling for this burger joint on the south side of Las Vegas.  Fun ambiance meets overhype at Slater's.  I'd give it 2.5 stars if I could.  When you walk in you're greeted by dueling walls full of beer taps from around the world.  A great touch in the craft-beer era.  The restaurant is well lit, and clean although it's filled to capacity.  The staff are hustling and bustling about.  Service is great here at Slater's; the good part of the 50/50 indeed.  The food on the other hand is average, maybe slightly below.  We started with the porkapalooza, which I must say was awesome.  The pork belly with jalapeno jam was the best thing I had all night, and it wasn't even close.  I would recommend this appetizer to anybody who comes to Slater's.  For the meal, I ordered the 50 alarm burger.  As a lover of all things spicy, I was hoping that this ghost chili habanero monster would be just what the doctor ordered.  Sadly, this burger is hyped on their menu as 'you need to sign a waiver to eat' but it falls well short of that level (P.S. I didn't have to sign anything).  Our waiter informed us they were out of the whole jalapenos that go on the burger and only had sliced. Ok, fine, no big deal.  The burger itself was lacking flavor, and would have been spicier if it had tobasco on it.  It was in desperate need of some crunch with a squishy patty, squishy peppers, and squishy egg on it.  I added the fried pig skin to the burger and it helped the texture and flavor a bit, but try as it might it couldn't elevate this burger to the $17.00 price tag attached to it.  The frys were golden brown and looked quite tasty, except they weren't crisp at all.  I think that the frys are as important as the burger at any self respecting burger joint, but that's just me.  The food is undoubtedly the bad part of the 50/50z  All in all, this great idea falls well short of expectations.  Slater's will be just fine as they are playing to the bacon and craft beer crowd, but I'd be happier and would save at least 50% on the bill by going to In-N-Out or 5 Guys.

photos.caption: Photo of Slater's 50/50 - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Slater's 50/50 - Las Vegas, NV, United States. No shortage of squishy textures here.
Photo of Slater's 50/50 - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 50 Alarm Burger.  5 alarm is more fitting.

By far the best burger flavors in Vegas. If you love bacon, come here!  Came back again today for breakfast- bottomless mimosas for me. 50 beers on tap- saison beer ( funkworks ) was great. Kay was our waitress - very nice!!

hAw0TNWaC01NM6NzP8Xs_w.text: Wow,absolutely horrible.First off the 12 year old little girl that took my order did not have a clue. Performance reflects leadership so obviously the people that own this just have a lot money and do not care.  Skaters you should be absolutely ashamed to be in business and I bet that this place will not survive one more year.. Do yourself a favor stay healthy and don't waste your time and money here... Absolutely,absolutely horrible...

photos.caption: Photo of Slater's 50/50 - Las Vegas, NV, United States. These were the fries and sloppy sandwich that we got.. Never again..

oLm5TiU1u2YjW3zTZBdbag.text: FIRST! May I just say this is if not the best burger place I've been to in ALL OF LAS VEGAS. 1. Their burger (The Original 50/50) is without a doubt the juciest / freshest and on point burgers with it's menu. The meat is soft and has such good texture and tenderness. 10/10 the egg is sunny side up with bursts of flavor. And the Avacado compliments every bite with freshness and rejoice. The onion rings are both big and good portions / exactly with the burger. To top it all off the dessert was the icing / frosting on the cake  their Chocolate bacon molten cake is by far and if not my favorite dessert I've ever had in my lifetime (along with cookie skillets) :) I highly recommend my friends and anyone to come here and try it. Once in a lifetime #YOLO

bajDhb7-5cx8a7lvHbQ9Gw.text: I am currently pregnant so you know I can't make up my mind about where or what I want to eat... We stumbled across this place, thanks to Yelp! I've been wanting a simple, yet gourmet burger, not from a fast food chain and boy did they deliver! We stopped in during lunch, so we were already expecting it to be busy. We were surprisingly seated right away and wasted no time looking at the menu. Everything we ordered was TASTY AND  DELICIOUS!! I was a tad sad that I was unable to order a draft beer from their world wide selection that they have.. but that just means I need to come back soon. The atmosphere is awesome. Great for families too, which is always a plus! Already looking forward to going back!

BPzR51UfrMZmFzpMRwcWVw.text: Random lunch stop and I got the Original 50/50 burger Its 50/50 beef and bacon blend, pepper jack cheese, avocado, sunny-side up egg and chipotle mayo on a brioche bun. Texture-wise it wasn't what I had anticipated - the 50/50 mix texture isn't like a regular ground beef patty so it threw me off. Taste-wise it was good. I got a side salad with my regular half thousand island half bleu cheese dressing and their bleu cheese is not watered down, its chunky and delicious!!  Got a spicy bloody mary to go along with my meal and was not disappointed!  Tarek was my server and he was awesome and attentive and checked on me enough and I didn't feel rushed at all. Excellent service!!

lpMEWvkXXME10J6JIYZ3Qg.text: There's a great vibe about this place.  I went here knowing they laid claim to the title "Best Damn Bacon Cheeseburger".  I partook in said burger, however I also tried their appetizer "fried Mac and cheese balls"!  I have to say I'm not a mac and cheese guy but anything fried is amazing and this was no different!  I have to give it to them, I loved this selection!  It is a "MUST TRY"!  Now to their "Best Damn Bacon Cheeseburger"...come on now, DO NOT make claims that are very rarely found and not live up to your own claim!  They had an extensive burger menu and after I ate said "Best" I felt like they took away from their own menu!  I would have tried any other burger to TRY Slater's fairly and honestly!  In my attempt to TRY a place, I eat the meal "as is".  The menu represented a lot of burger options that looked amazing.  I say all this because this was NOT the best damn bacon cheeseburger I've ever had!  I've had bigger, juicier and topped with more bacon!  At best I give it a 3 out of 5, middle of the road burger with bacon.  It came with bacon ketchup for the fries and that was ok.  Their sweet potato fries comes with an out of this world "MUST TRY" pumpkin sauce!  I'll be going back but solely to try another burger with those sweet potato fries and pumpkin sauce.  Service was a little slow and there was quite a bit of dirty tables when I arrived.  I sat in the bar area due to the dirty tables but that may have contributed to the slow service because I think the bartender also has to wait tables around the bar.  Not to sure about that.  I will be back though.  The place/meal overall was a definite 4 out of 5!

photos.caption: Photo of Slater's 50/50 - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Best Damn Bacon Cheeseburger
Photo of Slater's 50/50 - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bacon Mac and Cheese Balls
Photo of Slater's 50/50 - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bacon Mac and Cheese Balls

7OdZhq7VBjcHX8wiAcSSIg.text: KAT Is hands down one of the best servers I have ever encountered and that's saying a lot because Las Vegas has a lot of great service. She went above and beyond to the point where she brought napkins twice without us asking and she offered me a water to go because she remembered me saying that we live 35 minutes away and I had a long ride home. That is the kind of over the top service that you wish for every time you go out to eat.  The food isn't too shabby either. ;)  It's actually fantastic! I have the hardest time finding a Turkey Burger that doesn't taste like it was just pulled out of a freezer with absolutely no flavor in it whatsoever and I had a Turkey Burger that was absolutely fantastic. The rosemary parmesan bacon is so good and the pickled onions make it just over the top great.  My partner had  The Lone Star Burger with the barbecue sauce and onion rings and it was absolutely fantastic.   But absolutely do not leave here without having the Vampire Dip. You will be sad that you did not try it. It was so much better than I expected it to be and I expected it to be pretty great. I mean it's cheese and artichokes and garlic so what's not to love. I don't know what additional magic they put in there but it is phenomenal. (Fun fact:  You can choose vampire dip on your Burger as the cheese option).  We each enjoyed an Ace pineapple cider that was so good I cannot wait to have more.    A+ ya'll!!! See you again soon.  :)

photos.caption: Photo of Slater's 50/50 - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Look at that beautiful little golden gem of roasted garlic in my fries
Photo of Slater's 50/50 - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Close up of the Turkey Burger add avocado
Photo of Slater's 50/50 - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lone Star Burger with 2 patties and fries

yioG1pwXMlvyPkvNhGRmtA.text: REDEMPTION!!!   I was asked by the owner to give them a chance to improve our experience, and they totally redeemed themselves!!!   We arrived earlier than our reservations and the hostess let us know that our table was already ready, so she walked us right over and told us our server would be right with us. The store manager came up to us and said they were short staffed but he'd be more than happy to be our server.   I know being the store manager you have to have certain expectations as far as service goes and David went above and beyond! We ordered the Maple Bourbon bacon bone in wings and also some boneless Honey BBQ wings. They were nice and crispy and I prefer them that way. We decided to go with the Design It route for our burgers. Those never disappoint!   I'm so glad we were asked to come back, David won us back. He made sure we were well taken care of and I loved the fact that we wanted to hear me out about our previous experience with our service. He talked with us so much that my daughter even gave him a hug when we left, and she's super shy!  David and Andy, thank you so much for a great experience!

aPxT_-o1_QeqerFR6tPgaA.text: Outstanding burger and frys.... plenty of beers on draft to try as well. The price of the burgers and food is a little high but well worth it. All gourmet burgers

tW3jGMOBUWNnjmMZinGjPQ.text: I went to Slater's yesterday with my family and didn't care for it that much. We sat at the bar and Dana was our bartender/server. She was great! Very efficient and kind, also gave us some other ideas of spots to try out in the neighborhood. The food was as the part we didn't really care for. I had the quinoa burger... not my cup of tea. My mom had the hotdog and didn't like it. Our friend had a burger and she said the patty tasted frozen and was too thin. The reason I'm giving Slater's three stars and not less is because my father enjoyed his egg burger.   Their beer selection is nice. We loved the Tenaya Creek IPA... seriously check it out if you haven't.  It's a neat concept, you just check off the items you want on the burger and hand it in, just wished that the food was better. Bacon lovers will love this place... they even have bacon infused chili pepper jam. They have lots of games you can play- foosball, board games, etc. Also a decent sized patio to lounge on! I probably won't be back but if you love bacon... go.

4NwTCXzra4HSkjCASoQkiw.text: Tried this place with one of my besties and we both really enjoyed it  definitely coming back again to try that 24k burger  Kat was an excellent server and treated us like Queens

photos.caption: Photo of Slater's 50/50 - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Slater's 50/50 - Las Vegas, NV, United States. S&#39;mores Ultimate S&#39;More Shake

2pKgmkQxCndEPGZD4NJfgA.text: Uh AMAZING! Came here for my birthday lunch last week and wow from the server Kat to the food! It was great. We got the gold burger it was cooked perfectly the bun was so fluffy! Got the s'mores shake and she put a sparkler in it! The best service, the best burger!

gIJ8k1ssMHrYRbZc8txfNA.text: Looking for an informal early dinner, we tried Slaters 50/50 on the very strong recommendation of a friend. She did not steer us wrong. Located in a strip mall, there is plenty of free parking. The restaurant is huge with high ceilings and multiple TVs on each wall showing sporting events with the sound off. Dana, our server, was at our table right away, to get our drink orders ($2 off your second beer with a Yelp check in!). Getting through the menu to decide what to order is no small task. They do have a couple of salads if you want to behave yourself, but you don't come to a restaurant specializing in burgers that have 50% bacon in the meat in order to behave yourself. My wife and I decided to share the 50/50 Shroomin' Onion with a side of sweet potato fries ($15). Even a half a burger is large (see the photo). In addition to the 50/50 patty, the burger comes with sauteed mushrooms, fried portobello mushroom, caramelized onions, roasted red pepper, fried onions, and chipotle mayo. The fries come with a small side of bacon ketchup and a pumpkin sauce for dipping. Yup, it's decadent. But delish. They also have a huge selection of beers on tap, most of which I had never tasted. Dana was kind enough to bring a couple of samples for me to try before I made a selection.  For a sports bar atmosphere, the restaurant is surprisingly family friendly with at least half of the tables having at least one child (don't know if they have a kid's menu). Not the place to eat if you are watching calories or cholesterol. But definitely a fun place to eat for very tasty and somewhat unusual burgers.

1jLlhaA0uHyMbQ7PEl2LnQ.text: Been wanting to try this place. Finally got to since we were in the area(south point).   Beers and Burgers!!! Great selection of IPA!!! Great selection of different type of burgers - yes the have a vegetarian burger.   Kids loved their deep fried Mac and cheese.   Make sure you try their milk shake- yum!!!  Got their meaty appetizer- it's was very good.  Definitely come back to this place and try the other burgers.

qw8cy8ojQDhZ7GxbOAlLKg.text: That's too much bacon..said no one ever. This restaurant is amazing. The colors are bright clean and fun. It's kid friendly (I love the kids meals) the food was so good. I'm literally in a good coma right now/bacon coma. If your looking for something fresh with amazing food, cool ambiance, servers who are genuinely nice people then this is the place for you. I'm already planning my next trip back

9MFNXJgjrxDGkLyCvnhjow.text: Omg!! Best burgers ever and if you like sweet potato fries get them! They come with a pumpkin sauce for dipping and it was like eating dessert. You can also create your own burgers. In fact, the picture is of two burgers that were created. The Crew Burger and The Flash Over Burger. The atmosphere is very cool and the owner is so sweet. Our server Freddie was Johnny on the spot and incredibly friendly. This will now be our go to burger place for sure. Next time I'm going to save room for the s'mores shake.

BtoYZOkNsg-0QmeNyv646A.text: Tarek was amazing!!!! I myself am in the F&B industry and he by far was one of the best servers...super attentive to our needs, and awesome personality. I have an autistic son so it's always interesting everywhere we go when we eat out, and sometimes difficult, Tarek's kindness and understanding made all the world of difference and helped us have an incredible lunch. Definitely will be back and hold on to that server! You don't want to lose him :) Food was incredible as well! Highly recommend the Siracha Burger!!!!

QY2XUVqyhDz3JFA99YgUUg.text: B' B' B' Bacon!!!!!  That's the burger I went with.  I had a hard time deciding which one to go with, but I'm glad i went with the B' B' B' Bacon burger.  It was so good!!!!!!!!!!!  I upgraded my fries to onion rings, which was another good decision.  Perfect onion rings.  The batter had a great crunch and the onions were cut thick and held up well.  The 50/50 patty was super juicy and delicious.  Thick cut bacon and a perfectly runny egg, who wouldn't love this burger?  I will definitely be back to try a few of the other burgers.  I know I won't be disappointed.

-4XziikCRCGMnahuwFH68Q.text: A high end burger joint with an unusual twist....BACON!!!! If you love bacon the 50/50 burger is for you! Half beef, half bacon blended patty; great choice to make the meat in the burger the star rather than all the toppings that others use to inflate the price and disguise the flavor of the burger. Nice atmosphere and quality food in addition to the burger selection (Chicken Carb-o-nera).

5dwapIBSl0EMkpBsNDV4vQ.text: I never noticed this place until about two weeks ago, where we came to watch the Kentucky Derby, and I am really glad that I tried it out! Their milkshakes are a must try - I got the happy happy birthday shake that had real sparklers, two twinkies, jolly rancher bits and four dum dum lollipops.  The spaghetti and meatballs, though I only had the spaghetti, was also really good. Come try this place out, you won't be sorry.

ckrdUavSJBjmqZdTdDkTEQ.text: I'm staying a few blocks away after a work trip. I walked over for lunch and found this gem. I'd be a regular if I lived here. I tried the peanut butter and strawberry jam burger- sounds weird, right? Ya, it was different but absolutely delicious. Thanks to the super nice staff for recommending it along with her beer knowledge.

Yn_7wLbkjVST4XGTV6IAsw.text: Wayyyyyyyy too expensive.  $10.99 for a milkshake.     $14.99 for a burger..    this place won't last.  Will be gone within a year or two. Ridiculously overpriced.

YoiT-nMGRdz-0rGFojkldA.text: Holy smokes, this place is good. The Mac and Cheese Balls are incredible, the Bacon Flight is fun and delicious, and the Impossible Burger was fantastic (especially with bacon)! Go. Now.

ynXiom-yNBfdEv5TEdIjaQ.text: Being a Slaters fan, have been to 3 Cali locations over the years. This Slaters is a big disappointment.  Just a shadow of the Cali locals.  Burgers tasted good just good,  third pound before cooking, thin and dry.  Very little flavor in the beef.  Service was ok.  Place was half full at lunch time.  We were able to look over the menu twice and watch some baseball before server first came up to us.  Then there is the price, cost us 42.50 for one buffalo burger and one bacon burger, with 2 ice teas at 3.50 each.  Didn't get the $11 shake or the $17 bacon appetizer.  Traveled 20 miles for a burger I could get BETTER at multiple locations.  Red robin, fatburger, smashburger all better and cheaper options.  Finally if you are a fan on the original Slaters, which I am, were going to have to keep traveling to Cali.  The only thing that is the same is the name. No bacon maple Milk shake, no mac and cheeses, no bacon brownie. Just a below average burger joint.

NX6MNUFYgAWduSc8fG4Qog.text: This is not like the locations in California.   Service is very slow food very mediocre.  Overall go somewhere else if looking for a good night out

gI4BhPP0tUdgoNrpgdJO7A.text: We had a great meal of Mac and cheese balls, burgers and hot dogs. Try the tater tots with cheese and chili. Yummm!  Lisa was great in providing guidance on our choices. If you want something tasty for dinner with great service, you must stop in and enjoy your meal!

q6f_uoir3qJUR9PNup-diA.text: Our area has been need something new. This place does it. Thanks Lisa for your awesome service and suggestions. The food was great. Big portions so share.

uKz602ZMNYmxc-e7RCUuJg.text: The first time trying Slater's 50/50 was great for me! However not the best for my fiance.  First off, our waitress Lisa was great, very knowledgeable about all Slater's 50/50  has to offer. She was personable, friendly and attentive.  We started with the chips and dip. The chips were good, salsa was a bit watered down almost.. quest dip was ok as well. I was happy with it but found it hard to navigate around three giant jalapeno slices. Thinking next time i will try the vampire dip as a starter. A table across from us ordered it and it looked DELICIOUS! For my meal I ordered the hot chicken sandwich, with sweet potato fries.. YUM! I will be back for this! It has a great amount of heat for someone who enjoys spicy food. The chicken was fresh and crispy, not too heavily breaded either. I found the bun delicious as well, it was light however it held up well to the large chunk of chicken on the sandwich.  The sweet potato fries and pumpkin dip are delicious as well! Fried to perfection and lightly salted Truly like thanksgiving in a bite! Lisa was right( her suggestion). I will order those again too.  Now my fiance thought to "play it safe" and order something they are known for. He ordered the original burger and fries with bacon ketchup. My fiance was intrigued by the concept of 50 percent bacon and 50 percent beef. However was not blown away by the burger. I tried it and thought it was tasty however had much too much sauce on it making it kind of soggy. The fries were soggy as well so that was a bummer.  I am totally willing to come back and dine again because my dish was fabulous!  I look forward to trying the vampire dip as well as their shakes!  And ps LISA WAS GREAT!

y7fqddUcP7eMVTDKZ2lBzw.text: A great place to go for a burger and beer. Definitely bring your appetite, the burgers are generous and the beer is cold! Slater's has beers from everywhere to choose from. Close to home, great service and food. We will go back.

5GVvA2b_fsBElWggS-6jbg.text: Sat down at the bar and the bartender did not even take a drink order for 5 minutes and the place was not busy. Had time to fully examine the menu and even notice the B rating posted on the wall. End result was leaving without getting to try the food at this establishment.

mn1uNokLstFoIXOMSDFVGg.text: Amazing food & great service! Everyone at my table enjoyed their food so much we all ended up sharing!! I recommend the pork belly benedict  Their sweet potato fries & pumpkin sauce is like Fall in your mouth!!

OifbZHedPmVWp6W7RtNrRw.text: One star because the food was really good. Service was basically nonexistent. We saw our server once at the beginning of the night to take our drink and food orders. Never got a single drink refill. We've literally been sitting here for almost 20 minutes with our dirty dishes stacked up on the table trying to get someone to come take our money so we can get the hell out of here. They're barely even busy right now; half the dump is empty on a Friday night. Never again.

jhsCED2gnyY3ZErBiGGJIw.text: This was my first time eating here. Only reason why we will be coming more often is due to Taylor! Awesome bartender!

yh5Wl4ylRGQy26wt8Z9Vsg.text: First time here. Melissa the bar tender was very friendly and helpful. She answered all of our questions and was very patient with us. They have a huge selection of beer on tap and will even let you sample some. My wife had the 50/50 burger and it was delicious. Their sweet potato fries were awesome with the pumpkin sauce. Their green chili quest dip was very good. I would definitely recommend this place.

hdH3dse-0bA7tRv4YOu8vQ.text: Service was top notch! Kat was amazing and very friendly. If you try this place, you definitely need to request her. She was attentive and never let our bottomless mimosas stay empty. She recommended the garlic parmesan fries and they were delicious! Big chunks of garlic, so be sure to bring a mint for when you're done. Everything we ordered was yummy! The breakfast sandwich was my favorite. Can't wait to try a burger on our next visit! We will be back for another good meal and excellent service with Kat!!!

GGsy8fFrTosWpdkxxWOWSA.text: ....look at the TV screens on the wall...all the same size that circle the resturant...not that that is bad...just no additional effort to please...like the beer list that is right off the standard Southern list- no additional thought...the food is decent- yet its not a place you would tell your buddies about...but as others have mentioned the price...two cheap burgers and a couple beers $50...

3x6sqYRQkkkW1HfRgYN2rw.text: Tried this place the first time in San Diego. Excited to see the one here. Fantastic staff, Lisa was our waitress and she was great. Chatted with Dave about their beer selection for a bit. Wish there was one on the East side closer to us but we will travel. Keep it up guys!!

K6PWRE4mQXYt-1_vL7cGrQ.text: The Impossible Patty is by far the best veggie patty I've ever had! I had it on the Sriracha Burger and it was fantastic. The Vampire dip was also very good and great to share! The manager, Melissa was friendly and helped make our experience there great as well! We will definitely be back! Highly recommend!

NhCclH4qbmH7Vo2BozCLRg.text: Food here is great! The food is "heavy" though, don't come here if you are trying to diet! We have tried a few of the dishes and they were all very good and large portions. The spicy chicken sandwich is my favorite. Of course, who doesn't like a place with a ton of variety of beers too!

NDYgQe0UR8Q8Sg2OMDh2XQ.text: Finally made my way here, and am a big fan of Slater's from California. The location is probably the smallest one I've been to. Our server, Lisa, did a great job of keeping up with our requests, cheerfully. Food was good overall, I was a bit disappointed that you can't customize your burger at this location yet, as that's my go to (I was told they are still getting the hang of the regular menu items, they will eventually be able to custom make burgers, fair enough.) I didn't get dessert or beer this time, but I guess that's what I'll do on my next visit!

pnhdVpuPI9-fHi4nAYF_AA.text: Nicole was my waitress. She's the best one. The food was great, and we had great time at trivia. When you come here, ask for Nicole.

xjStGLBbbawFyIGP5KTrqQ.text: Kat is honestly the BEST! So sweet, & knows what's best food wise & beer.  There was 6 of us & she did great with the service & separate checks!!! Love her

ockdHogyeVOFmkAKt0gobA.text: Awesome. Manager came out and offered us bacon samples. What a way to start your visit. They have several flavors to choose from. You can create your own burger. Give it a name. Lisa is a fabulous waitress. We can't wait to come back. Decor is nice, clean and very welcoming. Saw this place on tv. Didn't know they had a Vegas Location. I'm in Bacon Heaven. Thank you.

fQ4nstVNzRYuaVMC5QUT8w.text: Staff was very friendly and often came by to check on us if we needed anything. The place was very clean and loved the sports bar theme they have. I had the BBB Bacon Burger and it was definitely one of the best burgers I had in a while. Overall, I will come back next time and recommend this place to anyone.

uEj8SfM6EtvQn_sOzsS7CQ.text: Ready to pay $15 for a burger off the strip?  How about $3.50 for fountain drinks with no refills?  Want to literally bathe your hands in grease?  This is the place for you.  Tldr: bad food bad service bad prices nty

4Y6HTZ8wM8iVBEkJRIKswQ.text: This was my first time here and I will definitely be back! Kat was amazing and helped me choose my beers and lunch (FYI their chili burger is awesome). The beer list is huge which is how I chose this place and I will definitely be back!

N4tEIp4U6TJEn711N4AtOA.text: Arrived around 11:45am on a Saturday . No one else waiting to be seated but it took a about 7 minutes to be acknowledged and seated, and this was by the bartender. She was very friendly from the start. There were only about 4 other tables with customers but looked like only one server. Around noon, two other servers appeared. Our server, light haired female was friendly, however she didn't know the menu. Another server, dark haired female was good with drink refills. Burgers were good but we expected something more fabulous. The bun was a brioche and it just didn't taste as fresh as it should be. I had the Bacon  Chili Crunch, again good just not a lot of flavor. The Tots with the Green Chile Queso was delicious, as well as Onion Rings with BBQ Sauce. Although the burger wasn't the best I've ever had, I would go back They have lots of interesting menu choices, and a couple of items I would like to try. They also have an extensive beer selection. Worth checking out.

5hMyAP9QFmZ-yAoj96bY6g.text: Freddy was an amazing server! I told him to surprise me with a drink and ge nailed it! His customer service and ability to multi task was phenomenal to see. Such a nice guy!

4GZIK4XEoiceEHV3I5OJ6A.text: Awesome food - my favorite is the 50/50 meatball spaghetti, and they just started a trivia night every Wednesday hosted by one of the bartenders - Eddie. It is our new Wednesday spot!

Fs-vPzcnkHgDDCUCkYD06Q.text: So excited they are here! We went yesterday for lunch and the first 50 people got a free beer and burger! On top of that we had the Pork a palooza! Which consists of: Bacon Salt & Vinegar Chicharron, Salted Caramel Bacon Kettle Corn,  Sweet & Sour Agave Pork Wings, Crispy Pork Belly with Jalapeno-Bacon Jam, Slater's Giardiniere HIGHLY RECOMMEND! Also added the pickles and the Mac n Cheese balls (OMG)!!! The Tapatio ranch dip with it really topped it off. Don't forget to get the bacon ketchup for everything! Was way to filling to finish it all. Be sure to hit this place up! You won't be disappointed!

trRM1StR_qilXO03DKP0Zw.text: If you like bacon and beer. Cant go wrong.  Bacon in ways I couldn't have imagined a good variety of beers with flight options.

HnY13_A4IdEJyxDdiJl6OQ.text: Our first time here and we were definitely pleased!! It was strange because this restaurant location was one of our very favorite breakfast/brunch spots for a very long time-New Day Cafe-but Slater's definitely pulled off an outstanding transition into its own unique eatery!!  The decor was very VEGAS, and our server, Nicole, was outstanding!!! She's great!! My burger-the original 50/50 was cooked perfectly and tasted so so good!! My fiancee had the pork belly flatbread and hers was also delicious!!  We both a a beer from their giant draft selection!! We came in around 1pm on a Thursday afternoon, and although it was lunch time we were seated right away!!   All in all we had a great experience!! The food was tasty, the service was top-notch, and we can't wait to try some more of the items on their unique menu!! We will be back!! Thanks again Slater's 50/50 for a great lunch!!

mEQuA5G7Iegn8gesxp26lA.text: Healthy options?  I think there may be some - but why bother.  This is a place to INDULGE - there's bacon, did I mention Bacon?  And then there's bacon.  Bacon ketchup, bacon salt, bacon on the burger and of course the meat is half BACON.  I could feel my arteries hardening as I read the menu.  But when you want BACON on your burger (and maybe a brew of two) this is the place!  Did I mention BACON?  I had the Sriracha Burger - two of my favorite things Sriracha and bacon (oh yeah - there was a bun too).  In any other place the brioche bun would be the star - here it has to play second fiddle to (wait for it) BACON.  I want to try some other things on the menu - but I need to wait until my blood test settles down.  Loved it!  Oh yeah and Lisa is a great great server!

ftQmhZ2fXcCoZ_qPADipWQ.text: It's a very nice restaurant in a great location. They have +50 beers and other drinks too. It's a great venue for large group events and sport nights.

Ra1T4eqdHTIKTN1xTX3NEA.text: Always consistently top-notch quality and service. The drinks are fantastic, the burgers are delicious... I come here for lunch and brunch. I'm so glad this place is around the corner from me.

V5HsTIBwStUCBshTTqVdnA.text: Never been here before and I can say GET THE BISON!! The meat is cooked so good you can definitely taste the quality in the meat. Definitely would recommend to anyone who wants a very great tasting and unique burger.

photos.caption: Photo of Slater's 50/50 - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Best burgers I&#39;ve had and the bacon ketchup and pumpkin sauce are the perfect condiments to compliment

QStbmyGn7fhXrLd5Dvcvsw.text: Known for 50% bacon 50% beef patties, this place is definitely a bacon lovers paradise! 50 beers on draft, full bar AND an amazing staff, Slater's is a jewel on the south side of Las Vegas. My server TAREK had the same name as me. Was so thrilled. He was amazing. Go to Slater's!!

nEQA1LXYocH95rFclm3m_A.text: This place is absolutely fabulous! The food was amazing, the atmosphere perfect and the service was great!! Will be back multiple times!

k7DAOrpVWdeZMxgmTMismQ.text: Slaters never disappoints. All of the burgers we've tried have been juicy & delicious. The service is terrific, fast, & super friendly. The bacon milkshake is a must try item. Can't ever go wrong here.

c4oXG_tt3uWoLzMB_1WYaA.text: We went on a Sunday afternoon. It wasn't too loud yet there were plenty of football games on. Very nice atmosphere (a touch cold).  The food was outstanding! The best burgers in town. Hand made patties, cooked to perfection. A variety of fresh toppings. You can make your own burger or order one if theirs. I got the highbrow and my husband got the lonestar. In my opinion, mine was better. We both got a side salad which was also very good. Came with pickled onions, cherry tomatoes and cucumber.  The server was attentive but didn't hover.  We will definitely be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Slater's 50/50 - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lonestar burger with side salad

2zTLo4ojbC_wuEd7QZ_osg.text: We wanted to find a place to go for Brunch, after church service, that had TVs to watch football. We found this place after a few searches & are so glad we did!If you like bacon, this is gonna be your place! They have twists on classic breakfast meals that do not disappoint! I had the Pork Belly Benedict & it was delicious! My husband shared the Fried Chicken & Bacon Pancakes with our youngest daughter & they were both very happy with the meal. Did I forget to mention the 2 hour Bottomless Mimosas for $20? So with it! Our server Kat & her trainee Natalie were amazing! They answered questions about the menu & made some great suggestions. Kat was so funny & interacted great with our large group.  We will definitely be back, especially to try their very large selection of draft beers!

qfuVcBRhEjtqRIDsBNcDEg.text: Cool little place!  They stream all VGK games which is always a cool perk. We were in the neighborhood so stopped by for the s'mores shake. It was pretty awesome! Only downfall? The s'more on the side tasted like butane... not edible....  But the shake itself? Pretty awesome.  The marshmallows were super gooey and yummy. If in the area, will definitely come back and catch another game here!  BTW... If you are a beer drinker,  they have a ton!

photos.caption: Photo of Slater's 50/50 - Las Vegas, NV, United States. S&#39;mores Shake

sg-QrN1b0HCbg2yR8alFEA.text: Anything with S'mores, I'm ordering it! There's something about marshmallows that get me every time. Aside from their creative burgers, Slater's 50/50 has REALLY awesome shakes to order, both for kids and grown-ups (meaning there's something from the bar added to it).   I have my kids today, plus I'm not much of an alcohol drinker, so I ordered the S'mores shake virgin. Just the sugar rush I needed! My only suggestion is to FRESHLY toast the marshmallows until they are crispy. think they may pre-prepare the marshmallow in advance, so they were soft on the outside.   I also ordered the Ahi Tuna salad. It was the perfect amount of spice and a very large portion. I was not even able to finish it.   My daughter loved the chicken fingers and ranch. It came out piping hot, so be prepared to be blowing to cool it down for the hungry little ones.   We will be back to try the burgers... they are huge, unique and look decadent! Plus, they plate the burgers so cool and I'm sure they will look good in pictures.

Photo of Slater's 50/50 - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kids activity offered

Z-IUIiOQ9rF51osJfHsrcg.text: 3.5-4 stars. We have tried Slater's a couple times since moving to the SW area and have had a consistently good experience.   They have a decent sized menu; the majority is burgers, but they have something for everyone- veg heads and meat eaters alike! One of the most unique offerings are their sweet potato fries and pumpkin dipping sauce! I know it sounds bizarre, but don't knock it till you try it! The fries are perfectly cooked and the aioli type sauce takes them to the next level!   I wish they had more snacks and small bites on their happy hour menu. It's basically just tots or fries. However, most of their drinks are discounted and draft beers are a BOGO deal. Service has also been a little sluggish and blah during our visits, but hopefully those were isolated incidents.

photos.caption: Photo of Slater's 50/50 - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Build your own and sweet potato fries with pumpkin sauce!

hRvDjtbD9CtEEsoetnzysg.text: First impression seated by host very quickly, Verry upbeat and helpful server (Nicole) they have an amazing beer tap selection interesting mixed drinks a comfortable laid-back atmosphere a little bit more low-key But the food is inventive!... and interesting!... I don't care how good you are if you get slaters twist on a Western bacon cheeseburger (Lonestar) you're gonna need to take a bath when you're done, if you can detach your jaw enough to take a bite, oh and by the way I made a double and good god there's a triple option!!! Trust me this Burger makes red Robin look like a McDonald's happy meal!...  Awesome definitely coming back!...

photos.caption: Photo of Slater's 50/50 - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu photos do justice to the actual food you were given

ubEn_2XgyMTILFmVCPUIDQ.text: I really want this place to be my go to spot. I was at there door the week it opened.  I love beer, but not any kind of beer.  I was really hoping they would have a nice selection of beer.  So I would pop in to look at the menu.....Nothing is there for me.   I've done this several times.   So I gave up on the beer.  I decided to try there spaghetti.   1) For the price point, it's not worth it, not much spaghetti, ad you don't even get a side salad, and a garlic bread. 2)  It didn't taste that great!  I was very disappointed with the flavor. But while were in there picking up my order, we looked at the beer menu again, we saw they had a Triple Belgium!  Awwww, we got excited, decided to try a sample.   It seemed like it would be good.   So I went back just for the beer.  Almost $9.00 for the goblet.   If it's good, I don't mind.   But the more I drunk it, the less I cared for it.  Now they have an opportunity to have a great Triple Belgium beer.  They carry Lovelady's beers, and Lovelady's has great Triple Belgium beer.   I think as of right now, my hopes have gone down for them to have what I'm looking for.  But if you like IPA's I'm sure you will love this place, they have lot's of IPA's  and if your into sports, it's a great place to hang out.

photos.caption: Photo of Slater's 50/50 - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spaghetti and meat balls not worth $14.00

B9-gfOhd2nzNQ9y6myIKMw.text: Well...today was National Hamburger day so of course we had to go for burgers. I was craving cheese fries so I Yelped cheese fries and Slater's popped up. What got me was the post of a picture someone posted that had the vampire dip in it. I was hooked with that. Then I read the menu and their burgers sounded yummy.  We were seated and on the table was bacon salt. Interesting taste. I personally do not eat bacon but my hubby does. I know... I know...why would I choose a place known for their 50/50 burgers...well because they have Angus burgers also! Works for me. The hubby tried the 50/50 burger patty and he said it was really good. A good mixture...not dry at all. We had heard of places before with a 50/50 burger and that they were very dry...so they are doing something right!! :) He had the lone star: 3 huge onion rings, bbq sauce, smoked bacon, cheddar cheese and he got the tater tots with the green Chile cheese. I had the Hi brow: Black Canyon Angus beef, melted swiss and blue cheeses, baby arugula and roasted garlic aioli on a brioche bun...yes I copy and pasted this...lol...I removed a few items that I took off. It was DELICIOUS!!!  I am a huge fan of blue cheese topped with a solid piece of cheese on a burger to hold the blue cheese on!!! I have never had it with Swiss before though...very good combination.  I also had the tots and cheese upgrade.  Now for the reason I wanted to go! The VAMPIRE dip!!!! I truly don't even have enough words to express how amazing this was. Let's just say if you like cheese, artichoke hearts and bread as much as I do...with a hint of garlic also...then you will be doing the yummy food dance at your table like I was!!!!  Not only was the food delicious but the service was amazing too. We will definitely be back!!

wXGXuHmZBid9FZvVshYW4A.text: I've been a huge fan of Slater's since before they became corporate. Unfortunately, with changes like this you lose some of the better items.   The food is still excellent and the shakes are still good. But you can definitely tell there's a change. Of course I'll be back but I'd say I'm a little bummed there's no maple bacon milkshake anymore and even though they offer your basics the over the top ones are just too much.   I will be back when I have more people to share food with so I can try everything!

photos.caption: Photo of Slater's 50/50 - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Vanilla shake with sprinkles!!

UWWzPs_MgzkyLxlEWLFiaA.text: I really like this place.  Burgers are amazing.  Buns are ok, sometimes I think maybe a little too soft to deal with the burger depending on what burger you get.  Our server Aaron was awesome too, never left us with an empty glass and that's a big deal for me.  So far my 2 favorites are the BBB and the high brow. They also do a breakfast on the weekends and cant wait to try that out.  They lost a stat because one of my refills had a big lipstick stain.  I used to work in a restaurant and can understand being in a hurry and not noticing the stain just after pulling a glass and quickly filling it.  However, it should have NEVER left the kitchen.

OP-D0wTj2P9TTa2M_ST0bQ.text: This is definitely a place for bacon lovers. But if you don't eat bacon, there are still options and they're tasty.   Got the Kona Chicken Lettuce Wraps from the appetizer menu, but it's a large enough portion to be a light dinner on its own. The sweet potato fries were crunchy on the outside and soft on the inside. The pumpkin sauce that comes with it is very creamy, like mayo. They do have regular ketchup as well.  Our waitress was nice and personable, and checked in on our table regularly. Would definitely consider returning to check out other items on their menu, try their ciders, or return for breakfast.

N0Bp6DvcbihbQ3dE0YYuHA.text: Came in tonight for dinner with my boyfriend and so so happy we did! This is absolutely the best burger joint I have come across in Vegas. From the extensive amount of apps, creative burger options, toppings for fries, etc this place will have exactly what you're looking for. We started off with the vampire dip and this was honestly the star of the show. It comes in a MASSIVE bread bowl- think Panera bread bowl x3. Filled with gooey cheese and artichokes and comes with pitas, celery, sourdough, and carrots- this dip is a meal in itself. Fortunately for us, we have bottomless pits for stomachs so ate the whole thing then ordered the PB and Jealousy burger and the Best Damn Bacon Cheeseburger with sweet potato fries and the loaded pimento cheese fries. The pb and jealousy burger was a type of burger I have always wanted to try and so happy I did! Lots of gooey peanut butter and strawberry jelly and it paired extremely well with the bacon and burger, had a sweet ending with the bun.   I will say the burgers are smaller then I expected- but this wasn't necessarily a bad thing, especially after that dip. For the bacon burger- this was a bit more generic for my taste, it lacked the pop I was looking for in like an aioli or maybe a bacon jam- it seemed just kind of basic compared to the other items we had had tonight. Nonetheless was still good.   Now for the fries, the pimento cheese fries were awesome- lots of bacon, cheese and green onion. The cheese definitely had more of a cheddar taste and reminded me of just standard loaded fries as opposed to an actual pimento cheese- so I was a little disappointed, but they were still super good just not really pimento chees-y. Now the sweet potatoes were out of this world good, and the pumpkin dipping sauce I would absolutely love to borrow and take home because that is absolute crack. They brought over some bacon ketchup and that was amazing as well.  In summary 2 absolute must haves here are the vampire dip and the sweet potato fries WITH the pumpkin dip, but you have to have the pumpkin dip!! Next would be pbj burger because wow what a combo. Service was great as well we had Cait and she was attentive and great!  Prices aren't bad here as well- if you have a car and are in town for the weekend, make the trip!  Food taste: 10/10 Value: 9/10 Service: 9/10

photos.caption: Photo of Slater's 50/50 - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Southern Pimento Fries, Best Damn Bacon Cheeseburger, PB and Jellousy Burger, Sweet Potato Fries
Photo of Slater's 50/50 - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Entrance
Photo of Slater's 50/50 - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Inside

985Kh-ilu0mr3QWlPpleYg.text: This local spot is a must. The reason why I say this, it's the service, ambiance and food! With 50 beers on tap and the 50/50 burgers, they are a must. I took my family, so it's definitely family friendly, and had the 50/50 original burger (which the patty is 50% pork and 50% beef with a fried egg! Yu) and the PB Jellousy burger. Yup peanut butter beacon jelly burger with ice cream! It's sooooo good. Don't knock it till you try it. I also had the sweet potato fries, that tasted like a warm pumpkin pie when you dipped in their homemade sauce. Their cheese fries are equally delicious, it just depends on your mood, sweet or savory. With 50 beers on tap, it's a breeze to pair your food with drink, they also have crafted cocktails if your not in the mood for beer. I give them two thumbs way up. Jeff, our server was friendly and considerate with our children. Can't wait to go back!   So we returned! And it was good. I still like the PB Jelliousy burger. I had a BBBacon burger and my son had a Bacon Chili Crunch. I really liked the flavor of the BBBacon burger over his. The egg on top was perfect. Remember that your burger always goes down better with a beer. I personally like their local selection as well as some of the breweries that hit the top of my lists like Founders and Pizza Port. The only reason why Slater lost a star in my book is the wine. Not that it's bad, it's the price and the amount per glass. Hear me out. I will pay 4x the amount for a bottle. That is normal. But if you charge 10 per glass for a pour that you get 8 glasses out a bottle that is $10 then that's 8x the amount.  not too cool with that.

photos.caption: Photo of Slater's 50/50 - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bacon chili crunch
Photo of Slater's 50/50 - Las Vegas, NV, United States. BBBBacon

LPEN0GsZwtuQ9L6Hr7MPYg.text: The overwhelming growling of empty stomachs deafened within our vehicle as we traveled the heated and weary roads of Vegas. Only one place called for us as our wolf pack had not feasted in a length of time not normal for humans who come to the land of sin.  Slater's 50/50 knows the deal and the portions to fix such over indulgent needs of the human condition. The food, the beer selection and often upbeat tap your feet tunes will keep you more than happy that you chose to walk in.  We had the best of the best servers on our bacon and meat adventure Tarek. Yes meat fans, Tarek. From fist bumps to Naming self made burgers this OG Slater's slayer is the Top jalapeno- bacon Jam.   Don't skimp on the Vampire Dip and have Tarek hook you up with that Australian Wagyu!

BO8zln3weXB7JclDr1xYVQ.text: Really like this place and absolutely love the staff!! Kat is just a gem. We hadn't been in for a couple months, remembered us right away. Always enjoy seeing her and she's really why we come in because your wine price is rediculously expensive!! The food is mostly good. Fries take or leave. Burgers are great. Maybe change up some of the salads and add mixed greens instead of iceberg as only option.

fMt54G5BXG8HLojGtauNlw.text: Terrible burgers. Way overpriced. Suspect!  Went here for lunch with my girlfriend and we both ordered the backyard burger. She ordered well done and I medium. When the burgers were ready the waitress and manager stood at the expediting station and went back and forth with the cooks about which was which.   After a long wait the burgers finally came out. Both burgers were cooked well done and very dry. Bun was soggy and somehow stale. Tomato was the end piece of the tomato. Lettuce was brown in most places.   And I'm not done yet! There was a serving of fries for what I assume was for an infant. Because the few that were on the plate were soggy and undercooked. Also, I don't get why they call them Slater fries when they are frozen from a bag. Lameness.   The manager ended up comping the meal because even she seemed to think it was gross after I pointed out the abysmal failure of making a burger made by a...eh hem...burger place.   Seriously overpriced and low quality ingredients topped by incompetent cooks.   You're suspect Slater's!

Photo of Slater's 50/50 - Las Vegas, NV, United States. World&#39;s soggiest bun!
Photo of Slater's 50/50 - Las Vegas, NV, United States. World&#39;s soggiest fry!

tflXOD4WjHqe7vMeMxNTZg.text: First time here... And we really weren't impressed with the food. The 4 stars is strictly for the service.  1-they ran out of onion rings so my lone star smoke burger was missing that. Our waitress did advise me of that and she suggested sauteed onions, which I agreed to.  2-I ordered my burger w/out pickles and asked for the bbq sauce on the side. My burger came out w/ tons of pickles and bbq sauce slathered on the burger.   3- my brioche bun was so dry... It felt like it was more than a day old. The weird part, my friends brioche bun felt and tasted a lot fresher.  4- the other burger ordered was a bison burger and was missing flavor... Not sure what happened there. I ate my lone star burger but did not enjoy it because it was too sweet for my taste due to so much bbq sauce. I mentioned to our waitress that the bbq sauce didn't come in the side and they gave a bunch of pickles. She apologized and ended up taking the burger off the bill.  I didn't make the complaint to get my burger for free but I did appreciate the gesture. We'll probably go back so we can enjoy the ambiance and watch the VGK games there and enjoy some beer. They have 50 different beers! That's absolutely nuts!

N7XMDX1EaryVtxwVFNn-Hg.text: Burger wasnt good. Dry, tasteless. Fries were ok. Won't be back to the location on Silverado Ranch

weQNkAsfaT4wbFSWTX2Piw.text: A friend and I gave this place a try the other day and let me tell you it was awesome! The service was great, the ambience was perfect, and the food was out of this world!   We both were talking about how great the food was several days later. Listen, I know you don't know me and have no reason to follow advice from a random internet stranger but for just a minute pretend that I'm that friend who you despise because their advice is always right and go check this place out! I promise you won't be disappointed!   After visiting this place I became one of those freaking foodie-like people that I tend to quietly judge when I see them taking photos of their food. Just thinking about it now makes me want to go there for lunch tomorrow. It's one of those places that make you contemplate moving just to be closer.   Trust me when I say you won't regret giving them a shot!

photos.caption: Photo of Slater's 50/50 - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Boneless chicken wings! Soooooo good!

uln1BeyR1B80J2tj65fnSw.text: We are locals here.  We eat out every single day. We recognize that the restaurant business is a difficult and tricky business to achieve success in. We eat in divey out of the way places and in high end restaurants (think Hank's in GVR).  It is with this in mind we write reviews.  Executive Summary:  There are many "burger places" in the valley. They all claim to be wonderful and most are.  But not all are EXCEPTIONAL, which Slater's 50/50 is.    Don't miss eating at Slater's 50/50.  It is excellent.  It is not just another "hamburger joint" - this is quality food, excellent selection, superb preparation, outstanding seasoning and amazing service (ask for Kat who is remarkably attentive, experienced without being obtrusive!)  This was our first time in (The Boss has eaten at another location before but I have not.).    I was expecting "In and Out Burger, 5 Guys, Smash Burger, Fat Burger, Habitat blah blah blah"   Not even in the same competitive market.  None of the aforementioned burger joints can remotely compete with Slater's 50/50.  This place is a very comfortable environment, high end quality menu with quality preparation and service.  I ordered the "Best Damn Bacon Cheeseburger" and it was.  The Boss ordered the "Rosemary Turkey Burger" and it was moist and delicious, unlike most turkey burgers.   We also ordered the Parmesan garlic fries which were absolutely perfect, delicious, wonderful.   Additionally we got the sweet potato fries that came with a delicious pumpkin dipping sauce.   Really, I was shocked at how terrific our lunch was.  An extensive beer menu is available, including flights for sampling.https://slaters5050.com/beer/   Each month there is a beer of the month and there is, without a doubt, a quality beer for every beer taste.   In addition they have a remarkable drinks menu that includes a "Maple-Bacon Old Fashion", "Hickory Smoked Bacon Bloody Mary", and a "Spicy Pineapple Margarita" among other delicious concoctions and potions!  Our server Kat was knowledgeable, friendly, helpful and a general delight.  She offered great advice, was always available without being overbearing.  She exemplifies what being a good server is and is really a credit to Slater's.  Manager Cindy came by to check on us and we appreciated her interest.  We gave her the same feed back you see printed here.  I'm old, cantankerous and cranky and I expect excellence.  I'm vocal and I like to complain.   Having said that, we commend Slater's 50/50 to you without reservation (and our server Kat who made the visit very pleasant).     We'd be happy to answer any question you may have if you simply send us a Yelp message.

PvHtmGdIX6-ZjUNM4CXPeA.text: As anticipated but service was not good. They were busy as usual but once we sat down it was wait. Food was on point... 50/50 burger, Tennessee chicken sandwich perfect.

MmIDWnelKhpBPKzwlXwA5Q.text: Highly recommend! The service and food was amazing! Mariah was an amazing server and added on to the overall experience! We'll definitely be back :)

ahjN3jq31UBqgx8EG-X1ng.text: This is a great new place in town if you are a burger lover.  Especially a bacon lover. Great staff, service, good and a selection of beers.  I highly recommend

photos.caption: Photo of Slater's 50/50 - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Todd is the best good server. He&#39;s knowledgeable and attentive! Burgers are Fantastic! I found a new Burger Joint!

9PYXyaTsSNhgs1mWF92yjw.text: I've been to Slater's in Southern California, so I was happy to find out there was going to be about a mile from my home.    I went with my family (party of 4) on a Sunday afternoon. It was steady busy, not packed. We were seated immediately.  Menus and drink orders were taken right away. My seat had a view of the kitchen and expediting area prior to food being delivered to the tables. The lady that expediting was AWESOME! She gets a big . She was busy, but kept her kool the entire time. She even caught a mistake they made with my order before it arrived at the table. The kitchen seemed a little frazzled at times; I don't think they communicated well. It's still all new so that will come with time.   Our food was good, not great. The only things that I noticed on my burger (BBB) was the bacon was old and hard, like it was made hours ago. My family members enjoyed their food.   I'll be back!

vcwlHRSOQhbmaCw9tyXBuw.text: My second visit to Slater's (first here in Las Vegas, as this store is two weeks new!)  They did not disappoint!  Lexi provided excellent, attentive service, food was hot on  arrival, it was a very reasonable prep. time too.  An AMAZING variety of tap beers at this location, I went for a reliable Guinness.   This time around I tried the BBB Burger, I'm a sucker for a gourmet burger with an egg on it.  It was amazingly flavorful, a perfect balance between tastes of beef, bacon, egg, and bacon!!  The beer-cheese fries were good, but not as tasty as my wife's choice - the chili fries - don't pass-up those chili fries!   Already looking forward to our next visit.  I predict Slater's will become a LV favorite in very short order.

QEJsDcNyMLNM4PDz8P_LWQ.text: New place that offers a variety of recipes with bacon in it. Brussels spouts were YUMMY! Save room for dessert. We shared the Candy Shake. Whoa...what a sugar rush! Thanks Ish for the friendly service too.
