Photo of Slater's 50/50 - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Strawberry shake with runts, skittles, sour patch kids, gummy bears, sour belts, twizzlers, lollipops, vanilla frosting, and whip cream.

WNgQBSsu4-A0UlpZluAIHA.text: Very good experience, just like always. Nicole served us with exceptional service. She was able to recommend a variety of drink options and the food was amazing as ever. Would recommend the food and service highly. The dining area was very clean.

ZsZ-TYngBB24R-Hpdp1Yrg.text: What a pleasant surprise! Found this restaurant on Yelp, tried it for the first time tonight and it was great. The service was perfect and Mellisa was the best!!!will always ask for her station and you should do the same.

QakHUfzOy2XThEfcsJhGlA.text: Decided to try out Slater's since we live right down the street. Very glad we came in because food was amazing but most of all service by our bartender Jeff was awesome! He was happy to let us try different beers and had great suggestions! Suggested the PB&J burger and that was on point! Great first impression thanks to Jeff!

KHFmt8uJ6LwpBt4kOBVZTQ.text: Everything from the PB & J burger(add ice cream), sweet potato fries w/ pumpkin sauce-to the King milkshake was absolute perfection! Our server Paina was so wonderful! We will definitely be coming back.

dWEsAtTUbIveroPugAvJ8g.text: Yay!!! Finally in Las Vegas valley. I love everything. I tried the poke nachos and they were delicious. The bartenders are very friendly which makes it an even better experience. I also got to meet Scott Slater he was really nice. I will definitely be back. Oh....... and of course the Mac and cheese balls are to die for!!!

Cl9uMqjIInnDsujuRgBWRA.text: Always love Slater's! Total fat kid food. Good beer, good burgers and great service.   Tonight our server was Todd, he was awesome. Made some great recommendations. Someone in our group had a gluten allergy. He let the kitchen know and made sure everything she ordered was safe for her to eat. They even have gluten free buns and a gf menu online.   This was my first time at Slater's here in Nevada. I have been going to Slater's in CA for years. Nothing beats bacon!

R4brLrDRpxfdFeNmSc9wDQ.text: Seated immediately by a pleasant young lady. Jeff took our order and took his time to answer our questions and make recommendations. I went with his suggestion of the Hi-Brow burger and it was VERY good. I had the root beer on tap and it was delicious and smooth. We had one small issue with our table of 5 and Jeff jumped into action to take care of us. He also had one of the burgers removed from our bill. Overall a pleasant experience and yummy food. I already know what I'm ordering next time!

Rx6vhG7guX-_ZpUEiCe6sA.text: Yummy food and great service!  A tad pricier than some of our other spots but I would definitely come here again.

Q1rOl2eP29T8-QByldTLUw.text: Great place Silverado Ranch residents!  Burgers are great Pork Belly awesome and the team there has a great friendly neighborhood attitude.  Beer selection is perfect.  Great for family and friends to come and enjoy a meal.  Thanks Slater 50/50 for selecting Silverado Ranch as your location.

q9K0JOJMGszZSSPpzO3nDw.text: I love this place the sweet potatoes fries and pumpkin sauce is awesome. Not to mention the manager David is also awesome. He was always there to help out had plenty of suggestions. He is one of the reasons we will be back. Check this place out for sure!

mGzt4TxEE_RvqEAn872cQg.text: Okay I never post on yelp but OMG you have to try the Pork-a-Palooza Stater & P.B. & Jellousy Berger!!!! We went in thinking this was going to be just another burger joint but boy we were wrong. It's a fun and lively spot with a great beer menu and outrageous food. Try it you will be back!

9-K7YLW8Hnp_QErCBso6HA.text: Stopped by this new burger place tonight on a whim. So glad we did! The Mac and cheese balls were so good and the burgers were better! Lisa was our server and couldn't have been any sweeter. Great beer list and a nice atmosphere with music and TVs.

IuKPnUWpBgHVYrDlnB6cjw.text: This a great establishment! David and Lisa were absolutely amazing! I can honestly say that I have never received customer service as great as theirs. On top of that the food was also delicious! This is what dining out should always be like!

fOm7q4TuqqMbkn7yb1NH2A.text: Lisa was our server she was awesome really sweet very patient with us and giving us tips being it was our first time here. Definitely a pleasure and food was really good. 5 stars for Lisa.

BqM3DQRjBze1L3T8LqPrwA.text: The service by Katy was . The manager was friendly and do come up to us to see how we liked it.. Had 50 alarm burger  hot and delicious.

pjT4v48UWQGDJMzJngjQ8w.text: This place is the future. The creation of bacon salt and bacon ketchup is the best thing ever. Our server KAT was very knowledgeable on her bacon definitely will come back to learn about bacon history.

X2tyS7mAibr_EU_R4aXtyw.text: This is now my favorite neighborhood restaurant!! David, manager, was so wonderful! And Ish, our waiter, was so attentive. Food was absolutely incredible. We ordered Brussel sprouts, bacon meatballs, beer and vodka and there was zero disappointment. Great job Slaters! WE WILL BE BACK VERY SOON!

3kGLMTtqbGoJXmZtuEqnWw.text: I was there on Sunday brunch. Melissa was great. Served me while I was watching the football team. Can't complain

NkMaS5GtqmHvV8_xmHy3gA.text: Secret Las Vegas locals spot for great food and drink, located minutes off south Las Vegas Blvd on Silverado Ranch. Fantastic beer selection! Wonderful staff especially the bartender Freddie! If you're staying at the Silverton or South Point and looking to get off property without going to the overpriced strip, come here.

CSPMX18mIRrXTLsfkqcvLg.text: I've been here twice and each time the team here makes me feel like I'm a regular! Freddie was amazing at the bar and turned me into what could possibly be my new favorite beer. I'll definitely be back!!!

-CH6GmKP0kjq_jxB6ogpcg.text: Ana and Scott were so welcoming! The service and conversation they provided was fun and enjoyable. Also, the owner of this location cooked our food which was awesome! We will definitely be back because of Ana and Scott!!

XWRUHMPvoYdfNYACTBfV_g.text: No aloha.. no customer service. My fam and I weren't even greeted upon entering just asked how many people. No smiles.. ordered vampire dip and beverages.. waited like 20 mins for an appetizer.. too long but it was good, seen it sit in the window for a while.. got the lone star burger and hubby got best bacon burger ugh so disappointing my food was not even hot, bbq sauce was overpowering, fries and onion rings were cold. must of been sitting for a while too.. not impressed with the burgers at all and the customer service is horrible. I was given a plate for sharing that was dirty with cheese stuck on it! Our server had NO SYMPATHY, not an apology not a care given.. he just said do u want a new one. Did he think I wanted that dirty one? Should that even be a question?? They charge $3.50 for an unsweetened iced tea?! Crazy, I wouldn't recommend and will not return ! I am a server, and I just can't believe the service we got from here!

qj6ex6b66rU4fq7xA8YpVQ.text: Read some reviews, many were very good. After eating there, I'm wondering if they were from employees or paid reviews. The burgers are way overrated and overpriced for what you get. Never going back.

_6cRbM0W8lwsEcXu604h6A.text: Just tried to try this place. Only 3 tables seated in the place 5-7mins later not even a drink or I'll be right with you. I ended up walking out. I waited tables for years you have to at least acknowledge your guests. So I can't comment on the food.

-U1EEkrdlFrcsXoB6x4oEg.text: Two words: BACON KETCHUP. But really, Kat was amazing and kept our beers full. 10/10 would recommend.

4B6Jsu9ZcP0U2IneSJZ1Vw.text: This is just to let everyone to not trust this place. 50/50 Slater's has a web page for fantasy football which offers various discounts to try and get your and your friends to have your ff draft there. I called to ask them about it and they said they would surely work with me but they weren't sure exactly what they would offer. I was told they would at least be able to do half off mixed drinks and appetizers specials and she would give me a cal back later that night to confirm. Not only did she not call back but when I stopped in they said well you want to do it on a busy day so all we can offer is $2 off your 2nd beer. WTF!?! They don't honor anything on that website even though they are on the list of participants and lied to me on the phone. If they are willing to just blatantly lie, just think what else they wouldn't mind doing ....

qio_gycXIL5AhMoMaY1LJg.text: Sorely disappointed!  We were in a group of 8 and half the orders got screwed up.  They're still new so I gave them a pass.  I got the Original 5050.  The flavor, or lack there of, was masked by the avocado and egg.  I expected a very flavorful patty but sadly no.  After I finished, the food was just sitting like a rock in my stomach.  I really wish I could have thrown up what I ate because I felt gross.  The only positive was the fries.  Whoopty do  The novelty of half ground bacon and half ground beef is nothing more than that, a novelty. I'll never go or recommend this place.  I'd much rather have a normal burger with bacon on it.  The ground bacon doesn't offer any special flavor, in fact it detracts from the natural flavor of the beef.  McDonald's provides a higher quality.

FPRxHkXRHNUYfnUzxqiwxw.text: Went here on a Saturday night. Our server was as friendly as a pothole-filled street. Slower than a school speed zone, our server took his time coming over to us, getting our appetizers out to us, delivering our entrees, and retrieving our drinks from the bar. It's a cool place if you like sports bars, but not for much else. The fried mac an cheese balls were few and number and high in price. The bbq pizza flatbread was ok but wayyyy overpriced! If you expect (and deserve) good service, there are a phalanx of other choices in Vegas.

n49KZupDrGTkgWVvyRY2JQ.text: Based on the reviews, my one star shouldn't be normal. The artichoke dip came first and lacked any artichokes. It's was a bread bowl filled with greasy cheese. Unfortunately, after snacking on that and waiting for the burgers to come out, I felt like throwing up. The burgers came and I couldn't eat mine. Not because I still felt sick from the dip but the way the burger tasted. It had some many flavors that did not go well together. I know bacon is salty but damn, this thing was too much. Worst part of the visit here was when the server came by to drop the check and ask how everything was, I was honest and told her I felt sick and couldn't eat my food because it was not good. She apologized and took my card. I spent over $50 on food that I didn't eat and stated it was not good. Hopefully this doesn't happen to anyone but I will share my experience with my friends.

Am5Sst3VG53uBHUiBfZyWg.text: Great service from the moment I walked in from the hosts to the bar tender. Freddie made me the bacon- hattan which was delicious. This my second time here, and I have to be honest, it was the brussel sprouts spritzer that brought me back. Been craving them for days. First time I came in Genesis was awesome, sweet and a great conversation. She recommended the Original 50/50, and it was excellent. This time I decided to order the Sriracha burger, which was an interesting flavor combination. Next time I think I'll go for an all beef burger for comparison, but all in all I'm incredibly happy with the service and the food. Genesis is a day bartender, and I definitely coming in for lunch with her. Freddie works evenings, and he's super cool, friendly and hospitable. Come see Freddie for dinner some time. Thank you to the owners for hiring friendly, talented and hospitable staff. I've been in the business for 20 years, so very easy to be critical. I'll definitely be back.

qzNgQuOEIRlqgUQlGKvSLQ.text: When Slater's moved into our neighborhood, I was excited to try a new burger joint. I took a friend and we ordered their famous burgers. It was just ok, a little too saucey for me. The 50/50 meat didn't impress me. I asked for fries well done or doubled cooked and they couldn't get it right. For dessert, we split a vanilla shake and it didn't taste anything like real diary (or ice cream). When we got the bill, I had sticker shock, nearly $50. For the value and taste, I gave it a two star. Oh well, I wish them luck and hope they are successful.

gT1tXjxx_nzdQL1UFU70xQ.text: I was again impressed by staff presentation of food and of course my special spicy margarita ! Freddy , thank you for for making my night so much better , tequila cures everything!

pZMABcw_J-15O6vBtT1vfw.text: I live in LA I go to Slater's location there regularly and love the burgers but I'm in town and I'm happy to find a new location in Las Vegas and I wanted to order just the burger and lettuce plain no cheese no toppings no drink no side and they want to charge me the regular price of $14+ for meat and lettuce! Not cool !!

UUEXE5zcjQmQB--IrVwDRw.text: Had to check out the new burger joint! and I did 2 times.    LV needs a good off strip burger joint, LV  strip burger joints just do not cut it ....  1st time I had the Original, not a bad burger, was it worth the price and a 30 minute wait, no! I'm just glad I wasn't on my lunch hour. Like most burgers the roll consumed most of the burger. I'm not really sure if the burger was cooked too well, I would think after 30 minutes it should have been.   2nd visit, with a friend this time, we both had Sriracha Burgers. I received my burger in pieces, he didn't. I brought it to the attention of my server she looked at me like a deer in headlights, that is all. Not very impressed again. Rather than be attentive to the issue I was asked if I'd like to have a another beer, they like to push the beer after all they do have a good beer selection. Unfortunately I'm not much of a Beer Drinker  Because of my second issue there, I'm giving this 2 star a because it's not deserving of anything more there was no communication letting me know my burger would be so long or the fact that she didn't even acknowledge or care about serving me a burger that was in pieces, but I was asked if I wanted another beverage.  Thanks maybe I'll wait until staff issues are sorted.

-qB_QgpzQhJNc8lV4kkZJg.text: Freddy is the Maaaaannn! Go see him, he's so great! Personable and REAL! We stumbled upon this place because we live in the area, and we'll keep coming here until we move!

7Vigo6yvckbg-CxJMxKadQ.text: This place had an amazing artichoke dip and the burger was fresh off the grill. The Manager David made me feel like family with his great customer service and energy. After we stuffed our face with food, we decided to get one of their monster shakes that just made the experience one to remember. We will be coming back again even though i dont live near by.

d5055Bu6NiLbTZuqUuFDCg.text: My boyfriend and I came in for a quick lunch. I ordered the tuna salad and he got some burgers. We were both unsatisfied with how salty everything was. If you really love sodium, this place is for you. I'll pass.

_uwJ8VssqpfQJF9P4X9Tjw.text: I had Tarek tonight and he hands down the best server I've had in Vegas in awhile. He answered all my questions, made suggestions that I didn't even think about. He was attentive to my needs and even when I threw him for a loop, he was quick on his toes to make sure my meal was perfect. It was my first time in but every time I'm in Vegas I will definitely come to this place for the service alone.

6XagIctCS4RORp4e4ndJqQ.text: Great food. Love the new make your own burger menu.  Lord of options to choose from. Service is great.  Had Freddy multiple times. He's always on point.

sw2B5pyB3hMHRU7MUpkyVQ.text: I discovered Slater 50/50 on an early morning local news program, i thought thus place has to be good , burgers, bacon, whats not to like? i tried the original 50/50 burger, the taste was good, a little crispy but thats the bacon talking i believe. i like fried eggs on burgers so that hit the spot for me, definitely a burger you are going to eat with a fork unless you ask for the egg to be cooked "over hard". the Chipotle mayo was a little bland and could use a little kick in my opinion .  i ordered the fries as my side, fries were crispy, not over cooked. House made bacon Ketchup was very good, i asked for some extra, server quickly delivered some additional ketchup. . Service was good, attentive and friendly, without over doing it. i didnt have room left to try desert, but i have my eye on a return visit to try some.

4D0WUg9Dxvss65RWPiV0Fw.text: So glad I came to this place.  The service was delightful. Upon arrival we were seated right away. Melissa was our waitress and she got us all water and our drinks right away.  The atmosphere was really fun as well.  We had Vampire dip for an appetizer and it was so hot and fresh and most importantly delicious   my husband ordered the High Brow with a double patty and it was so big and flavorful.  My son had the kid sliders and those were pretty big for kids sliders. My daughter ordered the PB and Jealousy and we were all a little jealous   I ended with the 24k Burger and that was the DAMN BEST BURGER EVER! The flavors were just jumping and bursting all over my mouth. I savored every single bite and I could not finish it. We will definitely be coming back! I definitely think Melissa deserves some recognition for all of her suggestions and expertise  THANKS SLATERS 50/50  for having delicious food and awesome staff! I'll definitely recommend this place to all my guests and recommend Melissa as a waitress!  I am a hotel concierge and I wish you guys can open a place on the strip so I can go for lunch!

bdMSF3iWGs7tWASKvQpwHQ.text: Meh.  I know this isn't a long enough review but meh is what I felt about this restaurant.  Meh is not what you should feel after dropping 70 bucks on two burgers and a couple of drinks.  Nothing was really wrong about this place, but nothing was really good either.  The bacon thing felt gimmicky.  All and all I would go to any number of other places around Vegas that do burgers and beer better.

sgQxe2R0va9GRN3SYUm4PQ.text: Great burger(s)and 50 beers to chose from.  Delicious.   Nice job Lisa.  You were awesome

e22DH-wljvlsZn8jUSczXw.text: I regularly visit this chain in california and love it so when I heard they where coming to vegas I was super excited. However, it turned out to be a let a down. It took forever to get our food...it took so long the manager gave us a vampire dip on the house. And when the pork platter came out, it was a disappointment. The pork belly resembled burnt jerky, the pork rinds were soggy, and although the picture in the menu and on the advertisement prominently displayed in the middle chicken wings. "Pork wings" came out instead. I asked about the chicken wings and the girl said that they are supposed to pork wings and that was a common misconception. Which seemed like a moranic reply cause the all the pictures clearly show chicken wings. And one of the waiters asked if everything was okay and we told him about the pork belly, he immediately went to the kitchen and brought back a new order, which was a plus! So all in all, I really want this place to succeed cause it really is a great chain in California. I'm gonna blame most of the issues on the fact they they're been open for just a week and are still training. I give it a couple of month and I'll try again.

Photo of Slater's 50/50 - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Vampire dip

X_P1vBmNuPwRGCv7NVmAUg.text: I was very excited for Slaters to come to Las Vegas as i've been following their instagram for sometime and heard raves about their california locations. We came opening weekend (sunday) and it was a bit busy, nothing crazy but we opted to sit at the bar. And we are glad we did as we had an amazing bartender ( Jeff ). As we were overlooking the menu we werent really sure what to get, although we do know we want to try everything once someday. We placed our orders and Jeff very nicely suggest to change our burger order from the Original 50/50 to the PB&J ala mode (a pb&j burger w/ icecream?!?). Reluctant but willing to try we obliged. Needless to say, we didnt regret going with his suggestion. Who would've thought, i highly suggest trying it if you're having a bit of a sweet tooth or a little daring. We also had the Vampire Dip, wow! Another hit!! I wish we took photos :/ aha. Jeff overall gave an amazing experience to the point even IF the food wasn't great we'd go back just for his service. Overall making my review for slaters a 5 star.   P.S if you get Jeff as your bartender and happen to like Arnold palmers, tell him and let him make you a drink ... you'll love it.

4o59P6zU_jJLTPfhmpoUew.text: OMG....what a great time, great food, great people ...Lisa our server was awesome and attentive!  the manager came over and gave great advice for after eating the 50 alarm burger.....ask him!!!

e1d2Hhoj1Kyqitl8vsz9sg.text: Before coming here I would recommend checking out Hi score on blue diamond close as it in my opinion has better service, food and beer list. As this is a chain restaurant I have been to 1 other Slater's and was looking forward to this dining experience. Let me start with I love GOOD beer and am a beer snob so the offers taps as only marginal at best and when they can't even bring those out right or tells me that they need to bring in Jon Taffer to save them and train the staff to recognize when they bring you the wrong beer in color and smell. I requested a taster of barleywine and they brought me an ipa not interchangeable by any stretch then ordered a flight with 2 stouts and we get 3 yellow beers at which times the runner argues with us that it has to be correct and server finally realized we were right and she did offer to make it up to us with a free beer she was earning them 2 stars in this review so far.  All this occurs as the managers (yes managers plural) walk around never once coming up to us and asking how it's going. Then we order food and it continues to go down hill as the restaurant is nearly empty at 2:30 pm in the afternoon and it still takes 25 min to get 2 burgers and fries (which 1 was not as ordered) and as you can see from the picture while the place was clean there is a lot of staff standing around not contributing to a good experience taking them down to 1 Star. Overall slow and poor trained staff, bad management, and fair food with marginal beer list there is much better places in vegas to spend your time and money at.

photos.caption: Photo of Slater's 50/50 - Las Vegas, NV, United States

UQ0MxTX47bqtLVfXhezNuQ.text: Genisis makes this place run!  She will not steer you wrong!  Ask for her when you get there!

GfBlwnMvCum_6bEu1tYnNA.text: Loved loved loved everything. Sat at the bar and Kelley was amazing. Had some drinks then burgers which were fantastic (make sure you get a side of beer cheese for the fries). The milkshake that was a mistake and given to us just topped off the experience. All in all delicious

photos.caption: Photo of Slater's 50/50 - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The milkshake master himself

2qB1RAxrBOa33ifgC_vbAg.text: It was ok.. the turkey burger was extremely salty there was a hair on the edge of my plate..there server was really nice we had refills.. it's not the same food I use to eat back in California thats for sure.. they took away ipa beer cheese sauce and a lot of my old faves.. I bragged about this place and then was disappointed and so was everyone I brought alone with me

hodFcgBMwRHU55QqF00ldg.text: Bacon, burgers and beer oh my!! Delicious. Great atmosphere. You must try the PB & Jealously Burger. It's sounds so wrong but tastes so right. And Lisa, our waitress, was phenomenal.

eQjEgkgrR5eYW4-JymZgsA.text: Amazing food and service!  They have one of the best selections of craft beers in town. Lisa was our server tonight, she is on it. My husband had to take a phone call and in the mean time the food came, she took the time to cover his food so it wouldn't get cold by the time he got back. Thank you!  The High Brow burger is my favorite, and don't forget about the brussels sprouts!  Looking forward to coming back and trying out a milkshake next time.

XfOFM4F1ayaVJ5Gyji2NLw.text: Food was really good and the server Alex was excellent! Very family friendly environment and we will definitely be back

bv92JA3jh52mcM_vdiRSPQ.text: Great burgers and beer. The garlic fries are awesome. What more can you ask for. Oh yeah, great friendly service. Genesis is the best. We come back because of the food and her.

ijczWOACHQ8HyyWPYeSsqw.text: All the food we had was delicious. While we were waiting (less than 10 minutes), they brought us fries and bacon jam to try! Then, after we ordered our food they brought mac and cheese bites on the house. Our waitress, Nicole was super attentive and helpful. We had never been to a Slater's and she explained everything we asked and checked on us frequently to ensure we were enjoying our meal. My 50/50 burger was delicious! I planned to take half home but ended up eating every bite. My husband's poke nachos were GIANT and SO good. I'm stealing his leftovers tomorrow (shhh don't tell!) :) Beer menu is on point with plenty of local breweries on the list which is awesome!

FlkMu455P00bJoMZS9Blvw.text: Extremely impressive burgers I will definitely be returning very soon proportions are great and french fries are bomb as well keep up the good work guys.

4EXA8C3uUh7O4EjCcU2oVQ.text: They are doing a soft opening and all of the food so far is on point and the service from KATIE behind the bar is amazing.I will definitely be returning for football Sunday's !!This place looks super cool!

4YGIXb12iQhsnvf8oRNMLw.text: My first experience here started off with Horrible service but ended well.  We sat down at 6:30pm - ordered around 645/650pm.  Many others were seated after us and we began to notice they were receiving their food before us.  Our waiter never came back from the time he took our order to refill our drinks, to say our food would be out shortly, NOTHING.  We had to flag down a different waitress to find out what was going on with our food.  It finally came an hour and 10 minutes later with a simple "im sorry" and thats it.  When he came back with our check I requested some sort of discount for the ridiculous wait ...he went and spoke to the manager and our bill was then cut in half.  After we paid our check we hung out for a little bit when a woman (possibly the sou chef/or a manager) came over to check on our experience.  We didn't want to make any further fuss since it was all taken care of but she proceeded to ask questions so we shared our experience.  We were very blessed when she went above and beyond and brought us gift cards asking us to give them another chance.  I so appreciated that amazing customer service in the end and will be giving Slaters 50/50 another chance.

eL2GKjYnO_k7MCjJMBuWxw.text: Called in order for a single burger.  Said no cheese 3x on the phone. Food allergy.  Arrived. Burger had cheese on it, had to be remade.  Not a good sign for your grand opening.

bm4ac1QBeNy3GectvSWe-Q.text: So last night 10/6/2018 myself and two of my closest friends decided to try this place. I had heard many good things about the one in Southern California so we gave it a try. The burgers we had had a great taste to them even though we asked for medium and received well done. The wings we had were outstanding but my thoughts were 12.00 for 6 wings they had better be good. As good as they were I feel a little over priced. My other huge disappointment was they gloat they have 50 beers on tap and it is an extensive menu of beer but no Heineken on tap!  Really??? 50 beers and no goddamn Heineken!!! For that reason alone I will not be returning!!!

wR-81UGipWjvASz9BWxD8Q.text: Definite 5 stars hands down. You wouldn't think it was a soft opening. Jeff gave us the run down on the menu and was honest about everything. Recommended the PB and Jeallousy. Probably the best burger I've had in a while. and I've been to some of the renowned places in the US. Service was ridiculously good. Everyone was working as a team. Keep it going guys and you'll all be successful. The table tried the Poke nachos. Not as good as Yard House. But. The poke was bomb. Need to perfect that mix of chip to topping ratio.  It was definitely tasty tho. Mac and cheese bites were hittin. The dipping sauces are all a must. We live around the corner but we'd make the drive from 20 mins out to come back. Thanks to Isaac too. They really made sure my daughter was taken care of as well.  Try the Lost Coast Tangerine. Better than Blue

Vl65i33B8UvbXXvO4Sm0Pg.text: We've been very curious about the new Slater's 50/50 that opened near us. Just got a chance to try it. Absolutely fantastic burger!! The 50/50 mix of ground beef and ground bacon creates an excellent and juicy patty. The fries and bacon ketchup were also very, very good. Lexi was our server. She did a very nice job! Asked if we had been in before, and fully explained the burger concept and the entire menu. Great service! Can't wait to go back and try the Spaghetti with 50/50 Meatballs and Marinara..

C2u25hYGBJ1NZ7SRThmBIw.text: I went for the burgers but decided on the chicken carbo-nera. Oh my!! It was beyond good. The blacken chicken was so flavorful and moist all i could do was smile and keep chewing. My server Chloe  was knowledgeable about the menu and understood what great customer service was all about. If they treat their chicken like this i can't wait to sink my teeth into their burger!

0A1G9G6GJNHx2xmJ9MFhzQ.text: Hey strangers, bacon lovers and/or beer guzzlers. Slaters 50/50 is an excellent choice for any group of ppl to dine in a restaurant dine in if you're their bars a good place for you. Let's start with the burger its juicy its savory and of course if a great choice. The sweet potato fries with comes with a pumpkin sauce (PSL lovers know what I mean) they complement each other so well the chef's obviously a show off and I'm okay with that. They got 50/50 patties that's right half beef half bacon grounded together to make something some ppl would describe as "holy **** that's sounds awesome how the **** did I not think of that" plus they got bacon strips if you dedicated. Over 50 taps they got a lactating dragon in the back if you want some new holland dragons milk (11% abv).  Also Jeff S. was my server funny dude, prompt service I recommend asking for Jeff S.  Also my buddy will be starting a food blog soon when it starts I'll put in the IG.  P.S. you smart you loyal theres some money buy yo moms a house

RRIo59qQKf9UjgEN_0y40w.text: This place was amazing. High end strip ambiance in local area location. Staff was friendly and fun. Melissa our server was incredible. She explained the menu in great detail, took time with us to make sure everything was made the way we wanted and made the whole experience memorable. The food was cooked to perfection and amazing flavor. The word of the day at Slater's is BACON. if you like bacon (and you should) this is the place for you. Highly recommended.

o1HhJgPxwOnpXJBwe7K_9w.text: Slater's 50/50 has been the "go to" place for me and a group of friends to watch NFL Football this year.  The food was pretty good, all the games were on the TV's, and the beer selection was good.  The biggest reason we've returned most every Sunday to Slater's is due to a waitress we liked very much.  Last Sunday, after spending  over $400, we learned that she had been fired for hanging around past the end of her shift in order to close out our tab!  FIRED!   SINGLE MOM!!  WE WON'T RETURN!!  DUMB MOVE!

wUi0z52FqIFKmvzX7oYo3Q.text: I wanted it to be so much better. Slater's has a good beer selection, with choices across the spectrum. We had the bacon cheeseburger and Fried MAC and Cheese balls. It was just...alright, and nothing special. The burger patty was small and a little rubbery. The fries were a little limp. It was something I'd expect more from a fast food joint than a place that prides itself on its burgers.  And it's definitely a bit pricy for what you get. As I said, it's just mmmeeehhh.

QUE5p3SCkvJ9OuSYx2pLxg.text: Every time I go in this place it smells like sewage! It's disgusting and a shame because the food and atmosphere are great and the bartenders are fabulous. Freddie was just as pleasant as he could be and provided excellent service!

YOAfleOiiUMXOxEwAkIUBQ.text: I've been hearing about Slater 50/50 since I lived in California. It was my first time, along with my fiance. The atmosphere was welcoming and my server Ralph G., was really patient explaining the menu and suggesting to try entrees out of the box. This place is something to try for, I highly recommended.

i4q0xJJQusJXDOz8QcOZYQ.text: Went here on a Sunday with my family and I think we found our new spot. The burgers are PHENOMENAL! I loved the sweet potato fries and the pumpkin sauce. The Smores milkshake was a hit with the kids but without a doubt we LOVED the Pork Belly Egg Benedict. Their breakfast items was AMAZING...  The best part was the staff. Super friendly and the service was fast. We can't wait to go back.

0towycnD8Mgrs2mV6-ukKw.text: The selection of beers on tap and the bartender Dino were great.

8EbzjbQXkpLk6M7dHWVJYQ.text: First time at Slater's and it was absolutely delicious. I've been recommended to try this place in California and was excited to see one open near our home. Bailey was great and recommended the impossible patty to my mom who can't eat super fatty meats. It was good tasted just like meat! The pumpkin sauce with the sweet potatoes fries was like a PSL in a sauce and so yummy! The bacon ketchup was so good too! We'll be back for sure! Thanks!

qu9DJwXlms2PGnvhXO4Pdg.text: The service was awesome and very personable!  We had the the original 50/50 along with the bacon Mac and cheese balls.  Everyone enjoyed the food and we plan to check out the breakfast.

aA6ub-F-TWakWLrfFZ0CFA.text: Great burgers (I had the Impossible burger). Four Foodies were all very pleased with the burgers. Great selection of beers and excellent service; shout out to TODD. We've enjoyed the Rancho Cucamongo Slater's for many years and are delighted to have this amazing burger joint local now. YES!

QcZR4W97wJE-J7fwPe2-7A.text: Best food Best Beers and Best Service. I hidden place you must try!!! Best collection of beers and verity of burgers and appetizers.

photos.caption: Photo of Slater's 50/50 - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Triple Belgium
Photo of Slater's 50/50 - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Buffalo and Bacon Burger
Photo of Slater's 50/50 - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beer taps

BPYeDYKBNJKJjvW1GGkFSg.text: Ok, so we stopped for lunch and were not disappointed. Staff is friendly helpful and chatty which is great. Manager spent 15 minutes at our table taking about smoking meats, bacon and the company background. Brought out samples of all their bacon and some fries. Food was excellent and so many choices we will need to keep going back and work our way through the menu. It's a must try for you.

pyk_gWkH2GBo6wpgtxYT5g.text: This is an awesome place, here with friends for burger and beer, and instantly fell in love with the selection we had. Kat was our waitress when we were here, and you will have an awesome time if you get her too.

JKz5Z7JH9OBBnwi3LsWPog.text: So I went today with two children and I was thoroughly impressed. Even though we didn't order any hamburgers (which I think may be their specialty) I enjoyed everything I ordered. I also loved the adult friendly options and extensive beer list.   Porkapalooza was amazing with all the kinds of bacon and pork forms that exist; I thought I found my heaven. So much so that I forgot to take a picture of it because I dug in so fast. My bad.   This is such a fun place to go with or without kids and I really enjoyed the food and ambience.   Highly recommend!!

1hhCdDM4hHbecT5GUuH5bA.text: Freddie. What can I say ? He's great! It was a such a nice first time experience.  Spicy pineapple margarita is so tasty! Pork-a-palooza was fun but the popcorn a little disappointing. Meh whatever great place check it out

AMG34knuaeqcvUiztupo0w.text: My boyfriend and I were so excited to try this place! 1. Our server, Lisa, was so positive and accommodating throughout our meal! 2. The vampire dip is a MUST 3. PB&Jellous burger is pretty good, on the sweeter side. I'd prefer their Rosemary Turker burger instead. I've had both and that's the one I prefer. 4. My bf loved the 50/50 Alarm burger, but says DO NOT eat the grilled peppers they give because they definitely pack the heat they promise hahah. When I thought he was on the verge of a meltdown, Lisa offered a bit of vanilla shake since they'd run out of milk. Luckily, my bf started to cool down before needing it. Thanks though Lisa!!!!

ACj2BRTzuc5ZHRr_0BGgYw.text: My husband and I went out to quietly celebrate  my birthday. I wanted a good burger. This one hit it out of the park. We tried the 50/50 burger. It was delicious. I thought the ground bacon might make it salty, but it did not seem to. The sweet potato fries with pumpkin dip is amazing.   The service was top notch. Our server was Gaby. She was helpful with selections and great at providing everything we needed. We will ask for her when we return, which we will soon.  The entrance is decorated with taps, which were interesting and amusing. We weren't standing long, so on our way out we took another look. This is a fun place, with great service and wonderful food. Beer drinkers are sure to find something that pleases them.

photos.caption: Photo of Slater's 50/50 - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Wall art
Photo of Slater's 50/50 - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bacon salt  - yummy!

ggtSZqvp5WTQcXKdvhzaqw.text: This is my second time At Slater's 50/50 First time it was just drinks  This time I had drinks and food, plus I also got to chat for a while with Freddie also chatted a bit with Dino. Freddie is a fantastic guy! No other way to say it, Dino himself is also a great guy he's brand new first day here and did a great job himself. Slater's is famous for having lots of beers on tap which I really enjoy also any kind of drink that your heart desire they'll make it here for you. They've got a great attitude and the place is super chill  Good for watching sports of just having dinner on your own like me tonight. The food is delicious  I had the chips and dip also their FAMOUS 50/50 original burger and it was hands down the BEST burger I have eaten in Las Vegas!  Eating that burger got me very excited! I live just a few blocks away so i will be returning to Slater's often, not only cuz of Freddie and Dino also cuz of the amazing food and great selection of drinks! Definitely a great chill spot.  Really sad to go from 5 stars to one star. Why? Bcuz last time I was there just over a week ago, I had the wings it tasted rancid and simply disgusting! I was SO disappointed! Also ordered again the 50/50 original burger and this time it was not good at all, undercooked nearly on the raw border and just not good. Even the drinks were bad, I asked for a gin and tonic and got what appeared to be a gin and water, just flat and no flavor and just not a good taste. Then I decided to ask for a jack and Diet Coke it came 3/4 DC n maybe 1/4 jack also not tasty and definitely not enjoyable. When I was there last time I was at the bar by myself and had a great experience. This time I was with my girl at the restaurant side and really excited to take her there! What a mistake...  on top of the food and drinks being a huge disappointment, the price was also ridiculous! 2 50/50 burgers, 7 disgusting wings and a couple of less than acceptable drinks cost me nearly $90 dollars... who am I kidding?  Slater's you lost a great loyal customer.  Life's goes on! On to In n Out we go!!! Burger time

Dllqcth5qpaQX_WTSH0mAQ.text: My favorite burger restaurant of all time. If you go here, definitely get the 50/50 patty on whatever burger you get. I actually love the strawberry burrata salad (add grilled chicken). The Lone star burger with the 50/50 patty is as good as it gets as far as burgers. And the service here was awesome. Caitlyn took great care of us. Drinks were always full, apps and entrees, and even the check was brought out perfectly.

1RKGs_AZ1_9VVYLygTowyg.text: I took my son to Slater's for the first time today. He loves a good burger and he ranks the burger in the top five best burgers he's ever had - anywhere. And our server Cait was amazing. She made sure we always had enough to drink and our food came out fast. Definitely will be coming back again.

Ld_5IvLTjiXi2TOhzyCbyw.text: Overrated. Food was fine, but overpriced.  Website said happy hour 2-5pm M-T, but when my husband and I sat down at the bar at 2:30pm, we were handed the food and drink menus, but not told about any specials, even though there was a stack of happy hour menus behind the bar in front of us.   Because it was our first visit and we weren't just there for happy hour, we ordered food and 2 rounds of drinks anyways.  The bartender, Genesis, was really into herself, dancing and flipping her long hair around. Even going as far as to take food from a regular patrons plate and eat it behind the bar.  I'm sure the health dept would have been thrilled.   Also, I'm vegetarian and although she double checked that I didn't want bacon on my impossible burger (which I appreciate), she then made fun of the fact that I came to a place known for bacon. I was with my meat-eating husband, and trying to be accommodating to his tastes as well, but we will not be returning.

kACekRN4E4QDEVgcaAtMIw.text: Looks can be deceiving. The burger patty was ok nothing spectacular, cooked well done, and not juicy/borderline dry. Supposedly, their is specialty bacon. The burger had a bacon sauce...meh. Only the bacon was it's saving grace but, who can't put bacon on a burger. If your thing is Bacon and I'm not blown away by bacon flavors, you better hang it up. Fries were over salted and when I asked the waitress for a mix of regular fries and sweet potato fries...she said sure but didn't deliver. Very sad. Had high hopes for this place. If I ever come back to this place I'll just stick to the bacon sampler appetizer and be done with it. 3 out 5 stars and that's being generous.

Kif7k-U8NtQ8foKzEzWEtg.text: Omg YESSSS!!! This was my absolute favorite biker burger and beer place when I was in CA and I am soooo happy we have one here now!!!   My friend and I were heading out, looking for food. We happened to be driving down Silverado when I saw the store front. I was like: Stop! We have to go!' So we went.   The bacon hamburger with jalapenos and cheese and everything (can't remember the name of it) was huge and messy but it was good. Chase it down with loaded fries and cold beer, we were very happy peeps! Can't wait to go again!

oswu5x1CBuwqk8B4xs8KPA.text: Was driving past and came here on whim (looked cool from the outside). Walking in noticed there were no loud smells (yes, I do notice things like that - unfortunately) and the young lady at the check in greeted us w/what seemed like a sincere smile (I usually can tell the difference). Decided to sit at the bar and the bartender Freddie saw that my menu was tattered, apologized and gave me a new one. He didn't give me that "huh?/whats your issue look" when I said 'no Rose's in my Gimlet please"  and he made it perfect.  Now the food; I ordered the Brussel Sprouts and wow, even minus the bacon, they were great - not greasy, balsamic sauce/sage and real parm, no complaints. Warning: everything contains Bacon.  Overall, good food, good energy and the staff was great. Will definitely be back!

zv5r_GUyRUkaPPqvQLCIOg.text: Super disappointing. Nothing like Slater's in California. Serviced sucked and there was only 3 other groups of people there. He gave a vibe like he didn't want to be at work. Food was just as terrible. Bun was stale and fries were soggy and there were only about ten friesThe chicken wings were red and raw in the middle. Worst part is I'm not a picky eater.

2GoV9vQD2r7sW3iGdYKLqw.text: AMAZING FOOD AND AMAZING PEOPLE  The food and atmosphere were amazing and relaxing!  Lisa was our waitress and she was not only an absolute doll, but hilarious, attentive, and warm! She has a wonderful demeanour!  My husband got the B'B'B'Bacon burger and I got the spaghetti and bacon-beef meatballs. I am happy and full right now . We also got the Bacon Mac N Cheese Balls and Strawberry Limeade drink. We recommend ALL of these items for sure!   Mariah, the hostess, was also fantastic! She was warm and welcoming and super friendly when we first walked in! She even picked up out plates and asked if we needed anything else!!   TEAMWORK MAKES THE DREAM WORK  And these two were soooo awesome!!

bvjV-VKMQJD4PuseoeD0MQ.text: Very delicious food and awesome service!! Our server  Tarek was super helpful and always attending. Had a beer flight and tried a bit of their beer selection.

photos.caption: Photo of Slater's 50/50 - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beer Flight

lpiIcXzEfRhWStoICipqnw.text: Went here for lunch the other day and the food was amazing! I got the original Slater's 50/50 and was very impressed. The sweet potato fries were super delicious and the bacon ketchup was an added twist! I do feel like they are a little too pricey for burgers and the floor needs a good cleaning. My flip flops shouldn't be sticking to it. Other than that, I definitely want to go back and try their milkshakes!

4coGxekAK_qm1SCWsAoSeA.text: This was our second time here and I  love it! I feel as though this could be our Cheers, the place where everyone knows your name. The staff is well picked. David the manager is very professional and fun to talk with. Kat the bartender/waitress is so enthusiastic it is contagious. Then we met Todd from Wisconsin, a fellow Packer fan.  Does it get any better, yes, the food is delicious! The Mac and cheese balls are to die for and who could pass up the opportunity to eat a 24k burger?

BOkORtVCiF214TARIfdolQ.text: First time here and about to be regulars. Ate and drank at the bar and Freddy treated us like he knew us. Super helpful, friendly and accommodating. Made the night for us. Food was great, so many beers on tap. Can't wait to come back.

IbUrj-Y6f_5XR0embcFQPA.text: While I was very grateful that they made accommodations for my dietary needs, I was very disappointed in the quality and price of the side that I ordered. The pork rinds were amazing and would order them again. However the five meatballs that I paid nine dollars for were dry and not worth the money. All the other people in my party enjoyed their meal. Just not a place to go when you're trying to watch your diet.

TlAdbde9P4YKPXPlOVsgxw.text: I struggled to give this spot 3 stars. I've had Slater's in the past in Southern California, which was great. The beer selection here is really not great at all- left a lot to be desired. The food, however, was the worst. I got a Cobb salad, and every component was fried to a crisp. Will not be going back anytime soon

MAt0w6I1TfKoFzicFjF_8A.text: Slater's is sooo good. Can't go wrong. FRICKLES!!! Lisa was a fantastic and very helpful waitress. Very happy they finally made it to Vegas.

juf7Q3qksBmaD4xr0wPyTw.text: Lisa put a smile on our faces. She helped us find the right beers out of the over 50 taps and directed us towards to what was good on the menu. She was very light hearted and was not afraid to joke around. I cant wait to come back for more next time! Great server! Delicious food!

ooKQGrbVopt5PUyQjjW9bw.text: Jeff recommended the BEST burger I have ever had... the PB and Jealousy!! Surprisingly amazing. Jeff was very attentive and fun, we will be back very soon!

y1De1n0qt5XtMSDSFeZdJA.text: Slaters 50/50 is always amazing me and my husband have eaten at the Pasadena location, we were nervous to see if the same quality was going to be as good as that. It did not disappoint at all amazing food so delicious, I can't wait until they start the whole thing were you can customize your burger and name it, and they'll say it out loud! I'm very picky with my customer service but the staff was all so friendly and nice especially Lisa she has the best personality . I can't stop saying positive things about slaters!

zQmVhosTeKVLK60N2CSPoA.text: I loved this place. Food was outstanding and Melissa was awesome. It's always the sign of a good place when the staff is happy and the food is made right. The sloppy joes were incredible "they explode in your mouth"love this place and def ask for Melissa. I also had the Lone Spur burger and it was awesome. Can't wait to try other items. Definitely will be back.

oWBAjcy-dkBZlawORUlwlg.text: Been waiting for this place to open in our neighborhood. Went to soft open tonight. Started with vampire dip and a round of available beers. The vampire dip is my favorite! Had the lone star smoke and wasn't disappointed. Spaghetti and meatballs had to be taken back by Robby as meatballs were tough. Shea, the chef brought out a hot new plate and apologized for the inconvenience. Ana was our server and thanks to a great team, food and drinks kept flowing. Definitely will be back and highly recommend this place to family and friends.

ISGVqRUqbjtk5B68rwT67Q.text: Don't bother with this place. A sad & pale misrepresentation of the tasty and high quality Slater's we are used to. We went here Saturday about mid-afternoon. I've been to many Slater's in Cali and wanted to go when it wasn't crazy busy especially since this one is a new NV outpost. Beer list was okay and had some decent NV local beers. Nothing spectacular on the beer list but the service was horrible. My gf asked for a taste of a barley wine and a very yellow beer was brought to the table. Both of us looked at the beer and said nope. Not a barley wine. Runner & server disagreed. Oh no that's the barley wine. Tasted it and yep it's a IPA. Requested they go back and try again. Hmm, a more caramel barley win was delivered. Server had to agree the first one was not what we asked for. I ordered a flight with a wheat, two stouts, and a saison. A flight came with three yellow beers and a stout. Uh, I think you are wrong yet again. They tried to convince me a very yellow IPA looking beer was Dragonsmilk. Nope. Try again. Came back with another flight with the correct beers. Ordered my burger medium well and it barley hit the medium mark, and bacon crispy and still limpish. Server asked how things were and I told her "worst Slater's ever". There were two managers hanging around the server station but neither of them bothered to stop chatting and work the restaurant. We did see the server stop by them after I made my worst Slater's ever but still neither budged from their chatting post. The managers at other Slater's I've been to were much more proactive about checking on the quality of their store. I guess I'll save my Slater's visits for when we are in Cali or hope for better when they open other locations in Las Vegas.

03akqhlM6aIS3u1qJDT6Eg.text: Where to begin, one and done. To sum it up our group was more than ready to leave at the end of this one. We came in with a medium sized group of about 8/9. The restaurant was dead and our server (Lisa) was finishing up a large group of 25-30+ so a other server started our drinks, which is understandable. After drinks came out the server took appetizer/dinner orders. Dinner took about 45-50 minutes to come out. The cooks in the kitchen could be seen and heard screwing around while we were waiting on our food. The first round of beer that came out was about 50% wrong and had to be sent back. I ordered garlic fries and my friend ordered a 50/50 burger which we split. The fries we alright. Not much garlic other than the pieces of garlic clove sporadically thrown on top of the fries. The fries were good and cooked to completion so not much to say other than that. The burger was too much. There was not much flavor variety in the burger. It was too rich in my opinion. There was nothing to break up the flavor and nothing to really bite into. Very mushy. I ate half of my half of the burger. I couldn't get through it and I do not consider myself to be a picky eater. Someone at the table got the sweet potato fries which comes with some sort of pumpkin sauce. The combination of the pumpkin and the sweet potato was fantastic. I would definitely recommend. Especially if you have a bit of a sweet tooth. It's just right. A member of our group also ordered a milkshake to come with dinner. This did not come until we were asking for the bill. She tried to cancel the order because after waiting so long for our dinner we were just ready to leave. The milkshake came out and she was not charged for it. It took a long time to get beers refilled and I was only drinking water and had to ask to be refilled. Also the floors were extremely sticky, I'm not sure what it was but the entire restaurant was sticky which makes me wonder what the kitchen, where they cook the food, is like. The bathrooms seemed to be mostly clean. The men's and women's rooms are on opposite sides of the restaurant and getting from one side to the other around tables is a little difficult. All in all I would not recommend this place. The service was beyond poor and the food was mediocre at best. I must say the beer was cold though. Might be a good place to grab a quick beer at the bar. Wouldn't recommend more than that.

PYFtWuvUys-snObzSSOBvA.text: I waited for months....disappointed. Walked in on Grand Opening day around 130 in the afternoon. We were seated right away. Just as we sat I heard table next to us complaining...our server Renee came by and introduced herself. We got waters,she explained the concept and took our drink order.  Totally ruined the experience for my daughter when she was told that there were no milkshakes. Renee said that they had to work on serving before they served shakes due to the time they take to make. Why open if you don't have a full menu?? We ordered the $12 Chicken Wings....at $2 a wing not worth it. Yes you get 6 wings for $12. I got the 50/50 Original Burger minus the egg add lettuce and tomato. I couldn't believe I was charged 50 cents for lettuce and 50 cents for tomato. I omitted the egg....they could have let the veggies slide. Kinda ridiculous. Watching Fox5 news Sunday morning with Mr. Slater promoting the place. My burger was on there twice the size with the guac and mayo oozing all over the plate. Mine at the restaurant didn't look ANYTHING like it....DECEIVING. Good luck guys.

UEaJRKCMnno9lopDLCsl2Q.text: My husband and I went tonight which happened to be their opening night. The place was pretty busy so we needed to wait about 10 minutes to be seated. The hostess was so nice  as was the rest of the staff. They asked if we wanted beer samples or water while we waited and went over the menu and offered suggestions. Once seated we were helped by Ish. He was great, kept our drinks full and checked on us regularly. We started with the Bacon Mac and Cheese balls which were delicious and they come with a ranch tapatio dipping sauce. My husband got the BBB Bacon Burger and I had the Hi Brow Burger. He enjoyed his burger but thought it was a little dry. The Hi Brow Burger has blue cheese and swiss on it. I thought the blue cheese was a little strong but if you love blue cheese this burger is for you. Overall we really enjoyed our meal and look forward to going back and trying some other dishes. It's great to have a new burger option in the neighborhood other than Red Robin.

AXAd5w5ZBqb-XorFD2TPYA.text: Found this place looking through Yelp for something new. Called ahead to make reservation as there were 10 of us. Got there and were seated quickly. The menu is just right in size with enough options for everyone. We ordered the porkpalooza appetizer which is like a pork charcuterie plate. Everything tasted good however the ribs were a bit dry. For main course I ordered the Siracha burger lettuce wrapped and medium temp. While we waited for food I ordered one of the local IPA per server's recommendation which was good and I ended up ordering another. Once the burger came it was cooked to temp and wrapped nicely in the lettuce so it didn't get completely sloppy like I have had happen in the past. Everyone else at the table enjoyed their food as well and no complaints to be had. The kids really got a kick out of their over the top milkshakes. Will definitely go back to try other things on when back in town.

ITIFJCkaynzXmu826-5G6A.text: Not sure which is better, the service or the food. Here for a late lunch.$10.00 lunch menu. Best burger! Half bacon/half burger! Egg on top. Genesis, our server is the best. Opted for the lettuce wrap instead of brioche......#ketofriendly

v-paVoEjcoL37K_B3c2i4w.text: This restaurant has such an amazing menu. If you're a bacon lover, then DEFINITELY check this place out. The lady that was our waiter was very friendly and gave great recommendations! I highly recommend this restaurant.

b15tM_P0T-19GbaftjkNYg.text: Love the beers on tap , service was great . TVs decent . Organic greens instead of bun a huge plus . Menu variety is great. For a restaurant that prides itself on bacon I would like to see some high quality humanly raised pork as opposed to what I can safely assume is cheap factory farm pork , so minus star there . Other than that a good Place to try

DDkAUXpw_0_NrPcnNzM1jw.text: Excellent! Delicious food and wonderful service from Raina. Had the Nashville Hot Chicken sandwich. Can't go wrong with anything here really though. Their burgers are amazing. Even the drinks were refreshing. I recommend the Slater's Spiked Limeade. Definitely be back!!

EZYFOMZwR-VsMhljARV2SQ.text: We sat at the bar and were quickly attended by Freddie, from the moment we sat down to the moment we left it was nothing but exceptional service! Thank you Freddie! We'll be back soon!

zhc69LxPFnQWcPWQONLUTw.text: First time here, great location for us because it's right in between our house and our daughters. Casual hip atmosphere with a ton of tasty beers to choose from. Our server Bailey was awesome!! She was attentive and didn't miss a beat with our cray cray family!  The burgers were amazing and the shakes were a meal all on their own!  Will definitely be back!!

photos.caption: Photo of Slater's 50/50 - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The King Shake!  Aaaaaamazzzing....

i04X_6YFNDgyl3mcAwrB4A.text: Ate at the bar and had a great experience. Met the owner and Freddy the bartender was great. Very informative of the beer selection and food. I will be coming back soon. They have bacon everything  from ketchup to cocktails. I would highly recommend coming here

cFOkca5UKbjKjzXwZlGeRA.text: This place is awesome! Great food! A great selection of beers on tap. A yummy chocolate peanut butter stout soo good! The Slater's Vampire Dip is amazing, recommended by Freddie the bartender who is the best! love him!! Definitely my new favorite place. We will be back! THANK YOU FREDDIE!!!

_5masz_g7VWNxXQ_hdCz2g.text: Lousy service !  It's Thursday night, it's slow... our waiter did the minimal effort possible.  The burgers were well made, but they were warm not hot...because the burgers sat in the kitchen window for five minutes. (Attached picture).     The Manager should find out what is going on in the back room, ...that's where your staff was hanging out.  Your establishment has an open kitchen for a reason, and it displayed the kitchen staff and other wait staff watching food sit in the window.  No urgency, no ownership?   The low rating goes to the waiter who did the least work possible....and to the kitchen staff that let food sit in the window.  This was my first visit. This restaurant is a sloppily run ship,  and there are better restaurants in the same strip mall to spend my money.

photos.caption: Photo of Slater's 50/50 - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Slow service....minimal service.

lhrx8tjei4I3rKmI80L_QQ.text: First off, Jeff the bartender is awesome. Great with the crowd and had good tips for our first time here.  Had the pork-a-palooza for an app. KILLER!!! You could eat that as a whole meal. Then had the Hi-Brow burger. Fantastic flavors perfectly cooked.  We'll be back for sure!!

vDmb_2ZdHjJWHfxP5TMCHw.text: Second time here...first time had the original 50/50 and this this time the B'B'B.  Both times our server was Jeff.  Service has been great and food even better.

gj609gm1lwE3-1ZV-eGfbg.text: We went in for the first time today for lunch and we will definitely be back! The brussel sprouts were fantastic and the ahi nachos were huge! We were so impressed with the apps that we ordered a 50 alarm burger to split as well. It was hot, but not overwhelming, and the taste was delicious! I didn't get a beer (trying g to cut some calories to start the year) but the beer menu was great and I definitely will want to explore it in the future. Genesis was a great server and had us cracking up with her dance moves. She was all smiles the whole time and we will definitely hope to see her next time we go in!

iaDZiZoUFIZoW1tMD519bA.text: This was one of the best experiences I've ever had at a restaurant, period! Our server, Tavek, was ahead of the game the whole night. He anticipated everything we wanted with our dishes and made wonderful recommendations. Not only did he go above and beyond but he did so with a great attitude and was very accommodating. Overall was an experience that I wont forget anytime soon! The food was excellent along with the service, I got the vamp dip, the original 50/50, and the s'mores monster shake. The food was awesome and made to order! Highly recommend!

QIMMtd4Td11HuNiCvyP6gw.text: So we've seen this place many times while going to Island Pacific, Lucky Thai, and Dunkin' Donuts which are all located in the same plaza. We decided to give this place a shot since the family was craving burgers. The restaurant itself was clean and had plenty of space. We came in during NBA All Star Saturday Night with the three point shoot out playing on several televisions inside the restaurant. This would be a good place to catch games. We were greeted in the front by the host who got us seated promptly. Upon first glance of the kids menu, we were happy to see the variety of items for kids. From burger sliders to pizza to chicken fingers; there was plenty of options for them. My wife and I were looking at the burgers. This place is called 50/50 cause the mixed half of their burger meat with bacon. My wife decided on the Best Damn Burger and I got a Bison burger in a lettuce wrap with sweet potato fries. I ordered an extra patty since it was only a few dollars extra. My burger was okay. It wasn't spectacular but it wasn't horrible. The lettuce wrap kinda sucked. It quickly fell apart which made a big mess. A toothpick to keep it all together would've helped. Larger pieces of lettuce for the wrap would've been better. Overall, the bison burger was VERY average. My wife touched her burger but didn't care for it much. My son and oldest daughter had the sliders which they enjoyed. My other daughter had the pizza but didn't finish it which wasn't a good sign. It was also very thin and definitely not worth the price. The appetizers we ordered were the tater tots and onion rings which were the best part of the whole meal. I don't know what's up with this place; but you have to request ketchup which is weird for a burger joint. We had two cups of ketchup between five people but I digress. For the two burgers and three kids meals with drinks; we paid over $75 which was waaayyy overpriced for a VERY average meal. That is two sodas, three waters, and ZERO alcohol. Although everything was fine, I doubt we'll ever come back. The prices were ridiculous especially when you have Lucky Thai, which is amazing, in the same plaza. You have Red Robin down the street whose burgers taste better and prices more reasonable. We ain't tourists so stop charging locals ridiculous prices for average tasting burgers. We ain't on the strip and we live close by. You lost potential repeat customers which means $$$. Step up your game, there's so many other burger joints in the area.

UdIzBzHFGxkrHhP9SePHGA.text: I came here for the first time on Sunday. This place is awesome. Happy hour is great, they had buy one get one free beers. There are so many beers to choose from. The fries were good too. Freddie was my bartender, he was awesome too. Great customer service.

-Lx0ChACTXHDj8cU__-VnQ.text: ....So I returned to Slater's today, 9/3/18, at the request of the Manager David, great guy really knows his beers. MUCH better experience today with the Lone Star Smoke Burger and Sweet Potato Fries. Washed it down with a couple of the micro brews, thanks David for the recommendation, and tried a few samples. Definitely will return on a regular basis if for no other reason than to talk some football with David and sample some beers

wsGkerFVU0pEgznEHw26jw.text: Excellent service by Freddie,he was very informative and helpful when selecting what beer would suit my tastes.The burger was fabulous with plenty of fries.Had a double bacon burger and barely was able to eat it all.Nice crowd and excellent amount a TVs.nice to be in a bar atmosphere that doesn't have smoke and video poker machines.

yT6kmbH8rA3iv6Z_rESyOA.text: Friendly service by Melissa. The manager or whoever came over to pet our service animal (who was tucked under the bar laying down minding ME as he should) without asking. Just bc someone has a dog doesn't mean they want to see pictures of yours. Tried to order the chicharonnes ala cart and couldn't. Glorified fast food restaurant with a decent beer selection. Presentation was lacking. Burger patties small. Never again. Just goto In & Out.

photos.caption: Photo of Slater's 50/50 - Las Vegas, NV, United States

_Tt-GUI7iMgIpY8oX7_Qiw.text: I'll update my review the next time I'm here, but holy hell that was a really really bad experience. I'm going to say I understand since it's the first couple of days and they need to workout some kinks, but there is no reason for a simple beer taste to take 45 minutes to receive. Or an appetizer taking 50 minutes. Or the fact that our vampire dip was dropped off at the wrong table. The simple stuff was jacked up beyond all recognition. My family and I walked in at 8pm and our main entree didn't arrive until after 9:30pm. Also the egg on the burger was 90% raw egg whites and yolk, hopefully I don't poop my pants tonight. Scott Slater was even in the building witnessing this all go down, but it didn't make a difference in service. With the food taking an hour and a half to get, you would think a business would comp your whole check, but not this place. They comped our bread bowl that took an hour to get, and that was all. So we went home with a grumpy tired baby well beyond her bed time.  I'm from San Diego and I loved the Slater's in Liberty Station, so hopefully with time and direction this place will be as good as that one.

pPjWhv2gdY7JYfrNqCYEJw.text: Absolute GARBAGE. Overcooked,dry burger with cold fries. Waitress put in order wrong so both side sauces requested were on the burger. Not even sure they got the patty right. Ordered the 50/50 and was told that it might be pink in the middle, which is fine since thats how a burger should be. Not even close to pink. Cooked to dryness. Table next to me said that their fries were cold also. Maybe pay more attention to orders instead of the "eating contest" that was going on at the time. You're a burger place that cant do a burger and fries correctly. That should tell you something people.

kQwzcQkQfrm9NZQQoSe2gw.text: Great are server Lisa was great will definitely coming back try other burgers got the 50/50 great...........

24FYrlAaiTTQmg7Ta-syLw.text: The food is great, just as expected. The bison burger was amazing. Our server Tariq was on top of everything. Also, couldn't ask for a better manager than Dave. Can't wait to come back!

Wc-_3U-ekFsBke1rC8Y9BA.text: A great place to hang out. It is absolutely nice to have this place within our neighborhood. Smoke free place and kid friendly. Food is great and there's tons of beers to choose from. But what makes this place even more amazing is for their great stuff specially the bartender Freddie, he always make sure that he's on top with every costumers needs and wants!

bF9Pm18uCnVTf-v9YopNjQ.text: This was our best meal experience in Vegas! Nicole was attentive, friendly and funny.  Our meals came out quickly (which was great since my 6 year old was tried and starving!)  I love the seating, the cleanliness and of course the beer!  We will be back!

mjY9zWHyr_UIwgwsGdpzfw.text: Freddie was one of the sweetest bartenders in town!! His lemon drops are  we love Slater's!!!!

YCOtquZ7g7zwU2HlnRbziw.text: Freddie, the bartender, was a real delight. He was attentive and friendly. We will come back for shakes. They look delicious.

7_blj1OF5y0Y0A0f0_hAdw.text: Food was decent but unfortunately service was terrible. Everything started off well enough as we were seated by a young man who brought waters and took our order. And then he disappeared. Literally didn't come to our table again. Someone else dropped off our food and not once were we checked on by anybody. We needed ketchup and water refills, but only one waitress was near our section & she was clearly overworked and didn't notice us. By the time we got her attention to get the check, we had been done eating for a solid ten minutes.  It was family night on Monday where kids eat free, but I had to request our sons meal be taken off the check as well. Took forever. On our way out I saw our initial server behind the bar. I'm sure it was just a mix up, but dang, you can't just start as a server for someone's meal & then just abandon ship without handing off.

n5dxl4btawvXDOptUFAygQ.text: My girl and I came here for the first time after driving by from work and I think we stumbled upon something special. This place has some of the best burgers I have eaten here in Vegas. Shoutout to the bartender, Jeff, for his recommendation on the "PB & Jellousy Burger." One of the greatest things I have ever tasted.. it's an Angus burger with bacon and a Peanut Butter and Strawberry jam; served with a side of vanilla ice cream.. Absolutely, amazing!! Definitely recommend this place and I will be returning very soon (A++)

photos.caption: Photo of Slater's 50/50 - Las Vegas, NV, United States. PB &amp; Jellousy BURGER
Photo of Slater's 50/50 - Las Vegas, NV, United States. BEST DAMN CHEESEBURGER!

m1dYYjhVON_d2MuPq78pJQ.text: Went here with my family and it was incredible!! Server was awesome, all staff were super friendly and couldn't be happier to get outside of our usual area to eat (we live super north) so the drive for us was worth it and we will be back. We came with our kids and no one left disappointed. I ordered the PB & Jellousy Burger with a 50/50 patty (super yum!!) and if I didn't have my kids with me I would have seriously added the scoop of ice cream (it's gonna happen next time!) the only change I might made to it was maybe kick the jelly up a bit with a sweet chipotle jam but that may just be personal preference. My husband ordered the 50/50 OG Burger and it was a beautiful thing. The egg was cooked to perfection! Slightly runny and tasted deliciously cheesy (perfect for this burger!) and the avocado mash had even my husband who's mostly anti-avocado (seriously who did I marry!?) liked the avocado and said it was done really well and he would eat it again (Win for the guy who'll eat avocado but won't make a meal out of one like me!). Kids ordered buttered pasta and pizza and we took a bite of the pizza and were surprised at how good it was and kind of shocked when it came out that it wasn't some sad looking freezer pizza you could find at the store. But the best part of the night for our little entourage was the shakes. Husband and I share the Ultimate S'Mores Shake and it was perfect. Love that the graham cracker was not fully submerged and soggy, thank you for that!! Our girls split the Happy Happy Birthday Shake; I just wish I could share video of my 5 year old in her seat with the squee dance she did. It does not disappoint, especially when it comes to the kids. This was their first Twinkie experience (and this much sugar but it was a family night so treat yourself!) and the sparklers, pushed it over the edge. Kids had an experience and we made memories, laughed a lot and enjoyed our total dining experience. Yes, I was surprised that the sparklers were the old school metal ones from back when I was a kid. Owner/manager promptly removed the hot rods as soon as they went out so our kids didn't burn themselves (thank you!! I still have scares on my feet from stepping on them one 4th of July when I was little.) Also, thank you for not using kraft Mac & Cheese in your Bacon Mac & Cheese Balls.. it makes a difference and the dipping sauce was perfect, the right amount of heat without setting your mouth on fire so you can't taste anything.

photos.caption: Photo of Slater's 50/50 - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Happy Happy Birthday Shake

MbcBjNuFZKTJv0Gx3aTCRg.text: I'm so happy we tried the vampire dip. All of the dipping items that came with it (the bread, pita chips, carrots and celery) were also good, which is rare with dips and it was nice to have a lot of options for dipping. It is the main reason this restaurant will be a Must in our rotation. We both really liked the burgers and fries we had, but it's special items like that Dip that make this place stand out.

E_qxBjPexOfCq1p_njg4kw.text: Freddy was an awesome host and his recommendations were spot on. The burgers were amazing and paired well with the beer. I highly recommend this place for great food, great  beer and even better staff!

XDJkK6-IAo7EsXzzmirsvQ.text: This is a bacon and burger joint. Food was weird and not good tasting. Bacon over cooked and burnt, the burger was just not what a burger is. Co worker says he was high and had the munchies and STILL said it was disgusting... Server was taking his time with basic shit like refilling drinks and taking order.  He said and i quote "Fries were on point tho."

N1mTCQz1H1IK2_7M11OK0g.text: Unfortunately, they don't have gluten free buns like their locations in southern California do. Their wings are also breaded. Thus I'm SoL since I can't eat bread. They have lettuce wrapped as an option, but I personally don't enjoy my burgers lettuce-wrapped.  EDIT #1 - altered review rating (can't delete) based on manager's response; will try to eat there again soon and update pending our experience!  EDIT #2 - Went back to Slater's upon knowing they did have gluten free buns. The meal was good. The menu is noticably lacking compared to the couple locations in socal I've been to; in summary, I'd give the restaurant a 4-star rating as a whole (seems pricy for what you're getting, and not a lot of customization compared to the other locations in the franchise), and I'd give the customer service of the management staff a 5-star.

oIVov3om2LA_FNWwcv6WwQ.text: Hands down one of the best burger I have ever had! I ended up trying the burger peanut butter and jelly(think it's called on & jealousy). If you like pb&j and bacon that is the burger to try. Cant wait to go back and try another burger!

2Ow1EAdSy3r63CYwfQpOew.text: Just attended the grand opening. Decor and music are very contemporary. Great beer selection with a good mix of craft, local and favorites. The menu is strong in its bacon theme, with several new twists for people whom consider Pork to be their candy.  Ordered the Vampire Dip, with extra veggies for dipoing, and 50/50 burgers.  My wife is Gluten-intolerant and they were very accomodating.  Vampire dip was astounding, and reminds me of my homemade alfredo, in dip format.  The burgers are definitely the star here, with their patented 50/50 blend of ground beef and ground bacon.  They come with a great smoky flavor and more tooth than your standard burger. My wife, who is a True burger aficionado,  love the new take on her favorite food.  Place was bumpin' since it was their grand opening, but all the staff was extremely courteous and competent. A special shoutout to our server Renee, who kept us up to date and happy throughout the busy service period.  It's rare these days that quality, care and convenience all coincide, but with this location being walking distance from our house, I am sure it will become our regular hangout and a Date Night favorite.

c-F6WGjOvgjRN6s1Yzm0Tw.text: So glad I stopped in to Slater's! Kat the bartender recommended a new beer for me that I LOVED! She was so much fun and super knowledgeable! This will definitely be my new spot.

s-ve1TX8EjRJ8Z3tZcXowA.text: Came to this establishment 2 days ago and got me some food and some beer after work just so I can relax I was amazed at the selection that the bartender was able to remember 50+ different craft beers no jokey  The bartender Kim was awesome, attentive to the needs of the customers bartending knowledge/drink making skills are on point she make sure that you're comfortable and enjoying yourself while you're there I would definitely recommend Slater's 50/50 to everybody and I give this establishment 5 stars

cdFs8iOYyR1rmKrDwep_PA.text: A spiritual experience!!!! Thank you Yelp for helping me take a chance on Slater's 50/50.  In NC, you either have a beer garden with a sucky food selection or a sports bar with an okay beer selection. This is the perfect marriage of the two. I'm a craft beer "fan".. working my way to an aficionado. Huge Kudos to David.  His hospitality, knowledge and customer service was out of this world.  My selection was the Dragon's Milk Bourbon Ale.  My perfectly paired food selection was the Bison and Bacon Burger.. and I mean perfectly paired. I commented to my daughter that I was actually sad when I took my last bite of the burger and sip of the "elixir". The Dragon's Milk immediately got my to my top 3 list.  I also picked up another one for my rotation... Asylum from Left Coast Brewery. I think I may be able to get it from my local Total Wine.   This was so awesome an experience that I am seriously looking into an opportunity in the Raleigh area.. Wish me luck!

photos.caption: Photo of Slater's 50/50 - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Slater's 50/50 - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Dragon&#39;s Milk had just rocketed to one of my all time favorites!!!

CzusdDRs5ck-72k0rIzBPg.text: First time I have been to Skater's. Service was. Great. Food good. The plug is that the burger is 1/2 bacon. The meat was not actually made fresh but was shipped in. The bacon could not be cooked completely inside the hamburger meat making it noticeably greasy.  Fresh is always better but this was good just not great. Fries were crispy but previously frozen. The location was in a strip center.   I would recommend you try it it's novelty is worth the try

6qbHNPnuNMZEmQ-oCiEmuA.text: Went with the 24k burger and it was great. Alex was our server and was extremely attentive.  Keep up the good work!!
