IWEfu3GhQVf_-x_Vr0ldFA.text: The 3 stars is for a horrible service experience. We went on a Thursday evening with my 85 year old FIL. Walked in and stood at the empty hostess desk, 2 other parties shortly arriving behind us. No-one at the bar, 2 servers at the kitchen, backs turned talking to each other while we all waited for easily 6 minutes. Finally seated with maybe 30% of the tables filled. The whole meal was long waits for the server to get around to us for drink order, then food order, then forever for the food.....The burgers and fries were really good, but after we were finished and had waited another 10 minutes for the check, I finally went up to the bar where our server was and got the check. During our meal we saw others arrive to the same situation, one of them waited a while, then went to use their bathroom and left!  I love that they are no smoking, but we can go to Destihl near our house and get a decent burger with 5 star service in less than a 2 hour experience!

jAQ6gPAvz2FauCdVi6nYoQ.text: What a great place! Food was awesome, service (Kim) was spectacular! On point with menu suggestions, cool things to do in the area, our drinks never ran dry and she even put on the football games of our choosing!

Our food came out pretty quick after we ordered. The host of trivia was so amazing, he kept everything so interesting and fun, I left wanting to be his bestie!!! I will definitely be back again and again!!!!

It tasted like frozen food, we wont be eating here again. Super over priced for frozen patties and microwaved fries.

b8jpcwHgwyRrriYMd7EcZg.text: If you haven't tried this place you should!   The burgers are amazing and there are  so many options including a beyond burger (vegan). HQMdx1qeUdOk_9SVJChqBw.text: Starting it out with a Belching Beaver Peanut Butter Milk Stout (5.3% ABV, 30 IBU or International Bitter Unit) which tastes like alcoholic dark chocolate Reese's in a glass (see the last photo). For my lunch entree, I am having the 24K Burger (fresh-baked Brioche bun dusted in 24-karat gold with three slices of thick cut Billionaire's (gold dusted) stacked on 1/2 lb WAGYU beef, truffle cheese, arugula, jalapeno-bacon ham and roasted garlic aioli). To maintain my slim figure, I am having a "Slater's" salad. Wow! What presentation. My friend ordered the Vampire Veggie flatbread with their Vampire dip, piled with artichoke hearts, roasted red peppers, mushrooms and red onions. For my last drink, I am trying the Lovelady Paleo Porter (5% ABV, 28 IBU) with a similar smell and taste of peanut butter and then goes to chocolate and coffee. Burger bacon is a bit spicy and the bun gold coating is a bit buttery. There is glitter all over the place (my face, pants, shirt, etc.)...

Photo of Slater's 50/50 - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Slater's 50/50 - Las Vegas, NV, United States

vVAQemdiJsIWcyQdkdlAxg.text: I haven't ate red meat in 4 years and this is Hands down the BEST IMPOSSIBLE burger I've ever had. Cool bar style restaurant with tons of beers. It's a Chill and clean environment with super friendly staff. Beer was so refreshing and paired perfectly with our burger (I got the cali creamsicle beer). Staff and our server took the time to talk us about how the food was and even gave insight on how it's cooked. We had gaby as our server and she was really helpful when we were putting in all of our substitutions! Highly recommend!

skkjfIkYqlKTiWU-JWTgcg.text: Wow, this place was awesome! I went with about eight friends last night to try out this place. I went in already pretty hyped to try a burger made of half bacon and half beef, so I was hoping they would not disappoint. I was definitely torn between the 50 Alarm, Sriracha, and PB and Jealousy burgers (Peanut butter, jelly, and ice cream on a burger? Say whaaaaat?)  In the end, my buddy and I both signed some waivers and went with the 50 Alarm. Is it all that spicy? Nah, the waivers are just cute little hype machines. I think I took maybe two sips of water the whole time I was eating it to give you an idea of the spice level. BUT and I mean this is a big but (hah), this was definitely one of the tastiest burgers I've ever had. I'm not big on eggs on burgers, but it worked perfectly in this case, and the flavours were delicious. I was quite impressed. I also had the sweet potato fries and that pumpkin sauce? Amazeballs. I ended the meal with the Guinness adult milkshake. I consider myself a bit of an adult milkshake connoisseur, and while it was good, I don't think it was enough to warrant the $10 price tag. I was also happy they were able to get all of our food out hot and pretty quickly despite it being a relatively large party.   The only real downside was our server asked if we wanted to split checks at the beginning of the meal and we said yes, but when one of our party needed to leave a bit early and asked for her check, she ended up getting charged the whole bill. Bit of an unpleasant surprise expecting to pay $20 and getting charged $200. It wasn't a huge deal, but just a bit of an inconvenience and we would've preferred to know if one person had to put the whole bill on their card.  I'll definitely be back for their lunch deal. I'm pretty sure the PB&J burger is on that and it'd be nice to get a deal on that in case those flavours just don't work for me.

photos.caption: Photo of Slater's 50/50 - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 50 Alarm Burger with sliced instead of whole jalapeños.

EfTcWH6ECR5IRW7bhVC8wg.text: I heard heard raving reviews of the California franchise of Slater's 50/50, so when I found out there was one in my home town, I just had to try it!  Weeks and weeks had gone by, yet I never had a reason to be in Henderson, so I made one, and it was to visit this Slater's.  Upon arriving, we were greeted and sat at a table. Right next to our table, yet slightly behind us, was the waitresses computer area where they do whatever it is they do. One of the things they most likely did was overhear our conversation about our opinions on our experience, which I'm sure they quickly learned was lacking.  I'd requested on of their custom burger menus, at the recommendation of friends, and couldn't wait to dig into a juicy, custom made burger, as I'd been fasting for the past 36 hours. Yes, this was my first meal in over 36 full hours!  I decided on treating myself to a higher end cuisine, and I'd seen their 24k burger as for $24. I figured, if that's their high end burger, the one I build would probably be about the same price, if not cheaper, and mine wouldn't even be "dusted with gold!"  Boy was I wrong (but more on that later).  Their menu gave the option of a single patty, double patty for +$3, or a triple patty for +$5.   It also gave various choices of meat, but to my point, the Australian Wagyu option had indicated +$5.  The menu described its toppings as being "select up to 4 toppings. Additional toppings are $0.50 or priced as marked"  I opted for a triple patty, Australian Wagyu, with 4 toppings, and a regular bun and waiting for my meal to arrive. In the meantime, I also requested of their shakes (the King Shake).  My burger came and I was excited to bite in. However, to my surprise there were only 2 patties. Nonetheless I went to dig in, until I noticed that the fried egg topping is ordered had been cracked all over, causing the bun to be soggy and impossible to clutch. Again, I dug in anyways.  My first bite was as you'd expect, yet lacked the Wagyu consistency and taste I thought I'd get. Oh well, I'm sure the outer parts might be a little more done right?  Wrong.  The entirety of both Australian patties were far over cooked, well done. Might as well have thrown the burger to the dogs at this point. But remember, I hadn't eaten in 36 dang hours, so I wasn't about to wait another half hour for a remade burger. I ate half of it and informed the waitress of the overcooked burger and lacking of the third patty.   She brushed it off, and basically acted as if nobody had ever complained about a burger before (she didn't seem like she knew what to do aside nod her head). The excuse over the missing patty was that the Wagyu was a 1/2 lb patty. So? I can read a menu, and I'm aware it says 1/2 lb right next to it, and expected 1.5 lbs of meat.  Even to this point, I'd still shrugged the entire experience off as "oh well, it happens. Let's not be those people."  Then the bill came.  $33 + toppings + taxes + tip (just for my burger)  Suddenly this experience was much more expensive than I'd expected. A $40 hamburger - where's my gold at?  I politely asked the waitress if she could explain how my bill came to so much, and she said she just walks the food around, and got a manager.  Manager walks over and acts as if the waitress sent him over without telling him the background of the issue (doubtful but who knows). I explain to him all the problems we've had, and how I'd been let down at my Slater's 50/50 experience that I'd been looking forward to, and broke my fast for. As a reminder, I was missing a patty, had a soggy bun, was overcharged on my bill, and my Australian Wagyu meat was way overcooked.  I was shocked when he didn't care about literally anything I said and simply offered me half off my burger (not my bill). So you're telling me that it's still a $20 Burger then? Okay, fine, and I'm willing and able to pay it, but why should I pay for something that was overc.... and he walked away while I was in mid-sentence.  Manager comes back over, hands us a bill and a coupon for buy one get one beer, with purchase of an entree, and walks away. I look at the bill and he comped the burger. Okay, fine... but he made his point now that he just wanted us "complainers" out of his restaurant.  Don't worry about it, we won't be back. And we left the coupon for you too. I'm sure your other customers need it more than we do.

-aGM_KDF7-hDYd1gURaEXw.text: First time at Slater's and The experience was awesome. Server was awesome took his time to explain the menu will come here again...

photos.caption: Photo of Slater's 50/50 - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Drinks awesomeness

qzHbCpHUkiiWDB1Y0FDFKg.text: I got the PB and Jellousy and it was DELICIOUS! I let my friends try it and they all loved it too!   I hate bacon. But this bacon is so good! I didn't even mind it when other times I hate how crunchy it is.   The Chef Cindy came and spoke to us and was super nice and answered all of our questions.   My friends all loved their food as well, we even had a 24k burger.   CHECK OUT THE WHALE QR CODE!!!  Katie was our server and she was very helpful as well. We joked and had a a really fun time.

g6RisgNFVj87kI3GVVhp_Q.text: This place is impressive. The entryway alone is built to beguile tap handle lovers, but unlike many other establishments with showy entrances, this venue actually backs up the visuals with a beyond decent beer list/wall that showcases plenty of local brewery selections.   The burgers are, whoa. Any burger can be substituted with the 50/50 patty, which consists of 50% ground beef and 50% ground bacon.   I had the turkey burger after much internal grappling. After a quick but contemplative inner dialogue, I decided I'd be happy with the turkey patty topped with pepper jack, rosemary bacon, and some kind of warlock aoli. I was not disappointed. The dude I was with, I call him my husband, had the original 50/50, and judging by the speed at which the sandwich disappeared, I'd conclude it was pretty scrumptious.   With screens everywhere, it's difficult to miss a single play of any game you're needing to see.   So, yeah. Go here. Todd was maybe the coolest server ever. He overheard the conversation I was having with my four year old about how the green shavings on his pizza weren't a big deal, and without hesitation or even a question, he brought a greenless pizza for our picky little cherub.   The fun didn't stop there. We were planning to order a cup of vanilla ice cream for that picky 4 year old to finish out the experience. When I asked Todd if they had ice cream, he said, "we do, but we also have amazing shakes." We ordered the Birthday Shake topped with two Twinkies, plenty of sprinkles, three dum dums, and of course whipped cream, topped with sparklers, yes, sparklers. It was magnificent. See photo.   We'll be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Slater's 50/50 - Las Vegas, NV, United States

MWk0jQB_8mPsL23dCcs0LQ.text: This place was Fuckn BOMB!!! Came here after my job promotion with my family and have the BBB-Bacon Burger. Amazing-ness could barely describe the feeling of how awesome this food was. The "Slater's Vampire Dip" is out of the Fuckn WORLD!  The pork-a-palooza was good but to me this cheese artichoke dip was way better hands down! I loved it, definitely gonna try this place once again soon. The only thing that could've been better is if they were able to pick up all the cups and plates as we finished the appetizers and drinks. Didn't disturb my family too much, but that is the only thing that urked me.

WbGMJJrOlGtauTWFxMxZBw.text: Bacon! Bacon! Bacon! Bacon! Bacon!  Ordered from postmates here the other night with my Fiance because of the yelp reviews. We definitely tried a wide range of dishes. Burger is their specialty. This place makes some tasty burgers!  Here is what we ordered:  BBB Burger - Tasty! The fact that these burgers are on brioche bread makes them that much better!  Best Damn Bacon Cheeseburger - Very good!  Lone Star Burger - This was the best burger we had! Such great flavor! Onion rings was a great touch!  Original 50/50 - meh, definitely my least favorite.   Tater Tots - Tasty. I like a place that makes some good tots  Sweet potato fries - very good!  Tomato Basil Flatbread - meh. If it had a little bit of sauce would have been much better.    Barbecue pork belly flatbread - really good!  Burgers were pretty tasty. Not the best I've ever had. But still pretty good

04mE-pFxE64e_Yk3MdJPJA.text: The best burgers in town! Honestly, this place is everything. Great food, great service, great atmosphere. Our waitress, Caitlin, was so nice and sweet, very attentive and so knowledgeable about the entire menu. The hubby ordered the 50/50 and I got the limited time vegan shroomin onion...amazing!!!! I'm not even vegan but this burger is legit. They marinade the mushrooms for a day and half. I really want to go back and order another one.  I'm sure we will be regulars here. Watch for us Slaters!

KKYuvV6L3U4-bPirs-449A.text: Freddie our server was knowledgeable funny and made the experience that much better. I highly recommend the vampire dip. It was the beginning to a wonderful meal. You definitely do t leave here hungry

hyVwgPVqNkdDegi3wq0zXA.text: Slater's 50/50 stands for 50% bacon 50% beef.  We ordered the high brow burger with the 50/50 patty and the bison burger.  Both burgers were tasty but nothing too different than other burger places.  What we loved the most was the ahi tuna nachos.  Great portion of nachos with all the toppings.  It was delicious and filling.  Ahi was fresh and flavorful.  Timing was a little off. Served our appetizer and within a few minutes our burgers came out.  Not very happy about that.  Also the Parmesan fries were weird.   They were crusted fries.  Sort of dipped in batter then fried.  And there was this weird garlic paste that wasn't mixed with the fries very well.  Not a fan.  We never got to try the milkshake bc burger fries and nachos were very filling.  For a solid burger  I would come here again.  Nice to see something different pop up.

photos.caption: Photo of Slater's 50/50 - Las Vegas, NV, United States

v3Fske74datcCtFkOsEbuQ.text: I came here over the weekend for a holiday office party and was able to try a few menu items including the original 50/50 burger, vampire dip, buffalo wings, and sangria (I don't drink beer so I can't comment on whether or not they are good but they had a large selection). So I heard from friends that this is a chain that started in California and is known for the burgers being half beef and half ground bacon so of course it sounded delicious! Well I'd have to say when I got my burger I wasn't very impressed. The sunny side egg was still a little undercooked and the burger patty tasted like a frozen patty you find at any grocery store and tasted a little burnt. The fries and the wings were both average but tasted fine, nothing to complain about there. I would say my favorite two things of what I ordered were the sangria and vampire dip. The sangria was strong (I got buzzed off of it after one LOL) but a good balance of a fruity taste as well. The vampire dip was delicious...it's just full of cheesy, garlicky goodness haha. It was so good that I was trying not to fill up on it before my burger came out.   So I have to make one final comment on the service...there was about 50ish people for our party and we had 1 server who was doing the best she could. She got some help here and there from the kitchen staff too so props to her for doing such a good job. I'm sure it's not easy remembering everything for a party so large.   Overall, when it comes to the food, I don't think I'd come back anytime soon because I'd rather get burgers elsewhere but the staff was great!

photos.caption: Photo of Slater's 50/50 - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Original 50/50 Burger
Photo of Slater's 50/50 - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Vampire Dip

4_Lh-N5CDNQOW2A0ho-2Vg.text: Just left, the burgers were amazing, exceeded expectations. The fries were yummy, and so were their homemade sauces.   Why 3 stars? Our server didn't come to our tables for 12-15 minutes. Me being hungry and pregnant, wanted to initially order a Appetizer, and a drink, ( super thirsty) while I looked over the menu. Well he came after I decided what I wanted to eat so I just ordered that and not the Appetizer, didn't apologize for a wait, nothing. Well he didn't even come back to the table during our meal. And when I left I definitely felt like he was throwing some shade! I wish I caught his name, but he was a bald guy, with facial hair. I doooooo want to come back to eat another delicious burger, fingers crossed that the service will be better!

omNSY1x1NYp2aMUCpBJrjw.text: Living down the street and visiting a couple times it's been just ok but what just made me want to be a regular was FREDDIE!!! Vampire dip and mango shandy was out of this world

l5RwQl7TkP1Iw9p_OP8Lyw.text: Slater's 50/50 is a very welcome addition to this area and I am happy to have them! I've been in quite a few times and haven't been disappointed, even though I find that the menu is quite a bit different than what I've experienced at other locations in California.  If you aren't familiar with the concept - the 50/50 means that their burger patties are made with a mixture of half beef and half bacon. It's something to try at least once, but not all of the burgers are made this way, so if you don't like it, you can order something else! I'm a fan of their beer selection, there aren't enough places that serve a decent amount of True craft beer. And it's wonderful to see them carry some local beers as well.  They have a great $10 lunch special and a decent kids menu too. I'm not usually a ketchup fan, but I have tried what they serve with the fries and it's unique and tasty.   The service has always been really friendly. Overall, we've enjoyed our experiences there and look forward to going in for brunch and to get some bottomless mimosas soon.

loTg9R-2swtOn0EkVeYjIg.text: With 6 of us there was nothing shinning to talk about and there was nothing so bad to make us never go back. Couple people ordered well done burgers and still got red patties. There is an ample beer selection if you are drinking. Service was rather slow even though the place was not full

F3pOUZsPyhziVZMjA7548Q.text: Dinner tonight was amazing.. It was good to order off the sheet of choices for a custom 50/50 burger. ( Thank You Management for bringing the option to this location- We have been going to the original location for many years )  The Brussel Sprouts and Mac n Cheese balls were on point.  We had Nicole as our server and she was Awesome - she was always checking on our drinks and food.  The Bacon Lava Cake is incredible!! Slater's  50/50 has  best burger in Las Vegas

12Ow2GaeXnIYAwdZtuvH1w.text: Walked in for a quick to-go lunch with two of my kids the other day for the first time, this place is GREAT! It's totally different than a most other places you go to because it has a theme: bacon . Yum!! We sat down and saw the cool baconsalt salt shakers (yes it's good!) and the cute clipboard menus ... the kids meals my kids really liked but what we all liked the best, and my daughter said made the food taste even better, was the amazing service by our wait staff Kat. She really went above and beyond for us. Since it was our first time, she helped us decide what sauces would be best for the chicken fingers, what we might not like and gave me background info about the restaurant. I will definitely be back and bringing the rest of the family! Thank you, Kat!!

l0O2uQHCUdseUcrqP6HSlw.text: Sorry we didn't try it sooner...great beer selection, good food, nice happy hour and Freddie is one of the best bartenders I've met in a while!!!! Sit at the bar for great service, honest recommendations and good conversation. We'll be back!!!

lQEkxJOQaVzmCExVkKgncA.text: Place was great. The two waitresses and the bar where really friendly. The people at the bar where friendly. Food was great, the pb&j burger was recommended to me and it was amazing and a huge choice of on tap. Definitely will be back.

IEjxTDGXfNfNWO-iH1Crbg.text: This place is awesome!! I'm so glad I finally tried it, I will definitely come back! We had the Ahi Nachos, the Best Damn Cheese Burger, and the Lone Star Smoke Burger. Our waiter Tarek was great! He had some suggestions on our choice of fries (we couldn't decide since there is so many choices!), he was definitely enthusiastic and helpful. We also got to play connect four and ordered the S'mores shake, it's so delicious!!

fe1PlbsOUioFtHdI8fZkjA.text: My girlfriend came in one day to get a quick take out order and we wanted to grab a beer before we left. So we hit the bar to be happily greeted by Freddie. The amount of knowledge this man had on beer was just insane. I saw a beer that looked cool (don't laugh, I'm not a beer guy) and I said I wanted it. He said he would be happy to offer a suggestion of something better. So I thanked him, and took his advice. Got a way better tasting beer (sampled both). His attentiveness to our needs was unmatched, and his personality is very energetic and welcoming. He is the bartender that you wish to find at every bar. This Slater's is better than the other locations across CA. Will definitely return at every opportunity, thank you for a great experience.

UOSiBVG8JieGEeZqN8u_bg.text: I came here opening day and decided to hold off on my review until I visited again after they got settled in..  They did not disappoint!   Service: 5/5 Food: 6/5  The first time I went, it was a packed house with a 30 min wait. Thankfully, we were seated in about 10. I ordered the original 50/50 with regular fries and my boyfriend got the BBB bacon with sweet potato fries. We also tried the pineapple cider on draft and a Stella. Food took about 30-45 min to come out.. that was a huge downer, but it was opening day so I understood. The burgers were incredible! Huge so well worth the money. The best and most unique part were the sauces to the fries. The regular fries come with a bacon ketchup and the sweet potato fries come with a pumpkin cream like sauce. Both are AMAZING and a must try.  Now.. the 2nd time around we were seated immediately and the food came out in less than 15 minutes. This time I decided to try the PB and Jealousy burger. Yes, peanut butter, jelly and VANILLA ICE CREAM on a BURGER. Sounds like a lot of intense flavors in one, but they actually complement each other very well. The best burger I've ever tried and not too sweet as some would think.   Definitely would recommend this place and will be a returning customer :)

9YPISqzVMLnwIHMcXNOC8Q.text: Went in today.  Sat at the bar and was completely ignored by everyone that worked there. Some looked me right in the eye and.... nothing. After being completely ignored for at least another 10 min I got up and left.   Was never even given a menu or a glass of water or anything.  Needless to say I won't be back.   Fix your service

1eIBiXc7nWVzjX_s2eTG8Q.text: This place is great. Excellent selection of beers and an absolutely shocking selection of burgers! I'm a vegetarian and I had the impossible burger 2.0... a must try. Thanks to our awesome friendly server Lisa!!

4RdQP_TMDnmIhcPhmdxE_Q.text: The servers are very friendly and the impossible burger 2.0 is off the charts . Plant based burger with all of the characteristics of a burger and the flavor is amazing . I think it's better than the other burgers . I can't move now !!!! Thank you

BOTqzIb5992_UrXd3VVWTg.text: Good atmosphere and service.  Good burger and fries.  However we got the chops and dip appetizer and it was disgusting.  Like these cheap stale chips and a cup of what tasted like melted velveeta.

dklAriD8OZ7YJB74wLYBXw.text: This place is amazingly delicious! Huge selection of brews and the burgers are bomb.com. Friendly vibe and our server Cait was a blast. Would definitely come back to have a beer, a burger, and catch a knights game

FDDcGuzl5Pr438lAyuZHJA.text: This was a fantastic burger and the. Err isn't bad either. Service was great and Tarek was awesome. Would highly recommend it to anyone that is looking for a great twist on a burger.

Om8sCcw9Alg0TDmm54IV_Q.text: Delicious burgers and the sweet potato and pumpkin dipping sauce us amazeballs !!  Good location and good food.  Thanks !

cN5xUxmbCbQHhQ1zwlS2aw.text: I enjoy eating hear with family for a bite to eat on Sunday night football. The games are on all TVs and the food is awesome! Great selection of beers and servers are informative of all brews. Try the P&J burger with ice-cream my favorite.

CRuG2SmZk7mhm8aFW4_dPQ.text: I'm not entirely sure where to start. The bacon is good. It's bacon, which is difficult to mess up, but good all the same. We started with the Porkapalooza appetizer, and it's not worth it. The bacon was decent, the pork wings were actually great, the pork belly was far too tangy, and the kettle corn and pork rinds were sad little after thoughts that tasted quite stale, as if the bag they'd come from had been left open too long.  The burger itself is... okay. I had the PB+Jealousy, the wife went with the OriginalSlater 50/50 and they weren't bad. But they weren't great either. For the price I was expecting much better - like actual juicy ground beef, not a sad grey patty that had little flavor and looked quite a bit like those pre-formed patties you get at Sams Club. I'd asked for the grilled jalapeno to be added to my burger, and I'm glad I did because the extra spice was nice to have. But I was a little surprised to see I'd been charged a dollar for it when it came time to pay. A bit of warning beforehand would have been nice. That said, I should have expected it considering the $4 can of ginger beer that started the meal off.  Oh, and the fries? Dry and cold. As far as sports bars go, this place is overpriced and under delivers. I doubt we'll be going back.

Fx8fWU5om2WNzm_T_SflUg.text: First impression walking into the restaurant, I was awestruck. You can't look at the different beer tap handles at the entrance and not be impressed by the decor. It's a nice update from the restaurant that was previously in its spot.  I also have to commend the restaurant for having a well-designed menu. Mouthwatering descriptions. Impressive beer list too, and I appreciated how they worked with local breweries, such as my favorite Crafthaus.  Okay, this is where I begin to feel slightly guilty for my 3-star review. The food was just up to par for me, comparing it to other gourmet burger restaurants. Perfectly cooked and constructed burgers, but just up to par. Maybe I held too high of an expectation? Or maybe the service was eating into my meal too?  Service was great going into the experience from the hostess until my fiance sent our server back to the bar 'cause he ordered a Captain & Coke, not a Jack & Coke. Could visibly see the server's body language change, along noticing the less friendly tone of voice when returning to our table afterwards. I'm a fry addict, so the moment he put a couple dirty napkins on the plate, taking away the sweet potato fries as we ordered a second round of drinks, my mood just plummeted. Wanna ask if we're done first?  My fiance would like to give this place another try, so we'll see how that upcoming experience turns out.

xWIuMvZiDH2SAZEQi_rdiQ.text: Amazing food and our waitress Nicole was very friendly and helped us pick the perfect brew

qaxyy_IqNJe7IgQeuQKl6Q.text: Fantastic this food  was great I think that I will bring Family here I had a cheese burger and spinach dip was delicious thanks for good food & will be back for sure

gv0sx9gKICRkHwaNdoGazw.text: Really good food and service.  Go to freddy hes the bartender. Really nice and a great worker.

photos.caption: Photo of Slater's 50/50 - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Had an amazing time at slaters 50/50 the bartender Freddy was a great host and server. I would highly recommend this place!

4fq37QWA_1NC-andfAFAqA.text: Clean restaurant with great beer selection to go with a plethora of burger options!  Food was solid but nothing so great to warrant the extra $2-$5 premium you pay for a burger here. If you've tried most of the other restaurants in the area, then go for it.  But There are plenty of restaurants with great hamburgers for cheaper. Also, while the server was nice, she let us know they were making fresh French fries so it would be a few minutes. After watching her serve other tables their order of fries, we had to wave her down and ask for ours. She had completely forgotten. By the time we got our "fresh" fries, they weren't so fresh anymore. We get it, mistakes happen but when you're paying a premium for a burger, don't forget the fries.

Lw9K0UpGWV8EUPWy9nzwpw.text: Such a down to earth place to go and get a couple drinks. Vampire dip is delicious as well as the loaded fries! Hubby has gotten a couple other items and all have been quite tasty. Will be goin back for date night soon.

2waFoa78SzpZZiBXhkfA1Q.text: Awesome food and very friendly staff. Nice place to relax, eat, and have a good drink! Coat was awesome!!

46G7KDa4SkMzPWMCN8socA.text: What a great experience! We have been to Slater's in San Marcos a few times, and were surprised to see that it was here in Vegas. We went, tonight, and had such a great time. The food was great as usual, the beers were awesome, but it was the people and the service that really make this place so amazing. We were already talking about "we gotta come back here" 30 minutes into us sitting down. Tarek was our server, and he was great. Right on time with everything, super nice, and didn't rush us... and we definitely took our time. David was floating around and was at our table quite a bit. Let me tell you, this guy made our night. Truthfully, even if this place was just ok, I'd come back for him. Such a nice guy, super chill, great energy, and it all just came natural, he wasn't trying at all (he's Hawaiian, so it totally makes sense). Not long after we started talking, he was kicking me samples of beer, talking about our families, sharing pics, all that. Can't say enough about him... He's my kind of guy for sure, and we'll definitely be back to see him, soon.  It's a burger spot, so you can't go wrong with the food. They have so many variations of burgers, but you go for the 50/50 patty... half ground beef, half bacon... amazing. The topping options are awesome (avocado mash, billionaire bacon, bacon ketchup, etc), and the fries are on point. Good ranch too, and that can be hard to find. There's an endless selection of beers, and so many are good, but they're cool about letting you sample some so you can make an informed decision. I could say more, but just go try it out and do yourself a favor!

P7ZVjPQSCy_4sGOrKGgwAg.text: I absolutely love this place! Their service is top notch and the food is to die for. We visit the one in San Diego all the time while on vacation and were so excited to see one open here in Vegas! I got the lone star burger which is basically a bbq burger with onion ring on it. It comes with fries which you can pick regular or sweet potato fries with pumpkin sauce. I HIGHLY RECOMMEND THE PUMPKIN SAUCE! They have a wide selection of beer and cider on tap, this time I got the pineapple cider and it was really good. My husband got the peanut butter dark beer and I'm not usually a dark beer person but it was fantastic! I really wanted dessert because their milkshakes looked amazing but I was way too full to even think about ordering one. Our server Todd was very attentive and friendly offered advice to our friends who had never been to a Slater's before. The restaurant was pretty quite compared to the one in San Diego where you have to use open table to get a reservation or wait an incredibly long time. Also have I mentioned your burgers are 50% bacon and 50% beef? Amazing right?!?

arTeMcEXG2Ho2AlCDf_ZgQ.text: Just moved here from California, and we knew this had to be our first stop! Lisa was so friendly and made us feel like we were in our hometown sports bar. The place is super clean and has an awesome vibe to it. As for the food we did the create your own burger and had SO many options. On top of that they've literally turned bacon into their own food group. Give this place a try you won't be disappointed. But come with a big appetite!

kpe-E_CyZKgumakhLIr1rA.text: I am an avid Slater 50/50 goer in California and it's always been one of my favorite restaurants... So I was beyond excited to see one open in Vegas ! The owner was a really nice genuine person and the service was on par. Everything was actually fantastic and the vampire dip actually came out better than in Cali.  BUT.. I'm giving them 4 stars because my favorite thing about Slater's is the concept of designing your own burger which is a thrill for me since I'm vegetarian. The owner assured me that this will be something they will offer in the future when the cooks get their feet wet. Aside from that, if you haven't checked them out please do..  and order the vampier dip!! I've been making copycat versions during the holidays for years, but never as good as there's.. yum yum.

_SLQ4Op9_V3DylAWQTXWsQ.text: This place is the best!! Love the food and beer! The portions are huge. Nashville hot is my favorite! The boneless wings, pimento cheese fries, and pork belly grilled cheese are amazing! Also, if you can make a request, ask for Freddie! Outstanding server!

cSrf8U6WuAixGHcVcVXesg.text: Genesis was great! She made me feel at home and was very knowledgeable about the food and drink menu. She offered to have me taste a few beers when I was indecisive at the bar. Burger was good as well with all the sides and extras recommended. Definitely will come back as a regular.

photos.caption: Photo of Slater's 50/50 - Las Vegas, NV, United States

WNivPZIhutzogwX18f2SJg.text: Great beer selection and amazing food! Kat and Freddy are the best! Unbelievable service... hands down!

D3669EjfMNQsdbuIcuRTfA.text: My girlfriend surprised me by take me here for the first time yesterday. Great food!  Wide variety of beers to choose from to go with the unique burger combinations. We sat at the bar and was taken care of by Kat. She was super friendly and made our first time memorable. It happened to be my birthday dinner. We'll be back for sure!

photos.caption: Photo of Slater's 50/50 - Las Vegas, NV, United States

2aMyl5muVxqNxrjegqQKOQ.text: Food was great.   Good value.  Quick service.  Good for kids, not super packed for lunch.  Diane was our server and did an amazing job.

3Mr3lh-4oavY6iXKelulIg.text: A good friend of mine recommended this place. I love bacon, so it was a no brainer! I got The Best Damn Burger! No really... that's the name. Super yummy. The sweet potato fries with pumpkin sauce.  Amazing! Our waitress Lisa, was the happiest sober person I've ever met. Super attentive and a great waitress all the way around. We'll be back!!!

X3aMcnJuKJBU2-CJ_Zc94A.text: This place is a real hidden gem. Their beer selection is unmatched around this area. I recently went here to eat with my girlfriend and our waiter Alex was great. We were unsure of what beer to have since their selection was extensive, so Alex brought up a bunch of small samples to choose from. It was a great experience. Later on in our meal, Dave who I believe to be the owner, came to our table to check to see how everything was going. Our services here was hands down amazing, not to mention all the beers were on point. The food was good to but not sure if my diet will allow me to eat here as much as I want to. Definitely will be back here for the beers.

BCdL19nJvJonF0DaEJ7-SA.text: What happened within a few weeks?? We went there for lunch and they only had 2 people waiting on tables. It took a long time for drinks and getting refills. The Original was NOT as good as our last visit. It was too charred on the outside and not fully cooked in the inside. Also, the bacon ketchup was NOT the same. It tasted like marinara sauce. So disappointing! We drove across town to come here for lunch.

photos.caption: Photo of Slater's 50/50 - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Slater's 50/50 - Las Vegas, NV, United States

SqoxFmEHmahwUNSY6os23A.text: I'm not a big "burger" eater, in fact I could count the number of the times that I've eaten one in the past year. Usually I'll splurge if we go to In n Out but that's about the only place I have found worth it. Until now. Omg this place blows In n Out wayyyy out of the water (and I actually feel kinda bad saying that). Their bacon burger and their bison burger are SO good. Add in their amazing fries and bacon ketchup....it's a done deal. Wayyyy worth the money (and calories), this place is like bacon burger heaven. So. Good. And the beer was tasty too. Until we meet again Slater's. Until we meet again......

vS1V2XIVE-VwHWzIDxLXxA.text: It's Friday night, went to a couple of places to grab a bite to eat but they were packed. On the way home we remember this place so we stopped by to check it out. We walked in and were seated right away (Also ready to watch the VGK game which was starting). Our waiter (Alex) was extremely friendly and attentive. He asked if we had been there before. We explained it was our first time so he explained a little about the menu. We showed him a coupon for a buy 1 get 1 free appetizer. He recommended the Vampire Dip. We got that and the Bacon Sampler. Both were down right amazing. We then ordered a couple of burgers (Lone Star/PB and Jelly). Wow... Honestly I don't really care to do reviews on Yelp unless the experience was really great or really poor but this place was a home run. The Exec Chef (Andy) stopped by and made conversation and checked on how we liked the food. So bottom line is the atmosphere was great, the staff was excellent and the food exceptional. If you read the other reviews, they gave lesser stars due to the price but you get what you pay for. Yes, there are cheaper places to grab a good burger but I would put them at a reasonable price for the quality and taste of their food. If you're like me and get coupons for all kinds of places in the mail, save this one and go check it out.

photos.caption: Photo of Slater's 50/50 - Las Vegas, NV, United States. PB and Jelly Burger... Sounds weird but probably one of the best burgers I&#39;ve had...
Photo of Slater's 50/50 - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Vampire Dip
Photo of Slater's 50/50 - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bacon Sampler

ZND-lckqbR7ILFq0y7XnPw.text: Todd was our server and it was my birthday celebration with a party of 6. We had apps, all you can drink mimosas and entrees. The Porkapalooza platter was excellent as was the frickles! The burgers were all delicious! We challenged him in keeping the mimosas full lol! He never complained and was pleasant throughout the whole meal! This restaurant is great and the staff rocks!

KagZbyRBONWCOiH_6FEHxw.text: The only thing good about our last visit was the mango shandy, we happen to be close and decided to run in to get one. It was close to closing, we went right into the bar and Freddy was AMAZING! 5 stars for his customer service!!! He came over smiling, sweet, great energy, got our drinks, the mango shandy was delicious, chatted for a quick second and we left. He is the only reason we would go back and give this place another try.

CMJa_W_FQdkVEMpZzzNRNA.text: Nice looking restaurant! Great beer selection! Food mediocre at best! We had the tuna nacho to start. You can tell tuna was frozen. Nacho itself disappointing! Don't know why you would fry hominy and put it in nachos? Almost broke my tooth! Then I had the mozzarella flat bread disappointing! Bread was not crispy at all chew and tough! My wife and daughter had burgers. Sad to say that jack n the box has better burger? Sorry! Very disappointing they missed the mark!

photos.caption: Photo of Slater's 50/50 - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The taps!

d9AcLI-dj2C6qYCguw021Q.text: Excellent food and service! Glad that this side of town is seeing a boom of exciting new restaurants. Loved the bison & bacon burger, a must try specially if your in the mood for a flavor slap to the face! Thank you Todd for being patient and exceeding the service standard. Until next time!!!

4IRQ6gFWOewiF32CQDc_xQ.text: I was So Excited to see that one of my Favorite Cali Burger spots has landed in Las Vegas! I was equally as excited to see that the quality of the food was still as good as I remember. Our server Bailey was extremely personable and downright awesome! She let us know that our favorite build your own Burger feature will be debuting October 2018. As soon as I sat down and got comfortable I made sure I sent messages to all of the fellas that we had a new spot to hang, eat good and watch the games. So no matter what season of sports we are in, Bailey and the rest of the Slater's Gang better be ready for our appetites and our thirst and love for beer! See y'all soon...

bTpT19WDXv_6e8tvwRKvJQ.text: Love this place! The manager David is super friendly and knowledgeable with the menu. Went here for a date night for the 1st time with my husband and we were treated as if we were some VIPs. We tried several different samples of beer and we were educated by David on each one.  We had such a great experience that I decided to make a reservation here for my good friends bachelorette dinner. again we were all treated so kind by David and the staff. Definitely a great place, great food, and awesome staff! Highly recommend!!!

iWOkKdUhMUTxSpHTghiLZA.text: I had a great experience at Slater's 50/50. My guests and I had the 50 Alarm burger, 555  Bacon burger and the original 50/50. All three burgers were delicious & flavorful. Raina was our waitress and she was wonderful. David the manager brought us some sample beers which were very tasty, David was very nice & welcoming. The service was good. I will definitely will be returning.

h5rLuNODsnmNo93ENSBEAg.text: very interesting food, staff was very nice I would recommend it to anybody, has a very different menu if you want to try something different.

4EZ5HtDjyaW0GMNYObNauQ.text: This is the best burger place I have tried in Vegas! I am very impressed with how good the food was when they only opened 5 days ago - usually it takes a while for restaurants to get all the kinks worked out. I had the PB & Jealousy - the bartender, Jeff made me try it with the scoop of ice cream and it was a game changer!

EVoza00TysBtdi-GbShR0Q.text: Jeff was awesome! The service and food was so good! We will definitely be back! We highly recommend the sweet potato fries and pumpkin spice dip

Ii-9MBU55ll0j3HUnFONsQ.text: Holy cow!!! Or should I say holy bacon!?! This place was an amazing find. We both got the BBB Burger made with 1/2 beef and 1/2 bacon, topped with bacon, cheese and egg. Absolutely incredible burger. The porkapolooza was awesome as well as the Siracha Thai wings. I can't say enough about this place. The King shake at the end just topped off a perfect meal that hit the spot. Our server Marisa was great.. very friendly and informative. We enjoyed chatting with her. We will definitely come back and recommend this place to everyone.

QRR-wUvpz77KQla9mtZcLA.text: Great food and great service, we will be back enjoyed it!  We recommend this place if you are looking for a tasty hamburger and cold beer

T28YeZmzL1hFBBVGUPQHRw.text: The food here is amazing!!!!!! ALL of the servers checked on us and one in particular named Tarek was so awesome. He recommended great menu choices cooked to perfection and our liking. Atmosphere is a homely sports theme and the service is so quick and friendly!!! We will be here a few times a month easily!!! Same amazing service every time.

mR-e5gquzH70wlD0zoh5RA.text: Really flavorful food! Pork-a-palooza app delicious & great for a group. Possibly best Brussels sprouts I've ever had & "schmanimal" fries so good. Lexi our server was friendly & fun & kept our water and beer glasses full. Will definitely be back!!

iEomOmHy2adgr1VgxwjWsg.text: Excellent food and really different. If you like bacon this is the place for you. Large servings and good service make this the place to go!

LkIVweRByd1eFwoFC_MJ3w.text: Probably the best Oreo Milkshake I've ever had! (& I've had plenty to compare). The food arrived quickly & service was great. Lisa was phenomenal as well! Will definitely return.

H3NWJciQzcV0-EIgT9DS4A.text: First time at the Las Vegas location great food great staff.. fast service great lunch specials..and great beer selection.will be returning again in the near future

QaBuRg3ZhJ6ZCQgqiRpD5Q.text: The food amazing !!! The beer glasses could be bigger. The milkshakes are so good must try place!

UuPaNEfSvHqDa6U7CtSMAw.text: Very attentive and friendly service from Tirone. Burgers tasted good and great beer selection as well. Will go back.

uysJ7EFFk5mcG0bQWOsXWQ.text: This burger place has serious potential to dethrone any of the top spots in town. And the thing that will probably make that happen is the GREAT service. They beat many places w their service.  From hostess to server (Nicole-5 stars) to even the manager (David- 5 stars)...they ALL were knowledgeable and professional and had an overall attitude like they were all happy to do what they do.  There are enough beers on tap from staple brands to new local surprises to make me want to come back.  The sweet potato fries are the best I've ever had...period. Definitely a place to hang w friends. This place will probably be a great place in hockey season. Do yourself a favor and check it out

F8cjat3z1YsB0CP_raCMow.text: Second time here since they opened and it is great. The burgers are legit and they even offer gluten free buns. Nice beer list, if pretty standard offerings. Make sure you ask to sit in Raina's section because she is absolutely delightful and provides excellent service. Treat yourself and order the Pork A Palooza!

m-0P4QNmB1ko9sS4P1zJOw.text: I had the Sriracha burger and it was AMAZING! The candy shop shake would make anyone feel like a kid in a candy store and it had some of my favorite candies incorporated into it. The manager and staff were incredibly nice. Overall Slater's is a new favorite place of mine!

t8Kb8SoF1NsrYWxHL1CWCQ.text: Totally loved it! My son and his girlfriend took me and I was skeptical at first because the food looked different. We sat in the bar and right away we're greeted by Jeff, he was awesome! And he got us to try foods we normally wouldn't. It was amazing! Had the 50/50 sloppy joe sliders and loved them. Definitely coming back here!

C2U0fdjCOCmOZYB65tni4A.text: Great food and Melissa the bartender was amazing!!!! We had a peanut butter/jelly burger and a bacon wrapped hot dog!! Michigan beers on tap!!!!

4zNjF7B1utQSruKjqkWG0Q.text: Awesome new restaurant and Lisa (our server) made our night! We will keep coming for the good food, craft beers, and excellent service! Keep it up Slater's!

pWlGfixUT8SGTmpw1SioeQ.text: Dined in tonight. Lisa introduced us to the beer menu and we decided on local craft beers and mac and cheese balls. Beers came out and the food soon after. We ordered two burgers and fries with beer cheese. Everything was delicious and our sever Lisa was outstanding.
